loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos is a farmer and raises dairy cows. He sells their milk to a company called PIL Andina, an industrial milk plant. He lives in the community of Ancocagua in the sector of Laja, about 3 1/2 hours from La Paz, with his wife and three children ages 17, 13, and 10. He also works as a doorman at the technical institute which is located in their community. This loan will be used to buy a good cow and increase the production of milk to sell. It will be his first loan with Impro, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the money.

Santos es agricultor y también cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la Comunidad de Ancocagua sector Laja a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz., junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 17, 13, y 10 años respectivamente. También se desempeña como portero del Instituto Normal Técnico que se encuentra en la misma comunidad. El crédito lo destinara para la compra una vaca lechera de raza mejorada para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A MILK COW AND CONTINUE TO GROW THE BUSINESS

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro is a farmer who raises dairy cows and sells the milk to the industrial milk plant called PIL Andina. He lives in the community of Ancocagua in the sector of Laja, about 3 1/2 hours outside of La Paz with his wife and three children ages 22, 20 and 19. His family helps him carry out the daily activities. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow to produce more milk to sell. This is his first loan with Impro, and his evaluation shows that he is qualified to receive the money.

Pedro es agricultor y también cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la Comunidad de Ancocagua sector Laja a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz., junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 22, 20, y 19 años respectivamente, quienes le colaboran en el desempeño de sus actividades diarias. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y asi incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A DAIRY COW

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is a farmer who raises dairy cows and sells the milk to the industrial milk plant called PIL Andina. She lives with her parents and brothers in the community of Ancocagua, about 3 1/2 hours outside of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy a good dairy cow so she sell more milk and meet the demands of PIL Andina. This is the first loan with Impro, and her evaluation shows that she is qualified to receive the money.

Maria es agricultora y también cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la Comunidad de Ancocagua sector Laja a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz.. Es soltera vive junto a sus padres y hermanos. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mejorada y así incrementar la producción de leche y satisfacer la demanda de PIL ANDINA. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A DAIRY COW

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her clothes stock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria lives in the city of El Alto in the zone called Rio Seco, with her husband and five children ages 20, 18, 15, 13, and 10. Her husband works for the city of La Paz. Victoria is the owner of a small shop where she offers photocopying services. The loan will be used to repair the photocopy machine. This is her first loan with Impro and her evaluation shows that she is qualified to receive the funds.

Victoria vive en la calle Julián Apaza de la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos de 20,18,15,13,10 años respectivamente. Su esposo trabaja como empleado publico en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de repuestos para la reparación de fotocopiadora, pues ella es dueña de una pequeña tienda donde presta este servicio de fotocopias. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO REPAIR THE PHOTOCOPY MACHINE SHE HAS IN HER SMALL SHOP

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro M. Larrea lives with his wife and their thirteen-year-old son in Villeta, Paraguay. Together they run a small wooden stand from which they sell fast local-food favorites, such as empanadas, sandwiches, and milanese. They have had this stand for eleven years. A year ago, they began working with the Fundación Paraguaya, which utilizes programs like Kiva to give mico-financing to small business owners like Pedro and his wife.

Since their first loan, they have been able to paint their stand. Though otherwise a small achievement, paint is quite expensive, and the loan has allowed them to accomplish this without making sacrifices that would hurt business. In their newly-refurbished stand, they are doing better than ever. However, the couple tells us that they must get up at 3am daily in order to commute into the city and stock their stand. They are forced to shop in the nearby supermarket, though slightly more expensive, because it is the only store open at that hour. Additionally, all merchandise must be carried to the store for lack of other transportation.

In the future, Pedro and his wife would like to buy a van. The van will allow them to transport their goods with greater ease and purchase more at one time. Also, they want to start a delivery route. As he continues to improve his business and his life, Pedro tells us that his dream is to open a store closer to his home and to earn enough money to ensure the education of his son. It is important to Pedro and his wife that he have the opportunity to become a professional and not have to sacrifice as they do.

The money will go toward purchasing flour, eggs, meat, and drinks.

loans.use: The money will go toward purchasing flour, eggs, meat, and drinks.

loans.name: Sunkari

texts.en: Sunkari M. is twenty-eight years old and married with three children.  She started her business six years ago on a very small scale. In 2005, she joined SMT, and has so far obtained loans three times.  Sunkari expanded her business by including the sale of millet, pigeon peas, wheat flour and spices.  Her husband helps her purchase the items either in Freetown or from farmers in various villages.  Sunkari will complete her current loan repayments in December and would like to take more loans to expand her business.   She is therefore requesting a $300 loan.

loans.use: Expansion of her market stall by purchasing additional food stock

loans.name: Iye

texts.en: Iye M. is 55 years old with six children, two of whom are married. She sells palm oil, vegetables, salt and sugar. Iye is also an herbalist. She treats people with malaria, diarrhea and other minor ailments. With her previous loans, she was able to expand her business and can now sell palm oil to other retail traders in Kabala town. She is requesting a loan of $300 to expand her business and to purchase 50 more gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: Purchase additional palm oil to meet business demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock and buy a deep freezer

loans.name: Amelia Antonia

texts.es:
Doña Amelia R. is 50 years old, is originally from Bluefields, is single, and has two sons who are high school students. For the past 20 years she has worked selling pork and beef nacatamales Thursdays through Sundays every week. Mrs. Amelia is very well known in the neighborhood where she lives because of the years she has been working this business. However, because of lack of resources, her nacatamales sell very quickly because she prepares only small quantities. For this reason, Mrs. Amelia needs a loan to be able to buy the materials to prepare her product and sell it in larger quantities that will allow her to make a larger profit.
The large pot costs US$48.00; an industrial stove costs US$60.00; a pound of beef, US$0.70; a pound of pork, US$1.20; a sack of carbon, US$4.00 each, and a quintal (~100 lbs.) of corn costs US$ 22.00 each

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer
Doña Amelia R. tiene 50 años de edad, es originaria de Bluefields, es soltera tiene dos hijos ambos estudian en secundaria. Se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de nacatamales de cerdo y de res,negocio que realiza desde el dia Jueves hasta el Domingo de cada semana. La señora Amelia es bastante conocida en el barrio donde habita por los años que se ha dedicado a este negocio, sin embargo por la falta de recursos sus nacatamales se venden rapidamente ya que la cantidad que prepara es poca. Por tal razon es que necesita un financiamiento para poder comprar los insumos para la elaboracion de su producto y poder vender mayor cantidad que le permita tener mas ganancia.
El caldero grande le cuesta US$ 48.00 dolares, un fogonero industrial esta valorado en US$ 60.00 dolares, una libra de carne de res la compra en US$ 0.70 dolares, una libra de carne de cerdo cuesta US$ 1.20 dolares, un saco de carbon esta valorado en US$ 4.00 dolares cada uno y un quintal de maiz cuesta US$ 22.00 dolares cada quintal.

loans.use: To buy a large pot, an industrial stove, 50 lbs. of chicken, 50lbs. of pork meat, 8 sacksof coal, and 200 lbs. of corn.

payments.comment: La Sra. Reyes pago 25.08 dólares que es su cuota real
Pago el dia 22 de febrero del 2008 no fue reportado por falta de fluido electrico.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 25.08 dólares.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
The Sante Yalla Cooperative is a microfinance group with twenty members dedicated to raising poultry and other activities. The women of the group find that demand outstrips their output, so they are asking for a loan to support their enterprise and meet market demand. This loan will be serviced by all the members in turn and they will reinvest their profits to continue raising poultry without outside financing.

Translated by Alexis Hult, Kiva volunteer.

Le GIE Sante Yalla est une structure qui est déjà fonctionnelle et fait de l aviculture entre autre activités .Elle a subit une formation en ce sens. Elle déroule un projet avicole mais la demande excède de loin son offre. C’est dans ce contexte que nous sollicitons un prêt au près de vous pour pouvoir renforcer notre activité et améliorer notre rendement afin de faire face qu exigence du marche .La gestion est commune et l’entretien se fait a tour de rôle. Les bénéfices sont réinvestit jusqu’a l’obtention d’un fonds propre nous permettant de travailler sans prêt.

loans.use: To buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock and rebuild his stall

loans.name: Valentina Paulino

texts.en:
Valentina is married and has three children, two boys and a girl, each a year apart at fourteen, fifteen, and sixteen years old. While her children are at school, Valentina’s house becomes a neighborhood beauty salon. Valentina sells an assortment of shampoos, perfumes, hairbrushes, and other styling products for the makeovers her clients receive in her home.

Valentina has operated her business for one year but had no access to capital before now and was not certain that investing in her business was a viable option. She plans on using her loan to offer new and varied styling and beauty products, particularly fashionable hair accessories. Valentine hopes that she will one day own a “modern salon” where she can accommodate dozens of customers with a full-service staff.

loans.use: Purchase of new beauty products

loans.name: Gerson Abraham

texts.es:
Ever since he was a child, Gerson felt a great passion for music. In spite of his financial limitations, he focused all his efforts in learning everything possible about this field that makes him so passionate, and he has currently put all his talent in his musical group, Latidos (heartbeats). He is the vocalist of his group and he also plays some instruments in their presentations. In addition, because their presentations are not continuous, he sells CDs and CDs in a stand he rents in the market with most traffic in his beloved hometown. He does these things with the goal of offering an adequate quality of life to his three children whom he loves very much. His hope is to buy better musical instruments for his group, to be able to improve the sound quality in their presentations, as well as increasing the number of presentations. He also wants to invest in his small sales stand at the market, for which he requests help from your generous heart. Let's help Gerson reach the stars with his warm tropical songs. He hopes you can help.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Gerson, desde niño siempre sintió una gran pasión por la música, a pesar de sus limitaciones económicas puso todo su empeño para aprender al máximo todo lo referente a este género que lo apasiona mucho y actualmente ha plasmado todo su talento con su agrupación, Latidos.Él es el vocalista de su agrupación y también toca algunos instrumentos en las presentaciones que tiene, adicionalmente y debido a que las presentaciones no son continuas vende CDS y CDS, en un puesto que alquila en el mercado de mayor concurrencia de su querida ciudad. Estas actividades las realiza con el afán de brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a sus tres hijos que ama mucho. Su anhelo es comprar mejores instrumentos musicales para su agrupación y así poder mejorar la calidad de sonido en sus presentaciones y el número de éstas; así también desea invertir en su pequeño negocio de ventas en el mercado; por lo que solicita la ayuda de vuestro generoso corazón. Ayudemos a que Gerson logre alcanzar las estrellas con sus acaloradas canciones tropicales y usted lo puede ayudar, él lo espera.

loans.use: Buying musical instruments and investing in his small stand at the market. (Compra de instrumentos musicales e inyección de capital para el pequeño espacio de ventas.)

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
The micro-entrepreneur, Sofia E. P., is 66 years old. She is mother to 11 children, all adults. She is a widow and lives with two of her children. For the last three years she has worked selling a variety of clothes of all kinds. With this business she is able to support herself, since at her age she cannot get any other type of job. Mrs. Sofia, at her age, is a happy and likeable person. This characteristic allows her to attend to her clients with a good sense of humor, which makes many people prefer to buy clothes from her business. However, our micro-entrepreneur needs to have some minimum conditions to offer to her clients and to be able to promote her products. This is why she requires a loan to be able to buy a display cabinet, a clothes rack and clothes hangers. The cabinet costs US $202.00, the rack costs US $91, and the clothes hangers cost $US 1.4 per dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La microempresaria Sofia E. P. tiene 66 años de edad, es madre de 11 hijos todos adultos, es viuda y vive con dos de sus hijos. Se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de ropa variada para todos los gustos y con este negocio puede mantenerse ya que a su edad no puede conseguir otro tipo de trabajo. Doña Sofia a su edad es una persona alegre y carismatica lo cual le permite atender a sus clientes con un buen sentido de humor por lo que muchas personas prefieren comprar en su negocio. Sin embargo nuestra microempresaria necesita tener algunas condiciones minimas que le permita darle condiciones a sus clientes y poder publicitar sus productos. Por lo que necesita un financiamiento para poder comprar una vitrina, un perchero y unas perchas. La vitrina le cuesta US$ 202.00 dolares, el perchero se cotiza en US$ 91 dolares y la docena de perchas en US$ 1.4 dolares cada docena.

loans.use: Buying a small display cabinet, a hanging rack, and 5 dozen clothes hangers. (Comprar una vitrina mediana, 1 perchero y 5 docenas de perchas.)

payments.comment: Pago el dia 22 de febrero del 2008 no se habia reportado por falta de fluido electrico.

loans.name: Paula Torrez

texts.en:
Paula is a single mom with four children, three boys and a girl, whose ages range from five to seventeen years old. Paula serves traditional Dominican dishes in her home, where neighborhood customers enjoy them. Her homemade meals include arepa - cornmeal cakes; abichuela - a combination of beans, vegetables, and pork; and an assortment of other local dishes.

Paula produces some of the ingredients for her cuisine at home, but others, including many of the vegetables found in her meals, she buys from nearby markets. Paula plans on using her loan to increase her inventory and serve more customers. Someday Paula envisions operating a restaurant that is a focal point of her community, where customers can enjoy her home-cooked meals alongside friends and family.

loans.use: Purchase of more fruits, vegetables, meat, and other ingredients

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is 43 years old and lives with her husband and children on Guaman de Ayala Street in the area of Villa Nuevo Potosí in the city of La Paz. She dedicates herself to business and runs a grocery store from her home. In addition, she studied hairdressing and also occupies herself with this activity on Saturdays and Sundays. The requested loan will be used to increase her store's inventory and thus, offer her customers a variety of products. This is her first time with IMPRO. This is also her first loan and a completed credit evaluation qualifies her for one.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nancy tiene 43 años de edad y vive en la calle Guaman de Ayala de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La paz con su esposo y sus hijos; ella se dedica al comercio y tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su mismo domicilio de la cual genera sus ingresos, pero además estudio peinados y también con esta actividad trabaja los días sábados y domingos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su mercadería de la tienda y así ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes. No tiene antecedente con IMPRO; este será su primer crédito y la evaluación socio-económica la califica para poder acceder a uno.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her store's inventory

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is thirty-seven years old and a single mom of three children who are thirteen, sixteen, and twenty-one years old. Andrea’s two boys and one girl help Mom manage the general store she operates from the family’s home.

Andrea explains that her business is her life and that she enjoys sharing the venture with her children. Her store supplies many cooking products Andrea purchases from other communities or has delivered by vendors. Andrea’s store stocks rice, a variety of locally purchased vegetables, snacks, and a few soft drinks. Andrea intends to uses her loan to purchase some new products she believes will be well-received by her customers, including more popular snack products and a wider variety of cooking ingredients, such as sugar and bread.

loans.use: Purchase of new products, including snacks and cooking ingredients

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Senora Casilda is 66 years old and lives in the district of La Peca, in the province of Bagua in Amazonas. She is part of the group called Mientras Tanto Las Rositas. She sells vegetables, groceries and every day items in her small general store. She began her business to increase her income, and because there was no other store close by in her neighborhood.

Her business is growing every day, enabling her to cover her needs and those of her family, as well as continue to invest in her business. Her goal is to grow her business, expand the stock she carries to incluD. gifts and other items, and in this way become a serious business woman. She agrees to repay the loan in 4 months, and will use it to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, sodas, sweets, etc. Her customers are the people who live in Bagua and the surrounding areas, especially her neighbors.

La señora Casilda tiene 66 años, conviviente, vive en el distrito D. La Peca, Provincia D. Bagua, en el Departamento D. Amazonas, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rositas. Se dedica a la venta D. Abarrotes, verduras, artículos D. primera necesidad en general, inició su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y porque por su barrio no había una tienda cerca. Su negocio está creciendo cada vez más, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades y las D. su familia, además seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio, ampliar en lo que es mercería, regalos y otros, D. esa manera convertirse en una mujer D. negocios. El reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000.00 ($ 333.00 aprox.), que lo cancelará en 4 meses, servirá para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros. AtienD. al público en general que residen en Bagua y alrededores, especialmente a los vecinos D. su barrio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE EVERY DAY ITEMS TO STOCK HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es:
Gualberto works at parties and social events since he has contracts to provide food catering services like buffets and hors d'oeuvre. He lives in the area around Sopocachi and in his godmother's house since she also helps him prepare food. This is the first time he requests a loan, which will be used to pay his rent in Infocal and finish his culinary studies. His employment and experience qualify him for this loan. The income from his business will be used to pay back the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Gualberto trabaja con eventos de fiestas ya que recibe contratos para prepara comida buffet y bocaditos para todo acontecimiento social. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Sopocachi y es la casa de su madrina ya que con ella trabaja con el negocio de la comida. Es primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para pago de pensiones en Infocal y así culminar sus estudios como chef. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: finish his culinary studies

loans.name: Daysi Leticia

texts.es:
Daysi Leticia is 39 years old and lives in the district of La Peca, in the proviince of Bagua in Amazonas. She works selling everyday grocery items from her small general store. She began her business to increase her family's income, and because she likes working and not having to depend financially on her husband. Her business is growing day after day, enabling her to cover her family's needs and continue investing in the business. Her goal is to grow her business and start a new venture renting rooms, becoming an enterprising business woman. The loan will be paid back in 6 months, and will be used to buy rice, oil, sugar, as well as expand her stock for Christmas to include clothing for adults and children. She serves customers who live in Bagua and the surrounding areas.

La señora Daysi Leticia tiene 39 años, conviviente, vive en el distrito de La Peca, Provincia de Bagua, en el Departamento de Amazonas, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Corazón de Jesús. Se dedica a la Venta de Abarrotes y mercería. Inició su negocio para mejorar los ingresos de su familia, porque le gusta el negocio y también para no depender económicamente del esposo. Su negocio está creciendo día a día, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades y de su familia, además de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio e iniciar el negocio de alquiler de habitaciones y así convertirse en una mujer emprendedora. El reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000.00 ($ 333.00 aprox.), el cual cancelará en 6 cuotas, le servirá para comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar y además, aumentará sus productos para la campaña navideña (ropa para adultos y niños. Atiende al público en general que residen en Bagua y alrededores.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY ADDITIONAL STOCK FOR HER GENERAL STORE AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Juan J.

texts.es:
Client history: Juan Jose works as a taxi driver for the sindicato avora [avora syndicate] where he works the route Tembladerani to Achachicala. His home is located in the zone of alto san pedro in the city of La Paz. It is the third time that he requests a loan; his previous loan history qualifies him as a No. 1 client, which means he is a client with outstanding repayment history. The amount requested will be used for the full maintenance of his vehicle and to buy a new car engine. His work coupled with his experience as a driver allows him to repay the credit; additionally, he has been working with the syndicate for 10 years.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Juan Jose trabaja como chofer en el sindicato avaroa - trufi #5 con los tramos de Tembladerani hasta Achachicala (esa es su ruta). Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de alto san pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Tercera vez que solicita un crédito Su antecedente crediticio lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo y la compra de motor. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como chofer además que el sindicato al que pertenece esta fortalecido pues trabaja más de 10 años.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and to buy a new car engine

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia is 32 years old and lives with her husband in the district of La Peca, in the province of Bagua in Amazonas. She works selling every day grocery items and fresh vegetables. She began her business to increase her income so that she would not be financially dependent on her husband. Her business is growing faster every day, enabling her to cover her needs and those of her family, while still continuing to invest in the business. Her goal is to continue to grow the business, expanding and opening another location and becoming a serious business woman. The loan will be paid back in 6 months, and will be used to by rice, sugar, oil and other items. She serves customers who live in Bagua and the surrounding areas.

La señora Herminia tiene 32 años, conviviente, vive en el distrito de La Peca, Provincia de Bagua, en el Departamento de Amazonas, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Corazón de Jesús. Se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes y verduras. Inició su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y también para no depender económicamente del esposo. Su negocio esta creciendo cada vez más, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades y de las de su familia, además seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, ampliar y abrir otro local en la parada (ubicada en la misma localidad) y de esa manera convertirse en una mujer empresaria. Su reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 800.00 ($ 266.00 aprox.), que será cancelado en 6 meses, le servirá para comprar arroz, azúcar y aceite, entre otros. Atiende al público en general que residen en Bagua y alrededores.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Rosa Ela

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Elia is 31 years old, married under common law, lives in the Bagua Grande district, Utcumbamba province, in the Amazonas Department, and belongs to the Mientras Tanto group Virgen de las Mercedes. She runs a general store. She started her business to gain independence from her husband and improve her family's income.

The business is growing more and more, which allows her to cover her own needs and those of her family. She also invests in the business and saves for her children's education.

Her goal is to make her business grow, expand it, and become a business woman.

The loan recently given by Manuela Ramos for S/. 700.00 (US$233.00 approx.) which will be paid in 4 months, will serve to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, sweets, and sodas. Her store serves the people who live in Bagua Grande, especially the people in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rosa Ela tiene 31 años, conviviente, vive en el distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia de Utcubamba, en el Departamento de Amazonas, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Virgen de las Mercedes. Se dedica a la Venta de Abarrotes. Inició su negocio para independizarse económicamente del esposo y mejorar los ingresos de su familia.

El negocio está creciendo cada vez más, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades de ella y las de su familia, también invierte en el negocio y ahorra para la educación de sus hijos.

Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, ampliarlo y convertirse en una mujer de negocios.

El reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 700.00 ($ 233.00 aprox.), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, servirá para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, golosinas y gaseosas. Atiende al público en general que residen en Bagua Grande, especialmente a los vecinos de su barrio.

loans.use: Buying assorted merchandise for general store.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith always knew what she wanted to be as a grown-up, and now dedicated to cosmetology, her great passion is obvious to all her clients who recognize the quality of her hands, her great creativity and her diligence. Her dream is to own her own beauty salon, dream which has been postponed many times as her home is very young and many things are needed there. She has a three-year-old daughter who she adores and therefore she and her husband make a special effort in each of their activities. Edith’s plan is to buy, little by little, the material she will need for her beauty salon and that way save money to be able to purchase her own business in a short time. She is asking for funds so she, together with her family, can plan how to reach her goal. Please help this young woman to turn her business into a beauty center with an outstanding attention for all the ladies of Pichanaqui. We hope to count on the support coming from your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Edith, siempre supo lo que quería ser de grande y ahora convertida en una cosmetóloga, muestra su gran pasión por esta actividad con todas sus clientas, quiénes reconocen la calidad de sus manos, su gran creatividad y su diligencia.Su sueño es tener en algún momento su salón de belleza propio, sueño que ha tenido que postergar muchas veces debido a que su hogar es muy joven por lo que requieren de muchas cosas.Tiene una pequeña niña de tres años a la cual adora y por quién se esfuerza junto a su esposo en cada una de las actividades que desempeñan.Su plan es comprar poco a poco algunas cosas para su pequeño espacio de belleza y así ahorrar para adquirir su local propio en poco tiempo, razón por la que solicita una suma de dinero en calidad de préstamo que le permitirá empezar a estructurar estas metas junto a su familia. Ayude a esta soñadora mujer que quiere hacer de su negocio un centro de belleza con un servicio espectacular para todas las damas de Pichanaqui, esperamos también pueda contar con la ayuda de su noble corazón

loans.use: Purchase material for a beauty salon in order to offer better attention to the clients.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Mrs. Viviana lives in her own house in the area of Pasankeri ladera oeste of the City La Paz with her husband and her three sons; Mrs. Viviana works as a store clerk for a clothing store. With the loans that she previously received she fixed four of the rooms in her house and installed a fence in the front of her house. This new credit will be used to fix the interior walls and structure of her house. This is the third time that she is asking for a loan and the credit analysis performed shows that she is a favorable candidate and that she should be capable of repaying this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Viviana vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y su tres hijos, la señora Viviana trabaja como empleada en una tienda de venta de ropa. Con los créditos anteriores realizaron la refacción de cuatro habitaciones y el amurallado frontal de su vivienda. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de su vivienda en estructura y muros interiores. Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To fix the interior walls and structure of her house

loans.name: Ines Maria

texts.en:
Ines is forty-five years old, and she and her husband have five children, including four girls. Her husband is a truck driver and Ines sells cooking provisions throughout her neighborhood. Ines travels the main road in her community wheeling a cart full of fruits, vegetables, and other cooking supplies.

Ines plans on using her loan to purchase a small flatbed truck for use in both transporting and dispensing her goods. Also, she plans to increase her inventory of products, purchasing more of the potatoes and onions that are sought by her customers. Ines believes those investments will be a big step in ensuring her business’s continued growth and the well-being of her family.

loans.use: Purchase of a small flatbed truck for transporting fruits and vegetables

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Rosa is 54 years old, married, she lives in the District of Bagua GranD. in the Province of Utcubamba, Departament of Amazonas and belongs to the group “Grupo Mientras Tanto Virgen D. las Mercedes.” She is dedicated to selling groceries and started her business to increase the family income and because she enjoys this activity.

Her business is growing day by day and allows her to cover the family expenses and invest in her business..

Her goal is to make her business grow, expand, and become a business woman.

The loan requested is $250 which she plans to repay in 4 months and it will be used to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, candy and soft drinks. Her clients live in Bagua GranD., especially in her own neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa tiene 54 años, casada, vive en el distrito D. Bagua GranD., Provincia D. Utcubamba, en el Departamento D. Amazonas, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Virgen D. las Mercedes. Se dedica a la Venta D. Abarrotes. Inició su negocio para mejorar los ingresos D. la familia y porque le gustaba esta actividad.

El negocio esta creciendo día a día, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades D. ella y las D. su familia, además D. seguir invirtiendo en su negocio.

Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, ampliar y convertirse en una mujer D. negocios.

El reciente crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos D. S/. 700.00 ($ 233.00 aprox.), el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, servirá para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, golosinas y gaseosas. AtienD. al público en general que residen en Bagua GranD., especialmente a los vecinos D. su barrio.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, milk, candy, and soft drinks to increase stock at a grocery store.

loans.name: Rosa Katy

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Nazarenas," and she designs and makes jewelery which she sells to customers in the neighborhood. She also teaches jewelry making to a group of ladies in neighborhood groups in Bellavista city, and she also sells supplies to them. Her business is located in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province of San Martin state.

The recent loan from Manuala Ramos for 2500 soles ($620US) will be paid in 6 payments. With this loan she will purchase jewelry making materials to create earrings, bracelets, and necklaces, such as shells, beads, and colored pearls, in addition to thread, wire and needles necessary to make the jewelry.

Rosa is 35 years old and has 2 children. She considers herself fortunate to be able to work in what she enjoyrs and have a business where she can express her creativity as she herself creates her designs at her customer's request.

She has a goal to open a store where she can sell jewelry making materials as going to the coast to buy the materials is one of the greatest expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Nazarenas, se dedica al diseño y confección de bijoutería, la cual vende a clientes de la zona, y también enseña a confeccionarlos a un grupo de señoras de algunos distritos aledaños a la ciudad de Bellavista a las cuales también vende materiales para su confección. Su negocio está ubicado en el distrito de Bellavista, provincia de Bellavista departamento de San Martín.

El reciente préstamo que recibió del Movimiento Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,500.00 ( $ 620.00 ) lo pagará en 6 cuotas, con este préstamo comprará más materiales para la confección de los aretes, pulseras y collares, tales como mostacillas, cuentas, perlas de colores, los mismos que adquiere en paquetes, además de los alambres e hilos necesarios para la confección de sus joyas.

La señora Rosa tiene 35 años y 02 hijos, se considera una mujer afortunada de poder trabajar en lo que le gusta y en un negocio en el que puede manifestar su creatividad ya que ella misma crea sus diseños a pedido de sus clientes.

Tiene como aspiración llegar a poner una tienda donde pueda vender los materiales para la confección de la bijouteria, ya que el movilizarse a la costa para comprarlos incurre en mayores costos.

loans.use: Purchase jewelry making materials

loans.name: Claudina

texts.en:
Claudia is thirty-seven years old and she and her husband have six children, five of whom are girls. Claudia is the proprietor of a beauty salon that supplies hair care products and accessories.

Claudia plans on using her loan to purchase additional items for her salon. She wants to add a small selection of women’s clothing to the beauty products her salon already provides, explaining that, with the new products, her customers can visit the salon for all their beauty and fashion needs. Claudia believes that her business is an important source of stability for her family, helping them to navigate the “unexpected challenges” that all families face.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing selection for sale in beauty salon

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Marco A.

texts.es:
Mr. Marco Velásquez lives in his parents’ house in the area of Ciudadela Ferroviaria of the City La Paz; he works in a company that installs sprinkler and irrigation systems throughout the city. The owner of the company where he works wants to allow him to live in a room that is adjacent to the factory. This will enable Marco to save money and time by being close to his work. However, the room is not yet completed. The loan requested will be used to finish the room. This is the first time Marco applies for a loan, however the credit analysis performed shows that he is a favorable candidate and that he should be capable of repaying this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marco Velásquez vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Ciudadela Ferroviaria de la Ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como empleado en una empresa de instalación de aspersores y sistemas de riego en esta ciudad. En el inmueble donde trabaja, el dueño de la empresa esta proporcionándole una habitación, ya que la distancia que debe recorrer diariamente le genera problemas tanto en tiempo como en gasto diario. Pero la habitación no esta concluida en obra fina. El crédito solicitado será destinado al acabado en obra fina de dicha habitación. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To finish a room

loans.name: Nancy Elizabeth

texts.en:
Nancy is thirty years old and married with two children. Her two young girls are already in school at ages three and five. Nancy is just starting her own business, selling women's and children’s clothing door-to-door.

Nancy has taken great care in choosing to begin her business by catering to women and children. She explains that given the expenses she will incur in purchasing her inventory, Nancy wants to be sure her products will sell and she believes women and children represent the greatest potential market. To minimize her costs and maintain a high profit margin, Nancy plans on using her loan to buy clothing in bulk, focusing on jeans and blouses for women. Nancy hopes that her nascent clothing enterprise will someday grow into a full-size family clothing store.

loans.use: Purchase of women's jeans and blouses in bulk

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Monica I.

texts.es:
Doña Mónica López, together with her son, owns a house in Llojeta in the western part of the city La Paz, she is a widow and works independently preparing French fries in her home which she sells to retailers in the city.

With previous loans she had a store built on her property (brick walls, covered with laminated sheets, “calamine”, and with doors and windows). The funds required will be used to finish the construction details of the store.

This is the sixth time that doña Mónica is asking for a loan and the financial analysis is favorable as the previous five loans have been repaid duly.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mónica López vive en casa propia en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo, ya que la señora es viuda; la señora Mónica trabaja por cuenta propia, elaborando papitas fritas en su domicilio que vende a comerciantes minoristas de la ciudad.

Con créditos anteriores realizo la construcción de una tienda en su propiedad, en obra gruesa (muros de ladrillo, cubiertas de calamina y colocado de puertas y ventanas). El crédito solicitado será destinado a la conclusión de la tienda en obra fina.

Esta es la sexta vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Los cinco préstamos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad y en los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: Finish  fine details in the construction of a business

loans.name: Juanita Mardonarad

texts.en:
Juanita, or ‘Chicha’ as her friends and family affectionately call her, is thirty-nine years old and a single mom. She has four children, three of them boys, who range from eighteen to twenty-four years old. Chicha produces homemade cheese that she sells to families throughout her community.

Every day, Chicha’s friends and neighbors visit her home to purchase her delicious cheese. Chicha does not raise livestock and does not own a cow, but she plans on using her loan to buy more milk. She hopes she can produce more cheese and attract new customers via word-of-mouth. Chicha’s wonderful, hearty laugh is contagious as she jokes that if her business grows as she hopes it will, perhaps she can buy a new house “every few years.”

loans.use: Purchase of milk for cheese production

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Liz Halley

texts.es:
Liz works enthusiastically every day in her business of selling appliances in the Pichanaki market. She gained a lot of experience in this line of work when she lived in Lima, and abandoned this profitable work to establish her home with her husband in Pichanaki. The location of her business is rented, and thanks to her work, she has been able to improve the quality of life of her two-year-old daughter, who she loves very much and who is the reason she strives every day to offer her the best. Her main goal is to obtain her own location and to be able to buy new and innovative products for her business to be able to satisfy the demand of her clients. She hopes that we will help her continue working like she has until now and that we will contribute to improving her business through a loan. She is awaiting your contribution and promises not to disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Liz, trabaja animosamente en su puesto de ventas de artefactos diariamente en el mercado de Pichanaki, ella logró reunir gran experiencia en esta actividad estando en la ciudad de Lima, abandonando este rentable trabajo por establecer su hogar junto a su esposo en la ciudad de Pichanaki.El local de su negocio es alquilado y gracias a esta actividad ha podido contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su pequeña hija de dos añitos, a quién ama mucho y por la que se esfuerza diariamente con la meta de poder de brindarle lo mejor. Su meta principal adquirir un local propio y así mismo poder comprar nuevos y novedosos productos para su puesto de ventas a fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.Ella desea que la ayudemos con el fin de seguir trabajando como hasta ahora y contribuyamos también con el mejoramiento de su negocio a través de un préstamo.Ella espera su colaboración y promete no decepcionarlo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a larger quantity of appliances for domestic use for her long list of clients.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
Mrs. Bendicta lives in her parents’ house in the area of Llojeta ladera oeste of the City La Paz with her husband and three children; Benedicta works as a teacher in a neighborhood center and her husband works in a detergent factory. With past savings and past loans they have been able to buy a lot close to where they live now. This new credit will be used to build one room in the lot that will eventually over time become their new home. This is the third time that she is asking for a loan and the credit analysis performed shows that she is a favorable candidate and that she should be capable of repaying this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Benedicta vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y tres hijos; Benedicta trabaja como educadora en un centro comunal de su zona y su esposo es empleado en una fábrica de detergentes. Con ahorros generados en los últimos años y el apoyo de créditos anteriores pudieron concluir la compra de un terreno en la misma zona. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación en el terreno nuevo que formara parte su vivienda propia. Esta es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To build one room

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.en: Maria and her husband have five children.  Their eldest daughter, twenty-three, is married, while their eldest son, nineteen, works nearby his family’s home.  The couple’s three other children, fourteen, twelve, and eleven, all attend school.  The general store Maria operates in the family home stocks a wide range of goods including fruits and vegetables but also soft drinks and rum, and other necessary items like motor oil, matches, and batteries.  Maria plans to use her loan to keep expanding the store’s inventory, particularly by buying more foodstuffs.

loans.use: Purchase of new foodstuffs and other inventory items

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Santa Javier

texts.en:
Santa is twenty-eight years old, and she and her husband have two young girls, ages five and seven. Santa has recently begun selling women’s clothing and fashionable shoes to members of her community. Santa plans to use her loan to buy more clothing at bulk rates, improving her profit margin and limiting the number of trips she will have to make to purchase the clothing she sells outside of her community.

Santa envisions her business becoming a “grand store” with a large selection of chic attire. She explains that the income from her business will help support her studies at the local university and help her to safeguard her children’s health.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing products in bulk

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Mrs. Teodora Q. lives in her mothers’ house in the area of Las Lomas ladera oeste of the City La Paz with her husband and two children; Teodora is self-employed making artisan shawls that she sells to a company; her husband works as a carpenter. With past loans they have been able to buy a lot (without utilities or building) close to where they live now. This new credit will be used to build one room in the lot that will eventually over time become their new home. This is the eight time that she is asking for a loan and the credit analysis performed shows that she is a favorable candidate and that she should be capable of repaying this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teodora Q. vive en casa de su madre en la zona de Las Lomas ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y dos hijos; Teodora trabaja por cuenta propia, elaborando chalinas artesanales que le son solicitadas por una microempresa textil y su esposo trabaja como empleado en un taller de carpintería. Con créditos anteriores realizaron la compra de un terreno amurallado en su misma zona, la que aun no cuenta con servicios básicos ni habitaciones. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación que formará parte de la vivienda propia. Esta es la octava vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To build one room

loans.name: Margarita Torrez

texts.en:
Margarita and her husband have five children ranging from age thirteen to thirty-one. Margarita jokingly points out that raising four boys has been no small task. She owns a small salon, operated in her home, where she designs and shapes hairstyles for local women.

Margarita offers a variety of styling products but plans on using her loan to buy more, hopefully at lower cost. She also plans on buying a hairdryer for her salon. Someday, Margarita would like to open a second salon outside of her home, as well.

loans.use: Purchase of new styling products and hairdryer

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Tereza Perez

texts.en: Tereza is thirty years old, married, and operates a small ice cream shop in her home.  All of the ice cream is homemade and Tereza takes great pride in her sweet creations.  She plans on using her loan to buy a larger freezer to accommodate a greater quantity of ice cream that, in turn, will be sold to more customers.  Tereza also hopes to buy more of the ingredients she uses to make the ice cream and increase her offerings.  Tereza aspires to own a big ice cream shop with plenty of seating, and dreams the entire community will enjoy her ice cream.

loans.use: Purchase of a new ice cream freezer

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is twenty-eight years old and she and her husband have three children, ages four, nine, and eleven. Dominga sells childrens’s clothing and shoes from her home, where neighborhood moms visit her. Dominga plans to use her loan to buy clothing for adult men and women, as well. She believes that customers will make her store the source for all of their families’ clothing needs.

Over time, Dominga hopes her business will become “more established” and popular with the community’s shoppers. Domingo explains that she is eager to sustain her business’s growth without outside sources of investment.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing for men and women for resale

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Juana Burgos

texts.en:
Juana, sixty-one, and her husband have four children, all of whom are married. Juana sells an array of retail items specifically for women. She sells women’s clothing and shoes, beauty products and perfume, as well as houseware items such as curtains and tablecloths.

With her loan, Juana plans on increasing her selection, particularly offering more home décor products and new colors and patterns of curtains and tablecloths. Juana explains that her business plays an important role in preserving her good health – not only because it provides essential income, but also because it brings her great joy.

loans.use: Purchase of new home décor items for sale

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel and her partner have eight children, whose ages range from three to twenty-seven years old. All of Isabel’s children are either currently attending or have finished school, except for the youngest who still has some time left at home with Mom.

Isabel collects an assortment of old metal – batteries, aluminum parts, steel pieces – at little to no cost, and then resells these at a profit. Every day, Isabel gathers these items from families in her community who would otherwise dispose of them. Each week, Isabel travels to the capital of Santo Domingo, where she sells these items to her sister who operates a scrap metal business.

Isabel plans on using her loan improve the flatbed on her family’s truck so that the vehicle can accommodate more metal. Over time, Isabel hopes to operate a business with greater resources, perhaps employees and a number of vehicles, to profit from recycling a greater amount of scrap metal.

loans.use: Modification of flatbed truck to accommodate scrap metal to be sold

location.town: Sabana Grande de Boya Community of Yamasa

loans.name: Sonia Bertha

texts.es:
Sonia has always described herself as very optimistic, and now she immersed in her store that sells household electronics, she told us that she used to have a business selling plastics which was robbed, and everything down to her last pieces taken, with a loss of three thousand soles. Overcoming this difficult circumstance, Sonia decided to begin again, a business in her current household goods store, into which she puts all her daily effort to contribute to improving the life of her children. Her goal is to be able to grow the quality of her products, buying new household electronics for her store. This way her business can continue being a great help for her children and family and in order to reach this goal she is asking for a loan that will enable her to make reality these goals. We are counting on your noble contribution and support to the people, whom with much effort, wish to strengthen their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia, siempre se caracterizó por su gran optimismo, y es así que ahora sumergida en su tienda de venta de artefactos electrodomésticos nos contó que poseía un negocio de ventas de plásticos, el cual sufrió un grave robo ya que se llevaron hasta lo último que tenia por un valor de tres mil soles.Sobreponiéndose a estas duras circunstancias, Sonia, decidió emprender nuevamente su labor en el campo del comercio a través de su actual tienda de ventas de artefactos, en el que pone todo su esfuerzo diariamente para contribuir a incrementar el nivel de vida de sus hijos; su anhelo es poder acrecentar la calidad de sus productos comprando nuevos artículos electrodomésticos para su tienda.De esta manera su negocio podrá seguir siendo una gran ayuda para sus hijos y para toda su familia y para realizar estas metas ella solicita un préstamo que le permitirán hacer realidad estos anhelos. Contamos con su noble contribución y apoyo a las personas que con mucho esfuerzo desean consolidar sus pequeños espacios de vida.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of household electronics

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es:
Mrs. Carla Patricia G. Montana is originally from the city of Bluefields, she is 33 years old, married to Mr. Fernando Palacios. They have 2 children, ages 7 and 11. Mrs. G. is owner of a store, has more than 1 year of experience, and her clients are children, women, and men of all ages that prefer she have a variety of products.

Mrs. G. needs to buy: 2 quintales (one quintal is 46kg) of flour at US$29 per quintal, 1 quintal of sugar at US$26 per quintal, 1 case of laundry detergent at US$8 per case, 2 cases of soup at US$10 per case, 6 cases of tomato sauce at US$3 per case, 6 cases of tomato paste at US$10 per case, 24 units of coffee at US$0.73 per unit, 24 units of toilet paper at US$0.63 per unit, 24 units of milk at US$0.42 each unit, 4 cartons of matches at US$2 per carton, 12 units of disinfectant at US$0.68 each, 6 units of vinegar at US$0.36 per unit, 4 cases of candles at US$0.42 per case, 6 cases of shampoo at US$2.00 each case.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Carla Patricia G. Montana es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Fernando Palacios ambos tienen 2 hijos de 7 y 11 años respectivamente. La Sra. G. es propietaria de una pulpería, tiene más de 1 año de experiencia, sus clientes son niños, mujeres y hombres de todas las edades que la prefieren por tener variedad de productos.

La Sra. G. necesita comprar: 2 quintales de harina a $ 29.00 dólares el quintal, 1 quintal de azúcar a $26.00 dólares el quintal, 1 caja de jabón para lavar ropa a $ 8.00 dólares cada caja, 2 cajas de sopas a $10.00 dólares cada caja, 6 cajas de salsa de tomate a $ 3.00 dólares cada caja, 6 cajas de pasta de tomate a $ 10.00 dólares cada caja, 24 unidades de café a $0.73 dólares cada unidad, 24 unidades de papel higiénico a $0.63 dólares cada unidad, 24 unidades de leche $0.42 dólares cada unidad, 4 cartón de fósforo a $ 2.00 dólares cada cartón, 12 unidades de desinfectante a $ 0.68 dólares cada unidad, 6 unidades de vinagre a $ 0.36 dólares cada unidad, 4 cajas de candela a $0.42 dólares cada caja , 6 cajas de champú a $ 2.00 dólares cada caja.

loans.use: Purchase: flour, sugar, oil, coffee, tomato paste, laundry detergent, toothpaste, toilet paper, aluminum paper, milk, vinegar, candles, matches, toilet paper, soup, Tang, disinfectant, shampoo.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
We found Francisca working diligently at her CD and VCD sales stand located in the Pichanaki market. She found herself working at this trade thanks to Peru’s boom in movie and music sales. She took advantage of the opportunity, rented a stand in the market, and entered the trade. All her efforts are done with the help of her husband, who is disabled due to deformities in the limbs. Despite his limitations, he works long hours supporting his wife by selling products at the stand. Every day they work hard to take care of their four children, ages 12, 9, 8 and 5. Now, Francisca is trying to enter the agricultural market by raising fruit, and her goal is to invest more in her sales stand to increase her family’s quality of life. Let’s make this loving mother’s request possible so that she can soon begin to plant and harvest happiness for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a Francisca trabajando diligentemente, en su puesto de venta de CD y VCD ubicado en el mercado de Pichanaki, ella viene dedicandose a esta actividad gracias al auge que existe en el Perú por la venta de películas y temas musicales en este formato, así mismo aprovechó esta oportunidad y alquilando un puesto en el mercado incursionó en este negocio.Todos sus esfuerzos los realiza en compañía de su esposo, quién es discapacitado ya que presenta algunas malformaciones en sus extremidades, por lo que con sus limitaciones y interminables horas de trabajo apoya a su esposa ofertando los productos en su puesto, ellos tienen cuatro hijos de 12, 9, 8 y 5 años por los que se esmeran trabajando día a día.Por ahora, Francisca, esta tratando de incursionar en la labor agrícola a través de la producción de frutas y su meta es invertir más en su puesto de ventas para poder incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia.Hagamos posible la petición de esta amorosa madre para que pronto pueda empezar a sembrar y cosechar felicidad para sus hijos.

loans.use: Increase of capital for her sales stand to strengthen it and begin a new project.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
The people that come to the market every day recognize Hermelinda as an excellent cook, and above all, a selfless mother. She prepares the dishes in her restaurant daily, thanks to the fact that she learned the secrets of cooking from her mother. This now lets her contribute to her family. She makes this effort to help her five children and to offer them well being through her work. Nevertheless, there are difficulties in their home because her 24-year-old son is an alcoholic, and as a mother, she is very worried and sad because she has tried to help him in many ways. But she is convinced that he needs professional help to free himself from this difficult illness. For this urgent reason, her wish is to expand and to fix up her restaurant properly so she can increase the number of clients so she can keep helping her children and start her son's treatment. Let's make this request possible so this sacrificing mother can enjoy the happiness of her 24-year-old son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Las personas que acuden al mercado diariamente, reconocen en Hermelinda a una excelente cocinera y sobretodo una abnegada madre, ella prepara los platos en su restaurante diariamente, gracias a que desde niña aprendió los secretos de cocina de su madre y ahora esto le permite contribuir con su familia.Realiza este esfuerzo para ayudar a sus cinco hijos a quienes les brinda bienestar a través de su ocupación; si embargo existen muchas dificultades en el hogar debido a que su hijo de 24 años es alcohólico y como madre está muy preocupada y triste porque ha tratado de ayudarlo de muchas formas pero está convencida que necesita ayuda profesional para liberarse de tan penosa enfermedad..Por esta urgente razón su deseo es ampliar y ambientar adecuadamente su pequeño restaurante a fin de incrementar el número de clientes para que pueda seguir apoyando a sus hijos e iniciar el tratamiento de su hijo. Posibilitemos esta petición para que esta sacrificada madre pueda gozar la alegría de su joven hijo de 24 años.

loans.use: Improving her small restaurant to increase her sales and the comfort of her clients.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy learned at a young age how to grow fruit, an activity that she still does today with a lot of spirit and sacrifice. She also sells food in the stand that her parents have in the most frequented market in her beautiful and hot city. It is from this last occupation that she hopes to exploit her great talent in the kitchen, acquiring a stand of her own to dedicate herself completely to the sale of her delicious dishes. Her goal is to finish building her house and to be able to contribute to the development of her young daughter, who studies in a modest little school. To achieve her dreams, she is requesting a loan to increase her harvest on her small farm. In this way, she can acquire her stand in the market. Let's all contribute to Nancy so she can build a happy home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Nancy, aprendió desde pequeña a trabajar en la producción de frutas, actividad que realiza actualmente con mucho ánimo y sacrificio, también vende comida en el puesto de sus padres ubicado en el mercado más concurrido de su bella y calurosa ciudad.Es a partir de esta última ocupación que ella desea explotar su gran talento para la cocina, adquiriendo un puesto propio para de esta manera dedicarse plenamente a la venta de sus deliciosos platillos con el propósito de terminar de construir su casa y poder contribuir con el desarrollo de su pequeña hija que se encuentra estudiando en una modesta escuelita.Para lograr sus anhelos, ella solicita un préstamo para incrementar los productos de siembra en su pequeña chacra para que de esta forma pueda lograr adquirir su deseado puesto en el mercado. Contribuyamos todos con Nancy para que pueda construir un hogar feliz.

loans.use: Investment of capital to acquire a better quantity and variety of seeds.

loans.name: Bernarda Del Socorro

texts.es:
This business is located in a large market in the city of Managua. Bernarda has had this business for more than 20 years, little by little adding more items to sell. She began the business as a way to cover her costs, and continues with her efforts in order to give her son a good education. Her efforts have also helped her daughter to construct her own house. She has been an excellent client for CEPRODEL for approximately one year. The loans provided help our clients invest in their businesses and continue growing day after day. Bernarda is an example of courage and hard work.

Este negocio está ubicado en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de managua, el cual se encontraba en malas condiciones estructurales. Ella poco a poco fue incluyendo la venta productos varios perecederos. El negocio tiene más de 20 años de existir y surge de la necesidad de cubrir los gastos que enfrentaba para poder subsistir. Ella continúa esforzándose por dar educación a su hijo pequeño el cual aun esta en el colegio.

El esfuerzo realizado le ha permitido ayudar a su hija a terminar de construir su casa. Ella a pesar de no ser casada vive con su pareja quien le ayuda a sacar adelante su hogar. Ha sido una excelente cliente de CEPRODEL aproximadamente por un año. Esperamos que al igual que otros clientes que empezaron vendiendo poco y han invertido en sus negocios gracias el financimiento otorgado logro crecer cada vez mas. Este es un ejemplo mas de valor, trabajo y sacrificio.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
In one of the busiest avenues of Juliaca we met Eva, a 24-year-old mother, selling her nutritious and tasty quinoa and apple juice, a well-known and popular drink in the city. She begins her day preparing the juice at 3:30 in the morning, and then she sells it from 6:00 to 10:00am. At first glance, this job wouldn’t seem to be very profitable, but due to the cleanliness with which she attends to her task and her delicious juices, she slowly began to earn regular customers. Now thanks to this nutritious food, she is earning her economic stability, allowing her to bring greater comfort and quality of life to her two small children. The wish of this young mother is to acquire a tricycle to expand her business and bring greater convenience to her customers. To do this, she is requesting a loan that she promises to repay in six months. Let’s support this young and enterprising woman in continuing on with her nourishing nectars.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

En una de las avenidas más comerciales de la ciudad de Juliaca encontramos a Eva, joven madre de 24 años de edad, vendiendo sus deliciosos y nutritivos jugos de quinua con manzana; néctar muy conocido y consumido por la población de su ciudad.Eva inicia su día preparando sus jugos desde las 3.30 de la madrugada para luego venderlos de 6:00 a 10:00 de la mañana; en un principio este oficio no parecía ser muy rentable pero conforme fueron pasando los días por el buen trato que daba a sus clientes, la limpieza con la que los atendía y preparaba sus agradables jugos, poco a poco fue obteniendo asiduos clientes y ahora gracias a este nutritivo alimento está obteniendo bienestar económico, permitiéndole también brindarles comodidad y una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos pequeños niños.El deseo de esta joven madre es adquirir otro triciclo para ampliar su negocio y brindar mejor comodidad a sus clientes, para esto solicita obtener un préstamo que promete reembolsarlos en un lapso de seis meses. Apoyemos a esta joven y emprendedora madre a seguir creciendo con su nutritivo néctar.

loans.use: Purchase of a tricycle to broaden her region and quantity of products.

loans.name: Betsabet

texts.es:
We find Betsabet, a separated mother of two children, In the home of her mother. She is making her beautiful embroidery on the suits for a popular dance. Thanks to her patience, creativity and enthusiasm, she is very well known for her work. Betsabet's goal is to have a small shop and grow her income to improve the quality of life for her children. To reach this goal, she is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary materials (thread, needles, etc) to continue making her elegant suits so that she can grow her business and one day open a shop for embroidery as well as custom made suits for her clients. Let's help this young mother so she can continue creating her unique pieces with much love and care, and achieve her goal of helping her children.

En el domicilio de su querida y adorable madre encontramos muy laboriosa a doña Betsabet, madre separada de dos niños, realizando sus hermosos y finos bordados de los trajes típicos de la danza de la diablada (danza muy popular de su ciudad), trabajo al que gracias a su paciencia, creatividad y entusiasmo la han hecho muy conocida dentro de su entorno laboral.El deseo de Betsabet es poseer su tiendita de bordados de disfraces a fin de incrementar sus ingresos para incrementar el nivel de vida de sus queridos pequeños y para concretar este sueño ella recurre a tu apoyo desinteresado y solicita un préstamo de dinero que le permitirá comprar materiales (tela, lentejuelas, etc.) para seguir confeccionando sus elegantes trajes, para cumplir su sueño de poseer un espacio para bordar también disfraces a petición de sus clientes.Ayudemos a esta joven madre para que siga bordando con mucho amor y cariño hermosos e incomparables trajes y los sueños de sus pequeños.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIALS NEEDED TO EMBROIDER BEAUTIFUL TRADITIONAL SUITS.

loans.name: Abdulai O

texts.en: Abdulai started running his business in 2002 by selling cola nuts.  According to him, he had $45 of business capital.  In 2003 he joined the SMT program and was able to take a  $40 loan which he invested on used clothes.  Abdulai accessed loans from SMT several times and won an award from the UNDP for being an on-time repayment client in Koinadugu district.  His business has expanded from selling cola nuts to selling blankets, bedsheets, towels and men's clothing.  Abdulai is married with six children and the children are all in school.  At 58 years old, he would like to expand his business and later hand it over to one of his children.  He is therefore requesting the loan for the purpose of expansion.

loans.use: Expand his business to include more clothing and linens to attract new customers

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed D. is thirty-seven years old and married with four children.  He needs to work hard to provide for the family.  Mohamed has so far accessed loans from SMT five times and has seen his business expand.  With the income, he said he is now constructing a family house and this will relieve him from renting.  He is requesting more loans to expand the business so that he can generate more income to complete the family house.  He is therefore requesting a $375 loan.

loans.use: Increase his variety and assortment of clothing to attract new customers

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Doña Lucy is fifty years old, and when her husband abandoned her, she searched for a way to make a living. This is how, with much effort, she was able to acquire two sewing machines to start her small sewing shop to make rain ponchos. She does this work very efficiently with the help of her two younger children. This hardworking model mother works very hard from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night in the company of her beloved family. The wish of Lucy and her family is to have more fabric to make their waterproof ponchos and to distribute them on a wholesale basis to the different markets in the city. During this rainy season, the markets are demanding a large number of these garments. To secure their plans, Lucy is requesting a loan, which she will invest and use to obtain other economic benefits. Let's contribute so the dreams of this hard-working family can become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Lucy de cincuenta años de edad, desde que su esposo la abandonó buscó la manera de ganarse la vida y así a base de mucho esfuerzo pudo adquirir dos máquinas de coser para implementar su pequeño taller de confección de ponchos impermeables; trabajo que ahora desempeña muy eficientemente con la ayuda de sus dos hijos menores. Esta laboriosa y ejemplar madre trabaja arduamente desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche en compañía de su querida familia.El deseo de Lucy y su familia es contar con más tela para la confección de sus ponchos impermeables y distribuirlos al por mayor en los diferentes mercados de su ciudad que por estas épocas de lluvia demandan en gran número estas prendas.Para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo con el que podrá invertir y obtener buenos beneficios económicos.Contribuyamos para que los sueños de esta trabajadora familia puedan hacerse realidad.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of waterproof fabric to continue making her useful rain ponchos.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is engaged in the selling of used clothes and African cotton print materials. Married with two children, he started his business eight years ago at a very small scale.  He started by selling palm oil and rice, and later on he included used clothes.  His last loan was invested in purchasing African cotton prints that he sells in the market in Kabala town of Sierra Leone.  Joseph’s wife assists him by selling the materials in the villages and on village market days.  The couple is determined to expand their business and build a family house in the future.  Joseph is therefore requesting a loan of $700 to meet his dream.

loans.use: Expand his inventory of African prints for sale

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
Don Máximo is 38 years old, lives with his partner Esther and their two sons, 8 and 2 years old. The oldest brother attends elementary school and the youngest stays home with his mother.

Don Máximo is driving a taxi motorcycle in the area of customs at Encarnación taking merchandise and passengers to Posadas-Argentina. It is a difficult job as it must be done daily no matter the cold or hot weather.

The couple owns a house which they built with a lot of sacrifice. Máximo has started a new project, as he has opened a general store which his wife is in charge of and this way generates an extra income. For this purpose they built an extra room and they have the furniture and necessary instruments, all they need is to purchase a larger variety of merchandise.

Don Máximo has saved some money but needs more funds to purchase the necessary merchandise such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, flour, rice, sugar, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Máximo tiene 38 años de edad, vive en pareja con Esther y tienen dos hijos, uno de 8 años y otro de 2 años. El hijo mayor ya va a la escuela primaria, y el más pequeño queda con la madre en la casa.

El señor Máximo se dedica al servicio de taximoto, en la zona de la aduana de Encarnación, llevando mercaderías y pasajeros a Posadas-Argentina. Es un trabajo sacrificado, pues haga frío o calor, debe realizar su labor diariamente.

La pareja tiene casa propia, lograron construir con mucho sacrificio. Máximo ha empezado un nuevo proyecto, abriendo una despensa para que su esposa pueda atenderlo y así generar un ingreso extra. Para ello, han construido un salón extra en la casa donde abrieron el negocio, ya poseen todos los muebles e instrumentos necesarios para ello, solo falta comprar mayor variedad de mercaderías.

Máximo cuenta ya con un dinero ahorrado, pero para poder completar lo necesario para la compra de mercaderías, el solicita el crédito. Entre las mercaderías que comprará podemos citar: productos enlatados, gaseosas, fideos, harina, arroz, azúcar, etc.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, flour, rice, sugar, etc. to increase stock at a general store.

loans.name: Bersy

texts.es:
Bersy, 34 years old, suffered a great heartache a few years ago. The person with whom she assumed she was going to start a home with abandoned her leaving her alone with her son Aldair. Since then, with the help of her adorable and incomparable mother, she opened a little grocery store. Through hard work and dedication, this little store has become the most visited of her little town of Nuñoa; people come for the product variety and the excellent customer service. Bersy’s biggest wish is to be able to offer her son a profession and in order to accomplish this she would like to expand her locale and increase the variety of her merchandise so her customers can find everything they require and thus fully satisfy their needs. For this purpose she asks for a loan with a payback period of six months. Let us help her realize her dreams by offering her our uncompromised support and let every day bring her closer to offering her dear son a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Bersy, de 34 años de edad, hace algunos años sufrió una gran decepción, la persona con la que creía formaría un hogar la abandonó, dejándola sola junto a su hijo Aldair.Desde entonces con el apoyo de su adorable e incomparable madre decidió abrir una bodeguita de abarrotes, gracias a su empeño y dedicación esta pequeña tiendita se convirtió en la más visitada de su pueblito Nuñoa, por la variedad de sus productos y el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes.El deseo más grande que tiene, Bersy, es brindarle a su hijo una profesión y para cumplir con este anhelo ella pretende ampliar su local y aumentar mucho más la variedad de su mercadería, a fin de que su clientela pueda encontrar en este local todo lo que requiera y así satisfacer plenamente sus necesidades; para cumplir su propósito solicita un préstamo, con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de seis meses. Ayudémosla a cristalizar sus anhelos ofreciéndole nuestro apoyo desinteresado y vea cada día más cercana la posibilidad de ofrecerle una profesión a su querido hijo.

loans.use: Injection of capital to increase quantity and variety of necessary products for full customer satisfaction.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdulrahman M. is a very creative person. As a professional tailor, he created a tailoring school for girls who drop out of school and war-abused girls. Abdulrahman started with one sewing machine and later acquired three more. After several loans from SMT, he obtained four more machines, making eight total. Contracted by local NGOs to train war-affected youth, Joseph now has 55 trainees learning in two shifts for a year. The experienced trainees also sew clothes for selling and generate income for the school.
