Thirty-six-year-old Joseph is planning to provide two years of training to the trainees to enable them to become more professional and also train more youth to be self-employed. He is therefore requesting a $550 loan to buy two ordinary machines, two machines for designing, and sewing materials such as threads, lace, etc.

loans.use: Increase his assets by purchasing additional sewing machines

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu K. is 40 years old and married with three children.  Her husband works as a security guard and his salary could not meet family expenses.  Yeabu therefore runs the business to supplement her husband’s income.  She sells spices, rice, palm oil and other essential items, and the previous loans enabled her to expand her business.  Yeabu plans to take another loan in December after she completes paying her current installments to expand her business.

loans.use: Grow her business with additional inventory

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
The little town of Nuñoa is located at some 4300 meters about sea level in an Andean region that is very cold. Despite this climate, we find Rosita here happy and enthusiastic while grazing her cattle and alpacas. This noble work that she inherited from her parents fills her with happiness and satisfaction, because thanks to the care and dedication she offers each one of her animals, they reproduce quickly. With the sale of the animals, she can better the economic situation of her family, and most importantly, offer the possibility of completing higher education to her three children. The wish that Rosita and her husband Genaro, who also does this same work, have is to keep increasing the quantity and variety of animals to better their quality of life and to secure their plans. Both are requesting a loan that will allow them to fulfill their objectives in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

A unos 4300 metros sobre el nivel del mar, está ubicado el pueblito de Nuñoa, zona alto andina muy frígida y helada; pese a este clima encontramos muy contenta y entusiasta a doña Rosita pastando a sus vaquitas y alpacas.Esta noble labor que heredó de sus padres la está llenando de alegría y satisfacción, porque gracias al cuidado y dedicación que brinda a cada uno de sus animalitos estas se van reproduciendo rápidamente y con la comercialización de los mismos puede mejorar la situación económica de su familia y sobre todo ofrecerle la posibilidad de realizar estudios superiores a sus tres hijos.El deseo que tiene doña Rosita y su esposo Genaro quién también está dedicado a esta labor, es seguir aumentando la cantidad y variedad de sus animales para mejorar su calidad de vida con su venta y para concretar sus planes ambos solicitan un préstamo de dinero que les permitirá mejorar y cumplir sus objetivos en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a larger quantity and variety of animals

loans.name: Poreh

texts.en: Poreh lives in the outskirts of Kabala town in Sierra Leone.  Married with five children, she needs to work hard to make ends meet and also take care of the children.  Because the children are still small, this thirty-year-old mother cannot travel out of the house to purchase her business items.  Poreh is assisted by her mother and brother to purchase palm oil and spices from the villages.  She sells the palm oil from her home.  With her previous loans, she expanded her business and was able to purchase an additional 30 gallons of palm oil.  She is requesting a $375 loan to purchase more spices and 20 gallons of palm oil.  This will enable her to generate more income for the future of her children.

loans.use: Purchase additional spices and palm oil to sell, generating additional income

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora is 30 years old, and for the last two years she has been immersed in running her small shop, a business she learned by selling notebooks and pens from a cart. Thanks to her diligence and hard work, she was able to rent a small space where she now offers a variety of items to the people of her native city of Nunoa. Now that her seven brothers have completed school, she would like to expand the space of her shop and increase the variety of merchandise to more customers. This will help increase her income and her overall financial situation. She is requesting a loan which she commits to paying back in 6 months. Dora needs our help in order to reach her goals.

Dora de treinta años de edad, es hija mayor Darwin y Griselda; desde hace dos años está inmersa en las labores que le demanda la administración de su pequeña librería; negocio que emprendió sólo vendiendo cuadernos y lapiceros en un pequeño triciclo y ahora gracias a su diligencia, esfuerzo y arduo trabajo ha podido alquilar un local para ofrecer una gran variedad de artículos de escritorio para los pobladores de su ciudad natal, Nuñoa, además de prendas y artículos deportivos.Su deseo de apoyar a la culminación de la educación a sus siete hermanos menores la llevan a planear ampliar su reducido local y aumentar la variedad de su mercadería con la finalidad de brindarles una completa y mejor comodidad a su amplia clientela, y así obtener mayores beneficios económicos, para esto solicita un préstamo comprometiéndose a reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses. En estos momentos Dora necesita de nuestra ayuda para concretar sus deseos, ella espera ansiosa por tú respuesta.

loans.use: d. TO EXPAND HER SMALL STORE AND INCREASE STOCK TO BETTER MEET THE DEMANDS OF HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 48 years old and a widow.  Her husband died during the civil war in Sierra Leone and she was left to bring up her three children and two adopted children.  She sells palm oil, spices, plastic shoes and other items.  Fatmata sells her goods in the villages and at the border of the Republic of Guinea.  With her previous loans, she was able to purchase 60 gallons of palm oil a month.  She would like to expand the stock of her spices and is therefore requesting a loan of $375 for this purpose.

loans.use: Increase her profits by purchasing additional spices and palm oil stock for sale

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is thirty-two years old and married.  With one child, she runs a restaurant and mini-bar.  Her husband works as a community development worker but his income is insufficient to manage the family’s expenses.  Musu has been an SMT client since 2004 and has seen her business grow with her previous loans. With some savings and the current loan, she purchased a freezer for her business and has attracted many customers.  According to her, she would like to diversify her business by supplying stationery to NGO and government offices in Kabala town.  She is therefore requesting a $375 loan.

loans.use: Continue to increase the size of her business to meet demand from customers for cold drinks

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Monday started her business three years ago in Kamabai village in Sierra Leone, and later she moved to Kabala town. With her previous loans she established a mini-restaurant within her compound for selling lunch, and her main customers are police officers. With the profit from selling food, she invested some money in a palm oil business, while also selling soft drinks and beer. She invested her last loan in clothes and some cosmetics.    Monday conducts her business within the homestead so that she can take care of her three young children.  Married to a policeman who has insufficient income, her business income supplements the family income.  Monday and the husband plan to build a family house and therefore are requesting a $525 loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Diversifying her stock of items for sale to attract new customers

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is very creative woman.   At the age of 45 years old, she is a widow with 2 children and 3 adopted children and is engaged in subsistence faming.  With her last loan, Hawa started a very creative business of purchasing vegetables from the small farmers and supplying them to expatriates engaged in the construction of the electricity dam in Tonkolili district and other towns of Sierra Leone.  She also purchases peanuts, rice, corn, and millet and sells them as seeds.  Hawa would like to expand her agro-business stock so she would be the main seed supplier.  She has orders for the various seeds from development organizations and is therefore requesting $1200 for the purpose of buying seed stock.

loans.use: Purchase additional seeds to sell and become the main seed supplier in her area.

loans.name: Haja Sundu

texts.en: Haja is 47 years old and a widow with 5 children and 3 adopted children.  She does farming and has a small business.  Because of her creativity and hard work, she was made a leader of the women farmers association in the village of Koinadugu in Sierra Leone.  Seeing the problems faced by women subsistence farmers in obtaining seeds and other farm implements, Haja started a small agro-business shop where she took some seeds and fertilizers on loan to be sold to the farmers. She also supplies seeds to some NGOs, but at a small scale.  With cash loans from SMT, she was able to expand her stock, but still more needs to be done. Haja is now discussing with SMT how women subsistence farmers can get access to loans so that they can expand their farm land and produce more food for sale and for consumption.  Haja is therefore requesting $1200 mainly for purchasing more seeds for Irish potatoes, carrots, rice, and peanuts.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to supply local women subsistence farmers.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta is 43 years old and married with 7 children. Her husband is a driver and earns a meager income. Fanta has to supplement the income, otherwise the family would not be able to cope with expenses. She said most of the income is spent on school fees and supplies.

Fanta is one of the beneficiaries of the skills development programs in Sierra Leone where she learned the trade. She produces dyed material and sells it in Freetown. With her previous loans from SMT, she was able to produce 14 suits a week and 6 bed sheets. She is very much concerned about her children’s education and therefore would like to increase her production. She is requesting a $300 loan for this purpose.

loans.use: Increase her productivity by purchasing needed raw materials.

loans.name: Sajor

texts.en:
Sajor is 50 years old and married with 6 children. He has the only rickshaw in Sierra Leone and his business provides good transport services to the community in Kabala town and especially the surrounding villages. He worked as a blacksmith before this business.

Sajor got several micro loans from SMT, with which he purchased a motorbike. With his last loan and some savings, he went to Guinea and built the bike into a rickshaw. The rickshaw can carry 6 passengers. He is requesting a loan to complete and improve the equipment. He would like to fix the windows and purchase spare tires.

loans.use: Improve the rickshaw by purchasing new windows and tires.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is 28-years-old and lives with her husband Victor, who is 32. They have a 7-year-old daughter who is of school age. They have their own house, and Elizabeth started her own business, a lovely grocery store.

Elizabeth started her business in 2005, with savings that she had and with the help of her parents. When she got married, she decided to fulfill her dream of having her own grocery store, and that way she would also have a greater income.

Her husband is a police officer, and with the salary he receives, they can pay their bills. Elizabeth hopes to have a bigger family.

The grocery store is doing well. Its sales generate good profits, thanks to the good location; there aren't any other businesses of this type in the area. Since the demand of her products has increased considerably, Elizabeth would like a loan to be able to invest in the purchase of more merchandise like: sugar, rice, noodles, cooking oil, milk, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Elizabeth tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su esposo el señor Victor de 32 años de edad, tienen una pequeña de 7 añitos en edad escolar. Tiene casa propia y en ella montó su negocio, una hermosa despensa.

Elizabeth inició su negocio en el año 2005, con un ahorro que había juntado con la ayuda de sus padres. Cuando se casó se propuso cumplir el sueño de tener su propia despensa y así obtener mayores ingresos.

Su esposo es policía y con el sueldo que percibe, pueden mantener juntos la casa. Elizabeth cuenta que desea agrandar la familia y tener más hijos.

La despensa marcha muy bien. Las ventas generan buenas ganancias, gracias a la buena ubicación, pues en la zona no existen otros negocios del mismo tipo. Ya que la demanda de sus productos ha aumentado considerablemente, desea un crédito que podrá invertirlo en la compra de más mercaderías tales como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, aceite, leche y otros.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise:  sugar, rice, noodles, cooking oil, milk, etc.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 42 years old and is married with 4 children. She started her business in 2003 with a loan from SMT.  She sells plastic shoes and some cotton materials.  Fatmata invested part of her last loan on a palm oil business. Her husband is assisting in the purchase and selling of the oil in Freetown.  She would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $300.

loans.use: Diversify her business to include selling palm oil as well as shoes.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en: Abdulai is 54 years old and married with 4 children. Abdulai was very happy when he was interviewed for a Kiva loan.  He started his business with one bale of used clothes and he had to travel to Freetown almost every week to purchase more items. With his previous loans, he increased his purchases to 10 bales a month and he generated enough income to purchase land for building a family house.  He was worried that his children would have nowhere to live when he dies, but with the loans, he has been able to secure land for the children.  He is requesting a loan of $375 to expand his business to generate more income to construct a 3-bedroom house for his family.

loans.use: Purchase additional bales of clothing for selling.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is a health worker and self-employed. She is 28 years old with 2 children. Mariama works with her husband, who is a health worker too. She started the business 4 years ago. Her husband provides basic treatment and Mariama sells basic medicines to various villages in Fadugu for the people who do not have medics in the area.  With several loans, they have been able to increase their outreach to far villages, but sometimes they do not have sufficient medicines.  She is therefore requesting for a loan of $1200 to increase their stock.

loans.use: Increase her stock of medications for her mobile pharmacy.

loans.name: Reneh

texts.en: Reneh is 38 years old and married with 6 children.  Her husband is a village elder and very influential as a local leader.  Reneh sells onions, salt, rice, and other food items.  She is also engaged in buying and selling palm oil.  With previous loans, Reneh expanded her business and she said the income has helped her pay one of her children’s school fees. Her future plan is to raise sheep.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $525 to buy sheep and also to invest in her current business.

loans.use: Purchase sheep for rearing and to supplement her current  food business.

loans.name: Hawa Barrie

texts.en: Hawa is 37 years old and married with 2 children. She started her business selling food items before the war, but at a very small scale. With her previous loans, she expanded the business and managed to purchase four sheep. Assisted by her husband who is a subsistence farmer, Hawa is able to purchase items for her business from the villages and Kabala town.  Hawa would like to buy more sheep and farmland and is requesting a $525 loan for that purpose. While her husband takes care of the farming and the sheep, she will continue selling food items, mainly to pay the loan installments and for school fees.

loans.use: Purchase additional livestock to further develop her family farming business.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu K. is 35 years old and married with 3 children.  After the war, life was very difficult for the family.  They were depending on subsistence farming only.  Isatu then joined a Rotating Savings and Credit Association club in the village.  With her first loan and her savings, she started a small business.  The subsequent loans enabled her to expand her business and purchase 2 sheep for the family.  She can now pay for her children’s education.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to further expand her business and increase farming activities with a greater number of sheep.

loans.use: Purchase livestock to further diversify their farming activities.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  She runs her business in the small village trading center of Fadugu in Sierra Leone.  She sells essential commodities and also kola nuts, rice, and palm oil.  Fatmata’s husband is a subsistence farmer with a few cows.  Both work together for the family.  She would like to rear sheep in the future and expand her business. She is therefore requesting the loan for that purpose. She said raising sheep is a long-term business and it will generate income for the children’s school fees. The income from her current business will take care of loan payments.

loans.use: She would like to increase her business and purchase sheep for rearing.

loans.name: Alieu

texts.en: Alieu is 57 years old and married with 14 children.  He has been running his cow trading business for 30 years but it was interrupted by the civil war.  He restarted the business after the war but at a very small scale.  He buys and sells cows in Freetown and other towns of Sierra Leone while engaged also in subsistence farming.  His previous loans enabled him to expand his business from purchasing and selling 2 cows a month to 4 cows.  He would like to expand his business and involve his wife in rearing sheep.  He is therefore requesting a $1200 loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows to sell and to expand into sheep rearing.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos G. is 51 years old and married to Benicia Gonzalez. They have 6 children, three of them work in a nearby factory and the others are still in school. Carlos is the owner of a small store and butcher shop which he's had for 6 years. He counts on a solid customer base thanks to his good location near the main route into the city.

In addition to the shop, Carlos also has 10 hectares of land about 10 kilometers away from his house where he raises catttle. He is known in his area as a very hardworker. In the future, would like to grow his cattle business, providing the meat to the butcher shops in the area. For now, he is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise such as sugar, oil, fruits and vegetables, dairy products, sodas and sweets for his general store

El señor Carlos G. tiene 51 años, está casado con la sra. Benicia Gonzalez, de 45 años de edad, tienen 6 hijos, tres de ellos trabajan en una fábrica de la zona y los otros tres aún están en edad escolar.

Carlos es dueño de una despensa y carnicería, hace ya 6 años. Cuenta con una clientela formada gracias a su buena ubicación, ya que el mismo se encuentra sobre la ruta de acceso principal a la ciudad.

Además de la despensa, Carlos posee una propiedad de 10 hectáreas, que queda a 10 kilómetros de su casa y en donde cría animales vacunos. Carlos es conocido en la zona, por ser una persona muy trabajadora.

Desea más adelante adquirir los elementos necesarios para fanear animales vacunos, y obtener mayores ingresos proveyendo de carne a las carnicerías d la zona. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías como azúcar, aceite, frutas, verduras, productos enlatados, gaseosas, fideos, etc.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR HIS STORE SUCH AS SUGAR, OIL, FRUITS AND VEGETABLES, DAIRY PRODUCTS, SODAS AND SWEETS.

loans.name: Dayhsen

texts.es:
Dayhsen is married to Julio, who works as a laborer for a company in the community. While he does this, Dayhsen dedicates herself to her small shop, while still caring for their two small children. She would like to increase the quantity and variety of her merchandise to meet the great demand of her customers. With the increased income, she can make necessary repairs on their home, which was given to them by her dear elderly parents. To reach her goals, she needs your generous support and is requesting a loan. She has commited to repay the loan punctually and responsibly.

Dayhsen, esta casada con Julio, quién se desempeña como obrero en una empresa comunal y mientras él se dedica a este esforzado trabajo; Dayhsen incrementa su esfuerzo y dedicación para que su pequeña bodeguita de ventas de insumos de primera necesidad les otorgue bienestar, sin descuidar la atención y sumo cuidado que brinda a sus dos pequeños y amorosos niños.Tiene el deseo de aumentar la cantidad y variedad de su mercadería para cumplir con la gran cantidad de solicitudes que le genera su clientela, y con los beneficios que obtenga refaccionar la casita que habita junto a su familia, que por herencia le dejaron sus queridos y ancianos padres. Para concretar su propósito, apela a tu generoso corazón y solicita un préstamo y promete ser muy puntual y responsable.

loans.use: TO INCREASE THE QUANTITY AND VARIETY OF MERCHANDISE WHICH SHE SELLS IN HER STORE, HELPING TO IMPROVE THE STANDARD OF LIVING FOR HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis and his young wife, who is 22, are dedicated to raising and selling alpacas. They started their small breeding center with only six alpacas that their parents gave them when they decided to form a family. Now, after three years and with two children of their own, the number of animals has increased notably, thanks to the diligence and dedication that they put into their work. Presently they have 55 animals. Sometimes their work is very exhausting and straining, but at the same time rewarding, due to the favorable results that they are obtaining. Luis's wish is to buy better breeding alpacas to keep growing in this noble work. This is why he's requesting a loan that will turn into a good investment in the hands of this young entrepreneur with many dreams of prospering.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Luis y su joven esposa Celia de 22 años de edad, están dedicados a la crianza y comercialización de alpacas. Ellos iniciaron su pequeño centro de crianzas teniendo sólo seis alpacas que sus padres les regalaron cuando decidieron formar su hogar; ahora después de tres años y con dos niños por quienes velar, la cantidad de sus animales se ha incrementado notablemente, gracias a la diligencia y dedicación que pusieron en su trabajo.Actualmente cuentan con 55 animalitos y debido a este hecho es que a veces su labor suele ser muy agotadora y esforzada pero al mismo tiempo recompensada por los resultados favorables que van obteniendo.El deseo de Luis es comprar alpacas reproductoras y mejoradas, para seguir creciendo en esta noble labor, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo que se convertirá en una buena inversión en las manos de este joven emprendedor con muchos deseos de prosperar.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of better breeding alpacas to increase the quanity of animals and profits.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
In a humble home in the district of Nuñoa, we find Petronila, who is very active and enthusiastic, showing her elegant and beautiful works that are made with extreme patience and care. This hard-working mother of four children has done this work for sixteen years. Year after year, she has improved and increased the quantity and variety of her production, on occasions with help from her beloved daughters. Presently she has a large amount of orders, but unfortunately she can't fill them all because she doesn't have enough raw material (alpaca wool) for the production of her beautiful art. This is why she is appealing to your help and requesting a loan that she promises to repay in six months. Let's help this adorable mother to keep performing her noble work efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En un humilde domicilio del distrito de Nuñoa encontramos muy activa y entusiasta a doña Petronila, mostrando sus elegantes y hermosos trabajos, realizados con suma paciencia y creatividad.Esta laboriosa madre de cuatro hijos está dedicada a esta noble labor hace 16 años, que año tras año fue mejorando y aumentando la cantidad y variedad de su producción, en ocasiones con apoyo de sus queridas hijas.Actualmente ella tiene gran cantidad de pedidos, pero lamentablemente no puede cumplir con todos, porque no posee suficiente materia prima (lana de alpaca) para la elaboración de su bello arte, es por esa razón que recurre a tu ayuda y solicita un préstamo que promete reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses. Ayudemos a esta adorable madre a que siga desenvolviéndose eficazmente en su noble labor

loans.use: Purchase of alpaca wool to keep producing beautiful woven goods.

loans.name: Doria

texts.es:
Mrs. Doria Velazquez lives in San Estanislao city, in the neighborhood Barrio 8 de Diciembre. She is 40 years old, married to 39 year old Fermín. They have 5 children - 3 boys and 2 girls, all are in school, two are still in elementary and the other three are in secondary school.

Doria has a well stocked store in her home, where she sells primarily basic necessities such as bread, milk, sugar, noodles, fruit, vegetables, canned goods, etc. Her husband has been selling sausages (cold cuts, bologna, sausage, etc.) in the city market for the past three years. Both businesses are going well and generate good income.

Doria wishes for a loan to buy more merchandise for the store, as customer demand increases considerably at the end of the year and she wants to be prepared to meet the needs of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La sra. Doria Velazquez vive en la ciudad de San Estanislao, en el barrio 8 de diciembre, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Fermín de 39 años de edad; tienen 5 hijos, 3 varones y 2 mujeres, todos van al colegio, dos de ellos aún están en la etapa primaria y los otros tres ya van a la secundaria.

La señora tiene una despensa en su domicilio bien surtida, donde vende principalmente productos de primera necesidad como pan, leche, azúcar, fideos, frutas, verduras, productos enlatados, etc. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de embutidos (fiambres, mortadelas, chorizos, etc.) en el mercado municipal de la ciudad desde hace 3 años. Ambos negocios marchan muy bien, y generan buenas ganancias.

Doria desea el crédito para comprar más mercaderías para la despensa, ya que la demanda aumenta considerablemente a fin de año y ellos desean estar preparados para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as sugar, canned goods, pop, noodles, rice, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a native of the district of Nuñoa and is the only daughter of Margarita. When her mother got sick, she decided to put her business of selling garments aside to devote herself completely to the care of her dear beloved mother and to be by her side during her recovery. Unfortunately, all of this effort was in vain because her mother lost her life one month ago due to the very advanced stage of her illness. This caused her a lot of pain and suffering. Now after this regrettable event, Julia hopes to start anew and to start her business one more time. To secure her dreams in the company of her adorable goddaughter, she is requesting a loan which she will invest completely in the acquisition of a greater quantity of merchandise. This young woman is waiting for your selfless support to be able to keep moving forward and prosper in life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Julia natural des distrito de Nuñoa, es la única hija de Margarita, desde que su madre enfermó decidió dejar a un lado su negocio de ventas de prendas de vestir, para consagrarse completamente al cuidado de su querida y entrañable madre y así junto a ella ayudarla a la recuperación de su salud; desafortunadamente todo ese esfuerzo fue en vano, ella perdió la vida hace un mes, por etapa muy avanzada de su enfermedad, este hecho le causó mucho sufrimiento y dolor.Ahora después de este lamentable suceso ella desea empezar de nuevo e iniciar su negocio una vez más. Para concretar sus deseos en compañía de su adorable ahijadita, ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlos completamente en la adquisición de mayor cantidad de mercadería.Esta joven en estos momentos espera por tu apoyo desinteresado para salir adelante y prosperar en la vida.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a greater quantity of garments and to consolidate her life's small business.

loans.name: Delia Flora

texts.es:
Delia Flora is an enthusiastic and enterprising mother of three children. She has been separated from her husband for eight years and has been solely responsible for the well-being and safety of her children since then. Delia Flora attends to her grocery store from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m., and thanks to her charisma and variety of merchandise, her store has become one of the most visited in the area. This hard-working mother does artisanship in her spare time, an activity for which she is very well-known and respected by her neighbors. Delia Flora's wish is to offer her three children a better quality of life, and above everything, a profession. To make this a reality, she wants to expand her store and increase the variety of merchandise so the economic benefits that she obtains will better their quality of life. Let's help Flora achieve her dreams in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Delia Flora, es una entusiasta y emprendedora madre de tres hijos, está separada de su esposo hace ocho años y desde entonces vela sola por el bienestar y seguridad de sus pequeños; Delia Flora atiende su despensa desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche, gracias a su carisma y variedad de su mercadería ésta se ha convertido en una de las tienditas más visitadas de su zona. Esta laboriosa madre en sus horas libres también se dedica a la artesanía, actividad por la que es muy conocida y respetada por sus vecinos.El deseo de Delia Flora es ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus tres queridos hijos y sobre todo una profesión. Para hacer realidad esto ella pretende ampliar su tiendita y aumentar la variedad de su mercadería para que con los beneficios económicos que obtenga mejorar su nivel de vida.Hagamos que Flora lleve a cabo sus sueños en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Improving her store and purchasing a larger quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena formed her family with Alberto when she was 17-years-old. She presently has two children, who are the reason that she works so hard. Both Elena and Alberto make a living by raising alpacas and selling their meat, but Alberto is always looking for a way to generate extra income to support the family, so he also offers his services as a handyman for temporary jobs. Meanwhile, Elena is in charge of caring for the alpacas. The wish of this young and enterprising family is to increase the quantity of their animals, and with their sales, to save enough to build a small house. Both believe that with this trade, they will be able to get ahead. To secure this dream, they require an amount of money to serve as a capital investment, and that's why they are appealing to your heart and are requesting a loan. Thanks to your selfless support, you will allow them to secure their plans.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Elena, formó su familia con Alberto a la edad de 17 años; actualmente ya tiene dos hijos, quienes son la razón por los que trabaja arduamente.Ambos se dedican a la crianza de alpacas y a la comercialización de su carne, pero Alberto siempre busca la manera de generar ingresos económicos extras para el sustento familiar desempeñándose como maestro de obras en diferentes trabajos eventuales.Mientras tanto, Elena se encarga del cuidado de sus alpaquitas; el deseo de esta joven y emprendedora familia es aumentar la cantidad de sus animales y con la comercialización de estos ahorrar lo suficiente para construir su casita, ambos creen que con este oficio podrán salir adelante y para concretar este pensamiento requieren de una suma de dinero como capital de inversión y es por eso que recurren a tu buen corazón y solicitan un préstamo que gracias a tu desinteresado apoyo les permitirá concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Increase of capital investment to acquire more alpacas with the goal of securing their family dream.

loans.name: Pablina

texts.es:
Paulina O. is 39-years-old. She is married to Braulio Ganoso, who is 36. They have 4 children, 3 girls and 1 boy, of whom 3 are of school age.

The couple has a butcher's shop and a small grocery store in their home. They have all of the necessary elements, and thanks to their attention and the good quality of their products, they have a large quantity of clients. Her husband also practices agriculture, raises cattle, and has a motorcycle shop.

Paulina and her husband are very beloved people in the area. Everyone knows them as very hard-working and enterprising people. Paulina hopes to buy more merchandise for her grocery store with the loan, such as rice, noodles, meat, chicken, canned goods, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Paulina O. tiene 39 años, esta casada con el señor Braulio Ganoso, que tiene 36 años de edad; ellos tienen 4 hijos, 3 mujeres y 1 varón, de los cuales 3 estan ya van a la escuela para estudiar.

La pareja tiene una carnicería y despensa en su casa. Poseen todos los elementos necesarios, y gracias a la buena atención y calidad de sus productos, poseen una gran cantidad de clientes. Su marido además de dedicarse a la agricultura y cría de animales vacunos, también posee un taller de motos.

Paulina y su esposo son personas muy queridas en la zona, todos los conocen como personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Ella desea el crédito para comprar mercaderías para su despensa, tales como arroz, fideos, carnes, pollos, productos enlatados, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise:  rice, noodles, meat, chicken, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena is a woman who works hard for her life. Ten years ago she started working in a meals business that she created together with her family. However, when her daughters started growing up they did not want to help Magdalena with the business anymore. Rather, they started doing other jobs and she was left working together with her husband. When Magdalena's husband passed away two years ago and Magdalena fell into a terrible depression, the tasks of the meal preparation business became harder for her, and so she decided to stop selling meals. Instead, she started selling clothes in a tianguis (small itinerant outdoor market), because she believes this business is not as draining on her and also clothes sell as well as the meals.

However, all the income she obtains from this business only covers her living expenses and because of this in some occasions she does not have much money to invest in new clothes to sell. For this reason she is requesting a loan for US $ 475 which she is willing to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy more merchandise for the winter season to offer greater variety to her clients. With your help Magdalena will be able to overcome her terrible loss.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Magdalena, es una señora que lucha por su vida. Hace 10 años comenzó a trabajar en un negocio de comidas que creó junto con su familia sin embargo cuando sus hijas comenzaron a crecer estas ya no quisieron ayudarle a magdalena en el negocio. Encambio se empezaron a hacer de otros trabajos y se quedó trabajando junto con su esposo, sin embargo hace 2 año que falleció y Magdalena entró en una terrible depresión, y los labores del negocio de comida comenzaron a ser cada vez más difíciles para ella, por lo tanto decidió dejar de vender comidas. Y comenzó a vender ropa en un tianguis, puesto que considera, este negocio no la desgasta tanto y también se vende muy bien como las comidas.

Sin embargo todas las ganancias que obtiene en este negocio le alcanzan para poder pagar sus gastos y es por eso que en ocasiones no tiene mucho dinero para volver a invertir en ropa. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía de temporada de invierno, para poder ofrecerle más variedad a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Magdalena podrá salir adelante de esta terrible pérdida.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for the winter season (Comprar mercancía para la temporada de invierno)

loans.name: Nery Veronica

texts.es:
Señora M. began her business by selling fruits and vegetables in a traveling fashion with the goal of supporting her four children. However, this wasn't enough to cover the expenses of their home, and she decided to take on the risk of starting a fixed business in the Israel Lewites market. This is how Nery started to work with CEPRODEL, and thanks to the financing she obtained from them, she was able to buy a location where she offers a little bit of everything to her clients.

Her traveling business started ten years ago with $40 in capital with little merchandise and few products. Although the infrastructural conditions now aren't the greatest, she has still been able to progress. Her business is covered with plastic for protection from the sun, and even though she hasn't been able to put a decent roof on her location, this isn't an obstacle for her in her progress.

She started working with CEPRODEL in 2005, and her first credit was 3,000 cordobas. Little by little, her line of credit has increased thanks to her credit record. For Nery, working with CEPRODEL has been an incredible help, and she is very thankful for the support that has been offered to her by being a part of this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora M., comienza su negocio de manera ambulante vendiendo verduras y frutas con el fin de darle sustento a sus cuatro hijos. Sin embargo esto no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos necesarios en su hogar y decide arriesgarse a poner un negocio de manera fija en un local en el mercado Israel Lewites. Es asi como Nery comienza a trabajar con CEPRODEL y gracias al financiamiento logro comprar un local en donde brinda de todo un poco a los clientes.

Su negocio ambulante lo empieza desde hace diez años con un capital de US$ 40.00 y con poca mercaderia y productos, sin embargo ahora aunque las condiciones infraestructural no es la mejor ella ha logrado progresar. Su negocio esta cubierto por plasticos para proteccion del sol ya que aun no ha logrado poner un techo digno en su local; esto no es impedimento para ella en su progreso.

Ella comenzo trabajando con CEPRODEL desde el 2005, su primer credito fue de CS3,000.00 (cordobas), y poco a poco su linea de credito ha ido aumentando gracias a su record crediticio. Para Nery el trabajar con CEPRODEL ha sido una ayuda increible y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que se le ha brindado por parte de la Institucion.

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise

loans.name: Melina

texts.es:
Melina is a hardworking and exemplary mother. Her husband abandoned her and her young children 8 years ago. Since then she has worked in different jobs to take care of her treasured children, who are her motivation every day. Today, she works as a cleaning woman in a government office in her native city of Juliaca. She works hard at this job from 7 at night until 2 in the morning. In addition to this work, she also creates handicrafts made of wool to help generate more income for her family. She puts in long hours making them and then sells them around the bus terminal. She is getting a lot of satisfaction and happiness from this work, and she would like to grow the business. She is requesting a loan to buy different colors of wool to continue making her beautiful pieces, selling more and improving the quality of life for her children. Melina kindly requests your support in helping provide for her family's wellbeing.

Melina es una esforzada y ejemplar madre, su esposo la l abandonó junto a sus pequeños niños hace ocho años; desde entonces trabajó en diversas actividades con el fin de sacar adelante a sus tesoros, quienes motivan su esfuerzo día a día.Actualmente esta laboriosa madre trabaja como personal de limpieza en una oficina gubernamental de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, desempeña diariamente esta noble labor desde las 7:00 de la noche hasta las 2:00 de la mañana, adicionalmente encontró en la elaboración de bellas chompitas otra manera de generar ingresos económicos para su hogar, dedicándose a tejer durante largas horas para luego ofrecerlos en forma ambulatoria en el terminal de buses interprovinciales. Ésta actividad que desempeña muy eficientemente le está otorgando mucha satisfacción y alegría y desea seguir prosperando con este oficio. Para eso solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar coloridas lanas para seguir fabricando sus hermosos trabajos y así ofrecerles una mejor solvencia económica a sus queridos hijos. Melina muy gentilmente solicita tu apoyo para seguir brindándole bienestar a su querida familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE DIFFERENT COLOR WOOLS TO CONTINUE MAKING HER BEAUTIFUL CRAFTS.

loans.name: Jesús Rafael

texts.es:
Jesus, as a father of a family worried for the future of his son, decided to start looking for a business which could yield enough money to support his wife and child, and enough time for him to finish his studies because he had no support from his own parents, and spend time with his son. This is why with the few savings he had, he rented a cart and started selling hot dogs on the sidewalk outside of their home. With only a small gas tank, a few utensils and no clients, but with faith and enthusiasm to make his business succeed, little by little clients started coming to buy his products.

However, Jesus feels obligated to offer his clients a better service, so they do not go seeking other competing businesses, and also to be able to attract more clients. This is why he is requesting a loan for US $750, which he is willing to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money, Jesus will be able to buy a deep fryer to make French fries and paint his cart, in addition to installing light in his small locale. With these improvements he will have more clients and will be able to support his family and continue his studies to be able to offer a better future to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Jesús padre de familia, preocupado por el futuro de su hijo, decidió comenzar a buscar un negocio que le pudiera dejar el dinero suficiente para mantener a su esposa e hijo y tiempo para poder terminar de estudiar, puesto que no contó con el apoyo de sus padres, y convivir con su hijo. Fue así que con los pocos ahorros que tenía, rentó una carreta y comenzar a vender hot dogs en la banqueta de su casa con un pequeño tambo de gas, pocos utensilios, sin clientes, pero con fe y entusiasmo para sacar su negocio adelante y poco a poco los clientes se fueron acercando a comprarle sus productos.

Sin embargo, Jesús se siente comprometido a ofrecerles a sus clientes un mejor servicio para que estos no se le vayan con la competencia, y poder atraer más clientes. Es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesto a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses. Con este dinero Jesús podrá comprar una freidora para hacer papas, y podrá pintar su carretón, además de instalar iluminación a su pequeño local. Y con estas mejoras poder tener más clientelas para sacar adelante a su familia y continuar sus estudios para poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia.

loans.use: Buying a deep fryer and remodeling the place where they sell products (Comprar una freidora y remodelar el lugar donde venden los productos)

loans.name: Yahaira San Juanita

texts.es:
San Juanita had the necessity to start working to be able to pay her school expenses, and that is why after thinking about which would be ideal job to be able to have time to study and money to pay her expenses at school, she started selling tacos and tortas (Mexican sandwiches) at night, outside of her home. However, although the sales were good, they were not what she hopes, since in her neighborhood there aren’t as many people as she would like. With the help of her mother, she started looking for a place to establish herself as a business offering meals. And so it was that they establish themselves in a food cart and little by little have increased their clients.

However, Juanita believes that it is necessary to give a better impression so that potential clients who walk by her cart may decide to stop and buy from them. The cart needs to be attractive and look clean because food preparation requires cleanliness above all to give a good impression. This is why they are requesting a loan for US$1025, which she is willing to pay within a period of 6 months. With this money San Juanita will be able to remodel her cart to have a better presentation and have more clients. With your help San Juanita and her mom will be able to have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

San Juanita, tuvo la necesidad de ponerse a trabajar para poder pagar sus gastos de la escuela, y por eso fue que después de pensar cuál sería el trabajo idóneo para poder tener tiempo para estudiar y dinero para poder pagar sus gastos en la escuela que comenzó por vender tacos y tortas en la noche a las afueras de su casa. Sin embargo las ventas eran buenas pero no lo que esperaban puesto que en su colonia no hay tanta gente como ella quisiera. Con la ayuda de su mamá empezó a buscar un lugar para establecerse como un negocio de comidas. Y así fue como se establecieron en un carrito de comidas y así poco a poco han ido aumentando sus clientes.

Sin embargo San Juanita consideran que es necesario dar una mejor impresión para que los posibles clientes que pasan por su carro, puedan detenerse a comprarles, sea atractivo y se vea limpio, puesto que las comidas necesitan sobretodo limpieza para dar una buena impresión es por esto que están solicitando un crédito de US $1025 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Con este dinero San Juanita podrá remodelar su carrito para poder tener mayor presencia y tener más clientes. Con tu ayuda San juanita y su mamá podrán tener un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Remodeling the cart where they sell food. (Remodelar el carrito donde venden la comida)

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Twenty years ago she started with a griddle, 10kg. of barbacoa (slow-cooked beef meat), and all the enthusiasm in the world, to sell barbacoa to support her young daughter who is now 20 years old and other daughters who are still studying. After much hard work to get a place in her neighborhood, she started selling menudo to have more variety in her business.

However, the battle to support her two youngest daughters is still ongoing, and that is why she is requesting a loan for US $925 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy more merchandise to make more barbacoa and menudo and increase her sales. With your help, Maria will be able to support her daughters and give them the education that they need so much to become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Hace 20 años comenzó con una parilla y 10kg de barbacoa y todas las ganas del mundo, a vender barbacoa para poder sacar adelante a su pequeña hija quien ahora ya tiene 20 años, y las otras mas chicas siguen estudiando. Después de seguir luchando por posicionarse en su colonia comenzó a vender menudo para tener más variedad en su negocio.

Sin embargo la lucha por sacar a sus dos pequeñas hijas adelante sigue en pie, y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía para hacer más barbacoa y Menudo y así incrementar las ventas. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a sus hijas y les podrá dar estudio que tanto necesitan para ser unas personas de bien.

loans.use: Buying raw ingredients for her business. (Comprar materia prima para su negocio)

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe is an exemplary father and respectable husband. For more than eight months now, his family has been going through very hard times. Sadly, his beloved wife Julia suffers from cancer and in spite of this fact which causes him much pain, he works tirelessly with his only work tool, his tricycle cart to try to cover the health expenses of his life partner. Now that the household expenses have increased enormously, with the help of his four children, Felipe decided to go into the business of selling bosta (a material used as fuel to cook food and other things.) Thanks to his hard work at this job and to the great demand for his product, he has been able to obtain a good income and he would like to continue this business for a long time. Felipe requests a loan to increase his merchandise stock and so be able to satisfactorily cover the health expenses of his beloved wife. In these moments, Felipe and his family need our prompt help, to be able to keep working hard and succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Felipe, es un ejemplar padre y respetable esposo, hace más de ocho meses su familia viene pasando por momentos muy difíciles, desdichadamente su querida esposa Julia padece de cáncer y a pesar de este hecho que le causa mucho dolor trabaja incansablemente con su única herramienta de trabajo, su triciclo, para tratar de cubrir los gastos de salud de su compañera de toda la vida.Ahora que los gastos de su familia se incrementaron enormemente, con ayuda de sus cuatro hijos decidió incursionar en el negocio de venta de bosta (material que se utilizan como combustible para la cocción de los alimentos y demás.) Gracias al empeño que ponen en este trabajo y a la gran demanda que tiene su mercadería le está permitiendo generar buenos ingresos económicos y desea continuar con este negocio por largo tiempo.Felipe solicita un préstamo para aumentar el stock de su mercadería, y así cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de salud de su amada esposa. En estos momentos Felipe y su familia requieren de nuestra pronta ayuda, para seguir luchando y triunfar.

loans.use: Investment capital to acquire a larger quantity of this precious fuel (Inyección de capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de este preciado combustible de fabricación artesanal.)

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Veronica is a hardworking woman who tries to give the best to her children so they can get ahead and not suffer the lacks she is living through now. This is why she started selling shoes among her relatives and friends, and so is able to contribute money to her house to pay the school expenses for her four children, since what her husband makes as a house painter in housing developments is not enough to cover all the household expenses.

However, the winter season is about to arrive and this is when clients buy the most, for Christmas gifts, and so she is requesting a loan for US $925 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy more merchandise to have a larger variety of shoes that can be of interest to her clients. With your help, Veronica and her husband will be able to support their children to offer them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Verónica es una mujer trabajadora, que trata de darle lo mejor a sus hijos para que puedan salir adelante y no sufrir las carencias que ella está viviendo. Es por eso que comenzó a vender zapatos a sus familiares y amigos, y así poder aportar dinero a su casa para pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus 4 hijos. Puesto que lo que gana su esposo, como pintor de casas en fraccionamientos, no les alcanza para todos los gastos del hogar.

Sin embargo la temporada de invierno está por llegar y es cuándo más compran los clientes, para sus regalos de navidad, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía para tener más variedad de zapatos que les pueda interesar a sus clientas. Con tu ayuda verónica y su esposo podrán sacar adelante a sus hijos para ofrecerles un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to have a larger variety for the winter season (Comprar mercancía para tener más surtido en la temporada de invierno)

loans.name: Corina Francisca

texts.es:
Corina has had a hard life and has worked hard to be able to support her mother and her two children. Her job as a kitchen helper could not cover the household needs. This was the reason she decided to start her food business, putting in practice the knowledge acquired as a helper. At the beginning this business was a plastic stand.

As the head of family, and with great disposition to succeed, Corina embarks in the adventure of bank loans to get her locale, in which she has been for about 5 years now. After working hard to pay that loan, she learns CEPRODEL and decides to start working with this institution, feeling more comfortable with the loan terms and feeling better attended by the personnel, in addition to the nearness of their offices.

Corina has been working with CEPRODEL for about a year and a half with a record of 14 loans, and she says she has felt a positive impact since she started with our institution because she has been able to make larger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Corina ha tenido una vida dura y ha luchado para poder mantener a su mama y a sus 2 hijos. Su trabajo de ayudante de cocina no podia cubrir con las necesidades en su hogar, razon por la cual decide colocar su negocio de comida poniendo en practica los conocimientos adquiridos como ayudante, el cual al inicio era una caseta de plastico.

Jefa de Familia y con mucha disposicon de salir adelante, Corina se embarca en la aventura de los prestamos en los bancos para adquirir su local el cual tiene alrededor de 5 años, luego tras una ardua lucha por pagar ese prestamo conoce CEPRODEL y decide comenzar a trabajar con esta Institucion, sintiendose mas comoda con los plazos y mejor atendida por el personal, ademas de la cercania de las oficinas.

Con CEPRODEL Corina lleva trabajando alrededor de 1½ año con un record de 14 creditos, y expresa que ha sentido un impacto positivo desde que incio con nuestra Institucion ya que ha logrado obtener mas ganacias.

loans.use: Buying raw materials (food for cooking) (Compra de materia prima (alimentos para cocinar))

loans.name: María Benita

texts.es:
María Benita is a woman who has always fought to keep her children moving forward. She worked for many years taking care of her 6 children, and she always tried to give them the best of herself. Her husband, who was the breadwinner, also worked a lot in order to provide the money for them to survive. However, when her husband died, María had to find the strength to keep going, and in this way she began to make tacos and tamales to sell.

Nonetheless, it takes María a long time to make her food because her stove does not yield much when making multiple types of food at the same time. For this reason, María is requesting a loan of $925, to be repaid over a period of 6 months, and with this money she will be able to buy a stove with more burners in order to be able to make more food in less time. With your help, María can move past this terrible loss.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

María Benita es una mujer que ha luchado siempre por sacar sus hijos adelante. Trabajó durante muchos años a atender a sus 6 hijos de quienes trató siempre de darles lo mejor de ella. Y su esposo quien era el que llevaba el dinero a su casa, trabajó también mucho por darles dinero para poder sobrevivir. Sin embargo en el momento en que el señor murió María tuvo que sacar fuerzas para poder salir adelante y fue así que comenzó a hacer tacos y tamales para vender.

Sin embargo actualmente tarda mucho en hacer sus comidas puesto que su estufa no rinde mucho para hacer varias comidas a la vez. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar una estufa con más parrillas para poder tener la oportunidad de hacer más comidas en menos tiempo. Con tu ayuda María podrá salir delante de esta terrible pérdida.

loans.use: Buy a stove

loans.name: María Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. María T. is 44 years old and married to 47 year old Mr. Arístides Speranza. They have 3 children, 2 in high school and 1 in the school near their home in San Estanislao.

María sells meat in the city market, specifically "menudencias" or edible organ meat of cows and chickens, such as heart, liver, kidney, intestine, etc.

María and Arístides are hardworking and selfless, as their daily work begins at 3:00 in the morning and they work Monday through Saturday.

María has a future project to build a room in the front of their house to open a small store. Today she is asking for a loan in order to buy at wholesale prices meat to resell, such as liver, heart, kidney, intestine, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. María T., tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada con el sr. Arístides Speranza de 47 años de edad. Tienen 3 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando en el colegio y 1 esta en la escuela cerca de su domicilio en San Estanislao.

La Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de menudencias en el Mercado Municipal de la ciudad, las menudencias son las partes internas de los animales como las vacas y las gallinas, que también se consumen, ejemplo el corazón, hígado, riñón, tripas, etc.

Son personas muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas, ya que su jornada laboral se inicia a las 03:00 horas de la mañana y lo hacen de lunes a sábados.

Tiene como un proyecto para el futuro el de construir un salón en frente de su casa para montar una despensa. Hoy solicita un crédito para la compra al por mayor de menudencias como: hígado, corazón, riñón, tripas, etc.

loans.use: Purchase organ meats: liver, heart, kidney, intestine, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Mrs. Beatriz started the business of shoe sales through catalogues because of financial problems. Her husband's income is not enough to be able to pay all of her three children's school expenses, and so it is that she started selling shoes through catalogues among her relatives and friends. Little by little she has become well known among the people to whom she sells shoes.

However, Beatriz wants to expand her business, buy more merchandise at wholesale prices, given that she has made herself known with her neighbors and friends, in addition of setting up a locale for the sale of shoes. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $ 475 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy more merchandise and rent a locale to have a fixed place where her clients can come to buy shoes from her. With your help Beatriz will be able to help her children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Beatriz Inicio el negocio de venta de calzado por catálogo por problemas económicos. Ya que lo que gana su esposo no le alcanza para poder pagar todos los gastos que sus tres hijos tienen en la escuela y fue así como comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo entre sus familiares y amigos y poco a poco se a ido dando a conocer entre la gente de que ella es quien vende zapatos.

Sin embargo Beatriz desea ampliar su negocio, comprar más mercancía a precio de mayoreo, ya que se ha dado a conocer con sus vecinos y amistades. Además de poder poner un local para la venta de sus zapatos, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía y poder rentar un local para tener un lugar fijo a donde puedan ir sus clientes a comprarle zapatos. Con tu ayuda Beatriz podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying more products and renting a locale. (comprar más productos y poder rentar un local)

loans.name: Reyna Adilia

texts.es:
Reyna M. is married and has a daughter. She started her business selling used clothes about 10 years ago with a capital of US $500.00. At the same time she helped her husband in the sale of beds and mattresses. With time and helping each other, the couple managed to start a shoe store in the market Israel Lewites in the city of Managua, in a locale enclosed by sheets of plastic.

Her work with CEPRODEL since two and a half years ago has made her sales increase, thus achieving greater profits. At the same time, she has improved the locale's infrastructure. Her credit record is of 14 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Reyna M. es casada y con una hija,. Inicia su negocio vendiendo ropa usada hace alrededor de 10 años con un capital de US$500.00 y al mismo tiemp ayudaba a su esposo en la venta de camas y colchones. Con el tiempo y ayudandose mutuamente la pareja logra poner el negocio de calzado en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de managua, en un local cerrado por plasticos.

Su trabajo con CEPRODEL desde hace 2½ años ha hecho que sus ventas incrementen logrando asi mayores ganancias. Asi mismo ha mejorado la infraestructura del local. Su record es de 14 creditos.

loans.use: Buying shoes to stock inventory (Compra de calzado para retroalimentacion de inventario)

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Mr. Ezequiel studied junior high, and when it came to choose which vocational shop he would like to take during those three years, he chose sewing, because he enjoyed sewing very much. Even though at home they told him that sewing was work for women, he decided to move ahead with his joy for sewing and started his business buying a sewing machine. His enjoyment and dedication to this activity has taken him to become recognized for his great work in this sector, and the necessity of supporting his family keeps him with the idea of continuing to invest in his business to be able to offer a better service to his clients and improve his profit.

This is why he is requesting a loan for US $325, which he is willing to pay in a period of 6 months. This money will be used to buy more cloth, embroidery, and other materials he used to be able to create the clothes his clients like so much. With your help Ezequiel will be able to support his children and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

El señor Ezequiel curso la educación Secundaria, al momento de escoger que taller le gustaría llevar durante esos 3 años, eligió la opción de corte y confección. Ya que a el le gustaba mucho coser, auque en su casa le decían que ese trabajo era de mujer, el decidió llevar adelante su gusto por la costura así que inicio su negocio comprando una máquina de coser y empezó, el gusto y dedicación a esta actividad lo ha llevado a ser reconocido por su gran trabajo dentro de su sector, y la necesidad de mantener a su familia lo mantiene con la idea de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para dar mejor servicio a sus clientes y mejores ganancias.

Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y el dinero le servirá para poder comprar más telas, bordados, y otros materiales que utiliza para poder fabricar esas prendas que tanto le gustan a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ezequiel podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su familia.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to expand his business (Comprar mercancía para crecer el negocio)

loans.name: Matilde Elizabeth

texts.es:
Matilde started this business as a way to occupy her free time and to help her husband with the costs of educating their 2 small children. Today this business lets them take care of more than 70% of their family expenses. They are thinking about expanding their store since they need more space to be able to buy a better assortment of merchandise and a better way to accommodate the merchandise that they currently have.

Matilde is requesting a loan of $925 that she is sure she will be able to pay back in 6 months. With this money, Matilde will be able to invest in expanding her business to accommodate her merchandise better and to buy a little more merchandise to make better profits. With your help, Matilde will be able to take proper care of her two children and will be able to pay for their education so they will be great men in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Ella inicio este negocio como medio para ocupar su tiempo libre y ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la educación de sus 2 pequeños hijos. Hoy este negocio les da para solventar más del 70% de sus gastos familiares. Están pensando en ampliar el local ya que necesitan mas espacio para poder comprar más surtido y acomodar de una mejor manera la mercancía que ya tienen actualmente.

Por lo tanto Matilde está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está segura lo podrá pagar en un plazo de 6 meses, y con este dinero Matilde podrá invertir en ampliar su negocio para acomodar mejor su mercancía y comprar un poco de más mercancía para obtener mayores ganancias. Con tu ayuda Matilde podrá sacar adelante a sus dos hijos y les podrá pagar los estudios para que estos niños sean en un futuro hombres de bien.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a young mother who dedicates all of her time to caring for her children and has never considered leaving them alone without her protection. This is the reason she decided to work selling fruits near her home, and today she continues to work in a diligent manner and has increased more and more the merchandise that she offers. She sells fruit every day in a small stand set up in her rented house. The best day for selling her delicious fruits is Sunday. Nancy hopes every day to secure the well-being of her family even more, and with time, to realize the dream of having her own house. This is why her husband also works very hard. Nancy hopes to keep working and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a larger quantity of fruits. With the profits she obtains, she will increase the well-being and education of her small children when they reach school age. Let's support this young mother and her family to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Nancy, es una joven madre que dedica todo su tiempo al cuidado de sus niños y nunca ha pensado en dejarlos solos sin su amparo y esta es la razón por la que decidió trabajar vendiendo frutas cerca de su casa y es así como hasta hoy sigue trabajando de manera diligente y ha incrementado cada vez más la mercadería de frutas que ofrece.Diariamente ella los comercializa en su pequeño puesto habilitado en su domicilio alquilado y el mejor de los días para la venta de sus deliciosas frutas son los días domingos.Nancy espera cada día consolidar más el bienestar de su familia y con el tiempo albergar el sueño de la casa propia; es por ello que también su esposo trabaja arduamente Nancy desea seguir trabajando y solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de frutas y con las ganancias que obtenga incrementar el bienestar y educación de sus pequeños en etapa escolar.Apoya a esta joven madre y a su familia a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of a larger quantity of fruits to offer to her neighbors and the general public.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
In addition to selling cold drinks, Clarisa R. also sells coffee and breakfast pastries and sweets. She works together with her neighbor who sells fast food. People who come to buy the food also like to buy a cold drink, and they have a strong customer base with the university students who come to their stands every day around lunch.

Clarisa has been doing this work for 35 years, starting with only 71 dollars, which were her savings from working as a housecleaner before she started her business. Her business started out from a little wooden stand covered in plastic, many years ago when they were building the central market of Leon. Her husband, who worked on a farm with dairy cows, selling the milk very early in the morning to local clients, and later selling cold drinks in the market, helps her in the business. He continues to sell milk, but now his main business is selling juices and breakfasts to people before work.

They have invested their loans in their business. With this work they support their family. Their 4 children attend school. They've used the loans for 2 1/2 years, and are at the point now where their business is strong and can survive thanks to the money they were loaned. Their business is growing every day, and it's had a great impact on their economic well being. They hope to continue to provide a better quality of life for their children.

La Señora Clarisa R. además de vender refrescos vende café con leche y pan para desayuno, golosinas y los mas fuerte es la venta de sus famosos refrescos. Se ayuda con su vecina que vende comida rápida, por lo tanto quienes llegan a comprar comida a la vez compran el refresco y podemos decir que tiene muchos clientes fijos entre ellos universitarios que visitan el puesto todos los dias a la hora del almuerzo.

Tiene 35 años de trabajar en este negocio y comenzó con un capital de 71 dólares, estos eran sus ahorros de los servicios domésticos que hacía antes de encargarse a vender refrescos...trabajaba de empleada doméstica.

Su negocio inició debajo de cuatro estacas de madera cubiertas de plástico negro, esto fue hace muchos años cuando construyeron el mercado Central de León. Con la ayuda de su esposo que trabajaba en una finca ordeñando vacas y vendiendo leche a las 5 de la mañana a clientes fijos, luego se iba al mercado a vender frescos, cuando en ese tiempo un vaso de jugo natural tenia un costo de 0.50 centavos de córdobas la unnidad. Luego remodelaron el mercado y fué ubicada en el actual tramo donde desarrolla esta actividad. A la vez ellos siguen vendiendo leche pero ahora su principal negocio es vender jugos y desayuno preparado para quienes deseen alimentarse antes de trabajar.

Sus créditos los invierte exactamente en su negocio de frescos. Con este trabajo su familia se ayuda pues es el unico sustento que tienen, ella tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar. Lleva 2½ años trabajando con los créditos, en total a manejado 20 créditos que le han servido ya que lo que le da su negocio puede sobrevivir y gracias al dinero que le prestan. Ha crecido cada vez más ya que con frescos, ahora tienen gaseosas, vende mas leche. ha tenido gran impacto en su actividad económica y espera seguir así para dar mejor vida a sus hijos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TROPICAL FRUIT JUICES TO STOCK THEIR BUSINESS, AND CONTINUE TO IMPROVE THEIR ECONOMIC SITUATION AND SUPPORT THEIR FOUR CHILDREN.

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es:
Problems and money shortages never defeated HIlda, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. That's why since she was 30 years old, she has been selling clothing. Years ago, she had a small stand, but she could not make enough to cover the rent. Because of the difficult situation facing her family, she decided to sell her garments door to door and in markets. Little by little, she began to sell her items at the local fairs. Now things are picking up and she would like to establish herself in a commercial location so her knitted pieces, designed entirely by her, will be better displayed and appreciated. HIlda has big goals that motivate her. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She appreciates your great support.

Los problemas y la escasez económica nunca derrotaron a Hilda que siempre ha buscado la manera de acabar con los obstáculos para salir adelante y es por ello que desde hace treinta años se viene dedicando al comercio de prendas de vestir.En años anteriores tenía un local comercial pero el alquiler no compensaba las ganancias que percibía, es debido a esto que decidió vender sus artículos de manera ambulante por la difícil situación que afrontaba su familia y poco a poco inició comercializando sus prendas en las ferias locales de su zona.Hasta ahora está bien y piensa establecerse en un local comercial para que sus artículos tejidos y diseñadas enteramente por ella sean también apreciados en este espacio. Ahora Hilda tiene grandes anhelos que la motivan a seguir adelante; solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de más mercadería. Así mismo te agradece tu gran aporte.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS SELLING KNITTED GARMENTS TO THE PEOPLE IN HUANCAINO.

loans.name: Martha Adilia

texts.es:
Martha began her business with the help of her partner and her children, renting a space for her business. However, they decided it was better to get a loan to purchase the space. The infrastructure of this location is not ideal, and many times when it rains everything gets soaked, even though she continues to sell her things as best she can.

She began her business with only 2 tables and 8 chairs, and now she has 6 tables with their own chairs. She wants to be able to grow her business more and improve the condition of the space. With the high costs involved she can't do this without support. Martha has worked with CEPRODEL since 2005, and has had 8 previous loans which were paid back. For Martha, her business, together with the help from the loans, has made a huge difference, and she appreciates the support she has been given.

Martha inicia con ayuda de su compañero y sus hijos alquilando un local para el negocio, sin embargo se decidieron por un prestamo bancario para comprar el local. La infraestructura del local no es la apropiada, muchas veces cuando llueve se moja pero da gracias a Dios que aun bajo estas condiciones no deja de vender.

Su negocio al inicio constaba apenas de 2 mesas y 8 sillas, y ahora ya tiene 6 mesas cada una con sus respctivas sillas, sin embargo en sus planes esta crecer mas y lograr una mejor condicion en la infraestructura de su local, ya que por ahora no la ha hecho debido a los costos altos que esto implica.

Desde el 2005 Martha trabaja con CEPRODEL, teniendo un record ded 8 creditos. Para ela el trabajo en conjunto Institucion-Cliente ha sido de gran trascendencia en su negocio, y agradece a CEPRODEL el apoyo que le ha brindado.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS AND CONTINUE TO GROW , MAKING NECESSARY IMPROVEMENTS ON THE LOCATION TO STOP LEAKS.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is 45 years old, married and has five children. She has applied for a loan to buy tools and chemicals she needs for her plantation. She sells her crops at the local market, where she makes a profit of 240 Tala (or $96 US) per week. She also sells vegetables from her garden to supplement her income, which helps with her family’s finances. She appreciates the support she receives from these loans, and hopes to participate in the loan program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz Maria is very creative and has a good eye for combining colors, which make her resulting works of embroidery both pleasing and beautiful. She has been developing her skills since she was eight, when she was taught by her mother and grandmother. Today she teaches other people who help her cover her orders. Each job requires considerable labor, which is why the cost corresponds to the width of the embroidery requested. For her part, Luz Maria is very pleased and content with her job because it allows her to care for her children, making sure they are prepared for life and acting as their only unconditional supporter. She has plans to improve her embroidery shop and get it running with the necessary materials; she is requesting a loan to solidify these dreams. Let’s support this diligent mother so she can get ahead in her self-sacrificing and generous role.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Luz Maria, es muy creativa y tiene muy buenos criterios para combinar los colores haciendo que sus trabajos tengan resultados muy bellos y armoniosos en cada bordado de fustanes que realiza; viene desarrollando este oficio desde que tenía ocho años, su madre y su abuela le enseñaron y hoy enseña a otras personas que la apoyan a cubrir los pedidos que tiene.Cada trabajo posee un considerable esfuerzo y es por esta razón que el pago es deacuerdo al ancho del bordado que se solicita.Por su parte Luz Maria se siente satisfecha y muy contenta de desarrollar este oficio porque le permite cuidar de sus dos hijos porque quiere que ellos se preparen para afrontar la vida y más aún porque en ella tienen el único apoyo incondicional.Tiene planes de mejorar su taller de bordados e implementarla de los materiales necesarios y solicita un préstamo para poder concretar estos anhelos. Apoya a diligente madre para que pueda seguir adelante con su abnegado rol.

loans.use: Formation of a shop with the materials needed to create the finest works

loans.name: Talitai

texts.en: Talitai is a 49-year-old woman with three children. She is divorced, raising her children on her own, and has come to us for a loan to buy the tools and chemicals she needs to run her plantation. She supports her family by selling her crops at the local market, mostly on weekends, and nets a profit of 320 Tala (or $128 US) per week. In recent years, her business has grown, thanks to the help she is now getting from her oldest son. This increased income has helped her family a lot, and she hopes to do even better in the future, thanks to financial assistance such as this loan.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Aiga Penese

texts.en: Aiga is a 41-year-old married woman with seven children. She has applied for a loan to buy the fertilizers and tools she needs to run her plantation. She tells us that this loan will make a huge difference in her ability to run her business. In the future, she hopes to come to us for additional loans so that she can continue to grow her business, and improve her life and the lives of the members of her family.

loans.use: To buy tools and fertilizers for her plantation

loans.name: Marina Susana

texts.es:
