Doña Marina is a very talented woman in the kitchen, and she is always attentive to serving the neighbors the various stews that she offers in her humble restaurant, which she has lovingly named “Carmencita.” She has had the restaurant for the last two years, but began her sales in the street, serving in Tupperware. With time, her income grew and now she is one of the most enterprising women in the neighborhood, going forward every day with her daily menus. She also provides room and board at modest prices to those who request it. With her everyday exceptional service and her good taste, her loyal customers continually gather to enjoy her rich stews. She wishes to open another restaurant as a second branch in order to continue to grow, motivated by her desire to bring her children the best in education. She is asking for a loan that she will invest in purchasing ingredients for the preparation of her daily dishes. Your support of Doña Marina will be of great help and her children are grateful for your brotherly and unselfish support.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Marina, es una mujer muy talentosa en la cocina y siempre está muy atenta a servir a sus vecinos con los variados potajes que ofrece en su humilde restaurante al cual ha llamado con mucho cariño, Carmencita. Desde hace doce años tiene este restaurante, comenzó vendiendo comida en la calle ofreciéndolos en tapers, con el tiempo capitalizó sus ganancias y ahora es una de las mujeres más emprendedoras de su barrio y cada día sale adelante con la venta de menús y también da pensión a precios muy módicos a todo aquel que lo solicite.Con la buena atención que ofrece cada día y la buena sazón, tiene clientes fieles que siempre acuden a consumir sus ricos potajes. Ella desea abrir otro restaurante como sucursal y seguir creciendo y esto es porque está motivada a brindar a sus dos hijos lo mejor para su formación académica.solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus menús. Recuerda tu apoyo para Doña Marina será de mucha ayuda y sus hijos te agradecen por tu solidaria y desinteresada ayuda.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of non-perishable goods to continue preparing her delicious food

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is 24 years old, married and has three children. She is her family's sole means of support, and their garden is their only source of income. She sells her produce in the local market and makes a profit of 160 Tala (or $64) per week. She can raise her income by increasing the output of her farm, and has come to us for a loan to buy the equipment and materials she needs to make that possible.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and tools for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
From the time he was very young, Oscar was raised by his dear old grandmother, Bety, who has a small grocery store. Thanks to the role she so efficiently played, she was able to offer her loving grandson an education and economic means. Now, unfortunately, Bety finds herself in delicate health, and Oscar, her exemplary grandson, has decided to leave his studies for a time so that he can responsibly dedicate himself to running the expanding store and to making sure that it is the best-stocked store in the area. His wish is to acquire a sales counter and to increase the variety of merchandise so that when his grandmother gets better, she will feel comfortable, proud, and pleased with the results that Oscar got during his time as manager. To make his hopes a reality, he is requesting a loan that he promises to repay within six months. This responsible grandson turns to your support to help keep his little grocery store growing.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer

Oscar, desde muy pequeño creció junto a su anciana y querida abuelita Bety, quien tiene una bodeguita de abarrotes; gracias a este oficio que desempeñaba eficientemente pudo ofrecerle a su amoroso nieto educación y solvencia económica, pero ahora, desafortunadamente, Bety, se encuentra delicada de salud y desde entonces, Oscar, su ejemplar nieto decidió dejar por un tiempo sus estudios superiores, para dedicarse responsablemente a la administración de este negocio que muy impetuosamente está sacando adelante, y haciendo de este lugar el más concurrido de su zona.Su deseo es adquirir un mostrador y aumentar aún más la variedad de su mercadería, para cuando su abuelita mejore pueda sentirse cómoda, orgullosa y muy satisfecha por los resultados que pueda obtener durante este tiempo y para concretar sus deseos solicita un préstamo y así mismo promete reembolsarlos en un lapso de seis meses. Este responsable nieto recurre a tu apoyo para seguir desarrollándose día a día con su pequeña despensa.

loans.use: Purchase a shop counter as well as a greater variety and quantity of highly needed goods

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es:
Elvin is a hard-working man that has sacrificed much and dedicated himself to his business since its inception. His initial investment capital was the result of a family collection, as his economic situation was not good at the time.

Today, his sacrifice has borne out, and besides being a respected worker and owner, he is also a model father to his to children (one in primary school and one infant). His wife, for her part, encourages him to continue forward for himself as well as for the well-being of the entire family.

Since starting to work with CEPRODEL, Elvin’s business conditions have improved; he has seen additional gains since managing to acquire furniture and equipment for the store as well as increase his inventory. His record consists of thirteen credits in two years.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Elvin es un hombre trabajador que se ha dedicado a su negocio desde sus inicios con mucho sacrificio. Su primer capital invertido fue fruto de una recolecta familiar, ya que su situación económica no era nada buena en ese momento.

Hoy en día su sacrificio ha dado fruto y ademas de ser un digno propietario y trabajador, es a la vez un ejemplo de padre para sus dos hijos (1 estudiante de primaria y un bebe). Su esposa por su parte lo alienta a seguir adelante tanto por el mismo como por el bienestar de toda su familia.

Para Elvin, desde que inicio a trabajar con CEPRODEL sus condiciones en el negocio han mejorado, ha sido que ha tenido ventajas ya que ha logrado adquirir mobiliario y equipo asi como incrementar su inventario. Su récord es de 13 créditos en 2 años.

loans.use: Purchase of products and goods

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es:
Astrid is a fighting young woman with big dreams of prospering in life. When her parents divorced, she decided to leave home on her own in search of a better life. With the little money she had managed to save, she opened her little shop where she sells highly needed goods. Thanks to her diligence and dedication, the business has been growing little by little and gaining steady clients. Now, after much sacrifice and labor, her little store is generating a good income, allowing her to continue her law studies at the university and pursue her dreams of self-improvement. This exemplary girl’s wish is to increase the variety of her merchandise, and with the economic benefits that she earns, continue to fulfill her dreams of one day becoming a professional. To solidify her desires, she is requesting a loan. Let’s make it so this fighting spirit can persevere and obtain the better future she so desires.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Astrid, es una joven luchadora con muchos deseos de prosperar en la vida, desde que sus padres se divorciaron decidió independizarse y salir de su hogar en busca de un mejor porvenir, así con el poco ahorro que tenía en su poder aperturó su tiendita de venta de productos de primera necesidad, negocio que gracias a su diligencia, y dedicación ha ido creciendo poco a poco y obteniendo con el tiempo asiduos clientes.Ahora, después de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, ésta bodeguita le esta generando buenos ingresos económicos, permitiéndole así, en su afán de superación seguir sus estudios de derecho en universidad.El deseo de esta ejemplar muchacha es aumentar la variedad de su mercadería, y con los beneficios económicos que obtenga, seguir cubriendo sus sueños de ser algún día una excelente profesional, para concretar sus anhelos solicita un préstamo.Hagamos que este espíritu luchador siga perseverando para obtener un mejor porvenir.

loans.use: Purchase a wider quantity and variety of goods to sell in her shop

loans.name: Marta Nidia

texts.es:
Before starting her business, Marta Nidia worked in a shoe store, which is where she got the idea for her own business. She lacked the capital to start herself, so she saved some, and with the help of her ex-husband, managed to save $70 and started to work as a traveling salesperson in the Israel Lewites district in the city of Managua.

Her family – husband and children – is what drove her to look for a way to help with the monetary needs of the household, but after her separation, she is driven entirely by the need to sustain and educate her children.

Marta has worked with CEPRODEL for two years and feels that it has had a good impact on her working life as well as her income. The financing that has been granted has improved her inventory, and her inventory has led to successful financing. Her current record consists of thirteen credits, which have helped her progress in the last few years.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Marta Nidia trabajaba antes de tener su negocio en un local de venta de zapatos, de ahí surge la idea de su propio negocio. Sin embargo no contaba con el capital para empezar por si sola, es entonces que ahorra un poco y con la ayuda de su ex-esposo (asalariado) logra reunir U$70.00 y comenzar a vender por su cuenta de manera ambulante en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de managua.

Su familia (matrimonio e hijos) fue lo que la llevo a buscar como ayudar en las necesidades monetarias de su hogar, sin embargo luego de una separacion se dedico a trabajar por entero para el sustento de sus hijos y para la educación de los mismos.

Hace 2 años que Marta trabaja con CEPRODEL, y siente que ha tenido un buen impacto en su vida laboral como en sus ingresos, ya que con el financiamiento otorgado logra retroalimentar su inventario, su récord es de 13 créditos, mismos que la han hecho progresar en estos últimos años.

loans.use: Purchase shoes for merchandise

loans.name: Virginia Candelaria

texts.es:
In spite of her young age, Virginia is a hard-working, responsible girl. When she was little, she worked at selling kitchen condiments, and through such small activities, she’s tried to somehow bring income to her home to help with the most urgent expenses. Currently, with support from her dear father, she decided to set up a modest Internet café to serve the community, hoping that her beloved family would find economic stability and that she could pay her tuition. She is avidly studying obstetrics in her town's university. This exemplary young woman’s wish is to bring good service and convenience to her customers; to do this, she is requesting a loan that she will use for the annual maintenance on the computers so that her customers can continue to enjoy their benefits. She is committed to repaying your noble help in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Virginia, pese a su corta edad es una muchacha muy laboriosa y responsable, desde muy pequeña se dedicó a vender condimentos de cocina y a través de estas pequeñas actividades trataba de aportar de alguna manera ingresos económicos a su hogar para solventar los gastos más urgentes.Actualmente con el apoyo de su querido padre decidió instalar y brindar en su humilde hogar el servicio de Internet a toda su comunidad, con el fin de que su querida familia encuentre estabilidad económica, y sobre todo satisfacer los gastos que le demanda sus estudios superiores de Obstetricia que muy ávidamente sigue en la universidad de su ciudad. El deseo de esta ejemplar joven es brindar un buen servicio y comodidad a sus clientes, para esto solicita un préstamo que utilizará para otorgarle el mantenimiento anual a sus máquinas a fin de que puedan estar muy bien para que sus clientes sigan gozando de sus beneficios, comprometiéndose a retornar tu noble apoyo en un lapso de seis meses.

loans.use: Maintain computers to keep them functioning smoothly and problem-free

loans.name: Nightingale

texts.en: Nightingale is married with two children. Her husband is a very good fisherman, and four times a week Nightingale goes to the local market to sell the strings of fish he catches. She sells as many as six strings per day, and makes 180 Tala (or $72) each week. The more her husband catches, the more she can sell, which is why she has applied for a loan to buy fishing equipment such as spears, goggles and a new canoe. She is very happy with her business and the financial help that she gets from the loan program, because it has meant a big improvement in her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy new fishing gear

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
Olga Maria is constantly moving around the central market of Leon selling her products. She also participates in the fairs where handmade clothing is always in demand. She has had this business for 8 years, starting with an investment of just $100 thanks to her mother, who had the business originally and had Olga Maria working by her side. She began to create her handmade pieces back when she was in 6th grade, learning from her mother and selling her own pieces in order to help the family's financial situation. She used the money from her mother to buy merchandise and sold her pieces from the time she was young. Her mother worked as a seamstress from their house, creating all kinds of clothing and uniforms.

Later, her mother helped her set up a shop and turned the business over to Olga, who has done well with it, always participating in the social gatherings and national fairs to display her products. Olga is married and she and her husband support their children. She has had 7 loans which have helped her improve their quality of life. The loans are very helpful as they enable her to invest in the business and offer more variety to her customers.

La Sra. Martinez tiene productos a la venta que estan en constante movimiento dentro y fuera del mercado CENTRAL de León, ademas que ella siempre participa en ferias porque la ropa y las artes manuales son bien demandados, además ella tiene arte para elaborar todo tipo de prendas.

Tiene 8 años de tener el negocio y comenzó invirtiendo $ 100 gracias al aporte de su madre, porque inicialmente el negocio era de su mamá y ella trabajaba a su lado. Comenzó a elaborar sus artes manuales desde que estudiaba en 6to grado de primaria, agarraba dle negocio de su mamá y vendia por aparte para ayudarle economicamente a la familia, tambien del dinero que su mamá le daba compraba mercaderia y las vendia ambulante desde que era una niña. Luego trabajó con su mamá porque el negocio estaba en su casa (era costurera), elaboraban todo tipo de prensas de vestir, sobre todo los uniformes

Mas tarde su mama le ayudo a poner una tienda y le fué dejando en sus manos el negocio, así ha sobresalido, siempre ha participado en las tertulias del parque y ferias nacionales para exponer sus produtos.

Doña Olga actualmente es casada y con el esposo ayuda a sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ha trabajado con 7 créditos y esto le ha ayudado ya que de su crédito saca para la venta y de su ganancia para mejorar su condicion de vida. Ha sido muy util sobre todo porque el crédito es rápido y eso ayuda a invertir siempre en su negocio para tener mas variedad que ofrecer.

loans.use: TO BUY MATERIAL FOR HER HANDMADE CLOTHING, EXPANDING THE VARIETY SHE CAN OFFER HER CLIENTS.

loans.name: Elba Elena

texts.es:
Elba Elena sells clothing and cosmetics. She takes advantage of each season by selling clothing appropriate to that season; for example at the time when classes start, at Christmas, etc. She has been working in this type of business for 25 years and began with $50.00 that an aunt gave her. This business belonged to her aunt, and when she passed away she left it to Elba Elena. In the beginning she sold small things.

She began to working with her aunt when she was 20 years old. Her aunt left the business to her as an inheritance because Elba’s family is from the countryside and did not have the necessary conditions to live in a dignified manner. She has managed to get ahead, through her own effort, and she is very grateful for the loans she has received because with them she has been able to get her own stand inside the Central Market of León. It is a very small stand—she has a wooden table where she presents and offers her products.

Elba has been working with us for three years, and she has received 21 loans. These have allowed her to survive by herself, as she doesn’t have anyone to help her. She has managed to keep her business going and is always optimistic about getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ella Vende ropa, cosméticos...en la temporada vende lo que se amerita, ya que es una oportunidad de venta, como por ejemplo...en las temporadas de clases, navidad...etc. Lleva 25 años trabajando en el negocio y comenó con $50 que le regaló una tia. Este negocio era propio de su tía, y cuando ella faleció se lo dejo a doña Elba Elena...eran pequeñas cosas de costura las que se vendian inicialmente.

Ella comenzó a trabajar con su tia desde sus 20 años de edad, la tia se lo dejó com herencia ya que su familia es del campo y no tienen las condiciones necesarias para vivir dignamente. Ella por si sola ha salido adelante y esta muy agradecida con los créditos que se le han dado ya que con ellos ha logrado aquirir su módulo dentro del Mercado Central de León. Es un puesto bastante pequeño, ahi siempre pone su mesita de madera para presentar y ofrecer sus productos.

Lleva tres años trabajando con nosotros, ha adquirido 21 créditos y esto le ha permitido sobrevivir a ella isma ya que no tienen a nadie quien le ayude. Ha logrado mantener su negocio en marcha y siempre con el optimismo para salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise and shoes

loans.name: Tafaoganiua

texts.en: Tafaoganiua is 35 years old, married and has two children. She runs a plantation and sells her crops in the local market, where she earns a profit of 240 Tala (or $96) every week. Tafaoganiua has applied for a loan to buy the tools and fertilizers she needs to run her business. These supplies will be extremely helpful to her and especially to her husband, who does most of the manual work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Maritza Lizet

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza Lizet Sáenz B. is a native of the city of Bluefields. She is 35-years-old and is married to Oscar Selva. They have 4 children. Mrs. Sáenz has sold cosmetics through a catalog for more than 5 years. Her clients are men and women of all ages who prefer her because of her specialized service and because she comes to their homes to make sales. Mrs. Sáenz needs to buy: 7 units of women’s perfume at $10 each, 1 unit of eye shadow for $3, 1 eyebrow pencil for $4, 1 unit of lip gloss for $2, 1 unit of face mask for $3, 5 units of face cream at $14 each, 2 units of hair gel at $3 each, 1 unit of hair conditioner for $3, 1 toothbrush for $2, 1 unit of liquid soap for $5, 1 unit of vitamins for $6, 1 shirt for $13, 1 unit of body spray for $5, and 1 unit of deodorant for $4. With this investment, she will be able to offer a variety of products to her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Maritza Lizet Sáenz B. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Oscar Selva, ambos tienen 4 hijos. La Sra. Sáenz tiene mas de 5 años de vender cosméticos por catalogo, sus clientes son hombre y mujeres de todas las edades que la prefieren por dar un servicio a domicilio y especializado. La Sra. Sáenz necesita comprar : 7 unidades de perfumes para mujeres a $ 10.00 dólares cada perfume, 1 unidad de sombra para ojos a $3.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de lápiz para cejas a $4.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de brillo labial a $2.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidades de mascarillas para el rostro a $3.00 dólares la unidad, 5 unidades de cremas para el rostro a $ 14.00 dólares cada unidad, 2 unidades de loción para cabello a $3.00 dólares cada unidad, 1 unidad de acondicionador para el cabello a $3.00 dólares cada unidad, 1 unidad de cepillo de diente a $ 2.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de jabón liquido a $ 5.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de vitaminas a $ 6.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de camisa a $ 13.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de spray para el cuerpo a $5.00 dólares la unidad, 1 unidad de desodorante a $4.00 dólares la unidad, con esta inversión podrá ofertar variedad de productos para su clientela.

loans.use: To buy:  perfume, eye shadow, eybrow pencil, lip gloss, face masks, face cream, mascara, conditioner, deodorant, liquid soap, a toothbrush, vitamins, shirts, and body spray.

loans.name: Tausinioga

texts.en: Tausinioga is 41 years old and married with six children. She runs a business selling flowers at a local market and is very interested in improving her garden, which is where she spends most of her time. During the years in which she has run her business, Tausinioga has established a great reputation as a gardener and customers now come to her home regularly to make their purchases. She has applied for a loan of $300 to buy the materials she needs to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy potted plants, fertilizer and other supplies for her flower garden

loans.name: Saumaleula

texts.en: Saumaleula is a married and the mother of two children. She is a long-term participant in SPBD’s loan program, because she makes repayments regularly and follows the program’s rules and policies very carefully and honestly. She has applied for a new loan to buy ingredients for her popular popsicle-making business, and to repair the roof on her house and its bathroom. She is happy with the support she has received from our loan program because it has helped her achieve a big improvement in her family's living standards. She hopes to remain in the program for a long time and continue the improvement she has achieved in recent years.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her popsicle-making business and for home improvement

loans.name: Nia

texts.en: Nia is 58 years old, married and has six children. She is very talented at making elei (a traditional Samoan printing material) prints, a skill she acquired last year at a seminar held in her village. She is applying for her first loan to buy the materials and tools needed to start a small printing business. She plans to sell her elei materials to shops in town as well as take orders at her home from her fellow villagers. In the future, she hopes to apply for a second loan that will allow her to expand her business by building a small room where she will practice her craft.

loans.use: To buy tools and materials for her new elei-printing business

loans.name: Ramona Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Ramona del Rosario buys fruits from farmers and sells them in the morning at the Central Market of León. She has 20 years of experience in this business, beginning with an investment of $286 that she used to buy a large aluminum container and wooden table to sell her products outside the market. When the market was renovated, she succeeded in using her first credit to obtain a stall. Little by little her business has grown, and she wishes to improve its facilities.

Before she had this business, she helped her grandmother sell food, fruit and meals in the street. She also washed the clothing of wealthier people.

She told us that she is surprised by the growth that she has experienced. Through her business, he has successfully helped her children to get ahead, and she cares for two grandchildren who want for nothing and are well fed. She feels proud to be a successful businesswoman who knows how to manage her money, her earnings, and her credit. In the last three years, she has received nineteen credits, and without these, she could not have experienced the growth in sales brought by the increase in income and her investments.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Ramona del Rosario, compra las frutas a los finqueros y los vende por las mañanas en el mercado Central de León. Tiene 20 años de trabajar en este negocio y comenzó invirtiendo $286. 00, compró un recipiente grande de aluminio y una mesa de madera para ofrecer sus productosa orillas del mercado. Luego con la remodelacion del mercado logró acceder a su primer crédito para conseguir un módulo.

Poco a poco va creciendo su negocio y desea mas a modificar la infraestructura.

Antes de tener este negocio ella ayudaba a su abuelita a vender comida, frutas y comestibles en la calle, tambien lavaba ropa a la gente que tiene mejores posibilidades económicas.

Ella nos comenta que se encuentra sorprendida por el crecimiento que ha tenido, ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos con su negocio, tiene 2 nietos a su carga y a ellos no les falta nada, estan bien alimentados y se siente orgullosa de ser una mujer emprendedora, se considera una mujer empresaria, que sabe administrar bien su dinero, sus ganancias y su crédito. Que si no fuera por los 19 creditos que ha obtenido en estos tres años.

Los ingresos obtenidos de sus ventas van aumentando gracias a lo que invierte.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables for retail sale

loans.name: Xiomara De Jesus

texts.es:
This lady sells a variety of household electronics; some she sells at a stand, and others she sells in the street, offering her products door-to-door. She has eighteen years of experience in sales, and her business has grown little by little. She recalls that she began her business with $715, the inheritance left to her and her husband by his parents.

She began selling hardware underneath a tree in the street, then she moved on to the “Choluteca” market and sold hardware and appliances on the edges of the street. Later, they built the Metropolitan Center and she was located in a flight of stairs where she proceeded to sell electronics.

Currently, she is in a hall passage in the Central Market of León, but the space is very tight and there is not enough room to display all the goods she has in stock. That’s why she wants to keep working hard to purchase a larger stall that is both bigger and more presentable to her customers. She expects to continue energetically working so that she can care for her mother and provide for herself and her children.

Doña Xiomara has worked for three years with 35 credits and has known how to administer them wisely. They have allowed her to improve the conditions of her life, keep her business strong, and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora tiene en su negocio una variedad de electrodomesticos, vende en el módulo una parte y la otra parte la vende en la calle, ofreciendo de puerta a puerta los productos. Tiene 18 años de trabajar con ventas y poco a poco ha ido creciendo recuerda que inició con 715 dólares que fué la herencia que los padres del esposo les dejaron.

Inició en la calle bajo un arbol vendiendo artículos de ferretería, luego pasó al mercado "Choluteca" que estaba construido de latas y vendía a las orillas de la calle. Comenzando a vender parte de electrodomésticos y ferreteria. Luego se construyo el Centro Metropolitana y la ubicaron en un tramo quedandode con la venta de electrodomesticos.

Actualmente está en un tramo del mercado Central de León, pero el espacio es muy pequeño y no hay lugar para exibir sus artículos, todo lo tiene en caja. Por eso quiere seguir trabajando duro para comprar un módulo mas grande...con mas espacio y mas presentable para sus clientes. Prentende seguir trabajando con muchas energias para poder darle cuidado a su mamá y mantenerse ella y sus hijos porque es una señora viuda.

Doña Xiomara ha trabajado tres años con 35 créditos y los ha sabido administrar bien, esto le ha permitido mejorar sus condiciones de vida, mantener su negocio e incrementar las ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Altagracia López

texts.en:
Altagracia is 60 years old, single, and the mother of three children: two boys and a girl. They have all grown up and have made their own homes. She is living alone and selling fried bananas, potatoes, and fried chicken to earn a living. She says that she can’t count on her children’s help to survive. In fact, she receives money from her children, but not regularly, and it’s not enough to bear all her expenses. The fried goods are her principal source of income.

Altagracia hopes she can increase her income and improve her stock of necessary items. She is asking for funds to buy a large amount of raw materials in order to prepare more food and, as a result, get more clients. Given the loan, the entrepreneur will have sufficient money to meet her needs and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to continue preparing and selling fried vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Seleue

texts.en: Seleue and her husband are hard-working people who do not want to rely on family members overseas to help them financially. Her husband fishes and tends to their plantation while Seleue runs a small business making elei (or traditional Samoan) prints. They sell their crops, catches and artwork at the market, where they can make 500 Tala (or $200) a week. They are happy because their lives are improving thanks to their hard work and assistance from SBPD. They hope that their lives will continue to improve, and have applied for a loan of $375 to buy materials and supplies they need for their two business to make that possible.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies to make prints and for her plantation

loans.name: Siti Mujiani

texts.id:
Every day from 5:00 AM to 12:00 PM, Siti Mujiani is selling vegatables in Kepaon market. Distance from her home to the market is 15 minutes by motor cycle. Since she is selling vegetables, she has to prepare it fresh. In the evening, she prepared the vegetables for next day's sale. She bought it from a wholesaler in Badung market by the kilograms. Profit from this business is about Rp80,000 (about US$8.40)/day. This income very much help her husband who works as a taxi driver, with no fix income. Siti has 4 children with daily expenses of Rp40,000 (about US$4.20)/day, and education expense of Rp300,000 (about US$32)/month.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap hari dari pukul 05.00 pagi sampai dengan 12.00 siang Siti Mujiani berjualan sayuran di Pasar Kepaon. Jarak yang dia harus tempuh menuju pasar dari kediamannya adalah 15 menit dengan menggunakan sepeda motor. Karena yang dia jual adalah sayur, maka dia harus menyediakannya dalam keadaan segar. Sore hari sebelumnya ia menyediakan sayuran yang akan dijual keesokan harinya. Ia membelinya di pengepul di Pasar Badung dengan harga kiloan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari usaha ini sebesar Rp 80.000,00/hari. Hal ini sangat membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai sopir taksi dengan penghasilan yang tidak tetap. Siti memiliki 4 orang anak dengan biaya hidup perhari Rp 40.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak sebesar Rp 300.000,00 per bulan.

loans.use:
To pay shop rent in market

Bayar sewa toko di pasar

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old. She is married and has two children. She is living in a rented house. She has a small sewing project in her house. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric to make clothes to sell to the customers near her house. She wants to increase her income and save for a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
After graduating from school Shoira A. got married. Her husband used to work seasonally (he helped his uncle to grow grapes). After the birth of their 4th child, Shoira had to begin trading at the market while her oldest daughter took care of the children. Initially, Shoira purchased goods from wholesale traders, but the prices were very high when she had to take out loans. In the summer of 2006, she found out about a credit program called "Microinvest". After receiving her first loan, she was able to secure lower prices for the goods she purchased wholesale, which allowed her to gain additional income. One part of the income was spent on family needs and the remaining part Shoira invested in her business. In order to be more competitive in her business, she plans to travel to Bishkek (Kyrgyz Republic) to purchase goods. This way, she will expand to a wholesale business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Аюбчонова Шоира после окончания средней школы вышла замуж. Муж клиентки имел сезонные заработки (помогал своему дяде выращивать виноград). После рождения четвертого ребенка в семье Шоира вынуждена была выйти на базар торговать оставив детей на попечение старшей дочки. Сначала она приобрела товар у оптовиков под реализацию, но стоимость товара был гораздо выше чем по наличке. В середине 2006г она узнала о программе кредитования «Микроинвест». Получив первый кредит она приобрела товар у оптовиков по более низким ценам, что позволило ей получить дополнительную прибыль. Часть прибыли она тратила на нужды семьи, а оставшуюся часть вложила в свой бизнес. Чтобы быть более конкурентноспособным она намеревается ездить сама за товаром в Бишкек (Республика Кыргизстан), что позволить ей перейти в оптовую торговлю товарами.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru:
Mehriniso S. has been married for the past 17 years. She has two daughters and a son.

After the Soviet Union collapsed the fabric where she worked closed. Her husband is a school teacher and his salary is $32 per month. Like thousands of other women in Istaravshan, Mehriniso had to begin a retail business. Currently, she needs financial assistance to build a roof over her trading spot. She will use the rest of the money to widen the assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Сохибова Мехринисо замужем уже 17 лет. Имеет 2 дочьки и сына. После распада СССР чулочная фабрика на которой работала Мехринисо закрылась.. Муж клиентки преподаватель средней школы и его заработок 32 долл.в месяц. Она вынуждена была, как и тысячи женщины Истаравшана занятся розничной торговлей. На данный момент она нуждается финансовой поддержке и хочет обогреть целлофаном и шифером свое рабочее место и на оставшуюся часть расширить ассортимент товара..

loans.use: Build a roof over the trading spot

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru:
Mutabar A. Obidovna has been selling children's clothing for the past 7 years. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a member of a civilian company. He is receiving a very small pension. After the birth of their youngest child Mutabar had to start selling on the market leaving her children under the care of her oldest daughter. In the beginning, she was buying goods wholesale in credit, but the cost was much higher than buying them retail. In 2006 Mutabar first found out about MicroInvest credit lending. She then took out a loan and was able to buy goods wholesale for lower prices which allowed her to make some profit. She was spending part of her income on the needs of her family and reinvested the rest in her business. To be more competitive, Mutabar intends to travel to Bishkek, the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, which will allow her to start selling wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедова Муътабар Обидовна в течение 7 лет торгует детской одеждой. Замужем.Имеет 3 детей. Муж участник гражданской компании. Получает мизерную пенсию. После рождения четвертого ребенка в семье Муътабар вынуждена была выйти на базар торговать оставив детей на попечение старшей дочки. Сначала она приобрела товар у оптовиков под реализацию, но стоимость товара был гораздо выше чем по наличке. В середине 2006г она узнала о программе кредитования «Микроинвест». Получив первый кредит она приобрела товар у оптовиков по более низким ценам, что позволило ей получить дополнительную прибыль. Часть прибыли она тратила на нужды семьи, а оставшуюся часть вложила в свой бизнес. Чтобы быть более конкурентноспособным она намеревается ездить сама за товаром в Бишкек (Республика Кыргизстан), что позволить ей перейти в оптовую торговлю товарами.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Heri

texts.id:
This gentlemen born April 21 1981 started his business a year ago. Materials he needs are leftover leather from jackets or bags. He sees a market opportunity in this business is good. Profit could reach up to Rp650,000 (about US$70)/month. Finished product is being sold in Sukowati Art market and several artshops in Kuta area. His wife is also a leather artist. Income could reach Rp400,000 (about US42)/month. Those incomes are sufficient to pay for daily expenses of Rp20,000 (about US$21)/day. Their 2 children need education for their future. This made Heri to expand his business, especially this business is their single only hope.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Pria kelahiran 21 April 1981 ini memulai usahanya setahun yang lalu. Bahan yang dia perlukan adalah kulit sisa dari hasil pembuatan jaket atau tas. Dia melihat peluang pasar untuk usahanya ini bagus. Keuntungan yang dia peroleh mencapai Rp 650.000,00/bulan. Produk yang sudah siap, dipasarkan di Pasar Sukowati dan di beberapa artshop di daerah Kuta. Sang isteri juga bekerja sebagai pengrajin gelang kulit. Penghasilannya mencapai Rp 400.000,00/bulan. Penghasilannya tersebut dapat mencukupi biaya hidup per hari yang sebesar Rp 20.000,00. Dua orang anak yang mereka miliki memerlukan pendidikan untuk masa depan mereka. Hal ini mengharuskan Heri mengembangkan usaha ini. Apalagi usaha ini merupakan satu – satunya harapan mereka.

loans.use:
To buy raw materials

Membeli bahan baku berupa

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo Y., aged 32, works purchasing and reselling cows with her husband to earn about $8 per day collectively.  She has three children who are all students.  She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase additional cows to increase her inventory and meet customer demands.  She believes this will lead to greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family.  In the future, she would like to reinvest the earnings generated by this loan back into her business to purchase additional cows and increase their income further.  They plan to use the increased income to fund their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows to raise and resell for profit.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
Munira Shukurilloevna I. has been trading at the market for 16 years. She is divorced and lives with her parents. She dreams of purchasing her own home. The income she receives from her business is not sufficient in order to get a loan, so she plans to purchase a piece of land and begin building a house. During the past two years she has been part of Kiva and has been an exemplary client. Because of the cold weather, she plans to widen the assortment of goods by purchasing warm jeans.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Иброхимова Мунира Шукуриллоевна в течение 16 лет торгует на рынке. Разведена. Живет с родителями. Мечтает обзавестись собственным жильем. Доход получаемый от бизнеса не достаточен для сформирования ипотечного капитала, поэтому она собирается выкупить земельный участок и постепенно возводить дом. В течение последних 2 лет кредитуется в фонде и является образцовой клиенткой. В связи с наступлением холодов она намерена расширить свой ассортимент посредством приобретения утепленных джинсовых брюк.

loans.use: Purchase of warm jeans

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Mrs. Tum S., aged 30, works on her farm growing and selling her crops to earn about $2 per day in income.  Her husband wants to become a motor-taxi driver to earn around $3 per day in revenue.  Their two children are students.  She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to operate a business and increase the family’s income.  She will use the remainder of the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to start a taxi service as well as seeds and fertilizer for her crop growing business.

loans.name: Roziya

texts.ru:
After the Soviet Union collapsed and the factory where she worked became bankrupt, Roziya Sulaimonovna I. had to begin trading. She started in 1992 by selling children's clothing. Currently, she has a trading location on the central clothes market. When she travels for goods to Karasu (Kyrgyz Republic) her daughter replaces her at the market. Her business is the main source of income for the family. After her son's marriage in the summer of this year, her capital base has decreased, and now she is looking to raise back the capital base and is therefore asking for financial support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Ибрагимова Розия Сулаймоновна после развала СССР и банкротства чулочной фабрики была вынуждена заниматься предпринимательской деятельностью. Свою деятельность она начинала 1992 году розничной продажей детской одежды. На данный момент она обустроила свою торговую точку в центральном вещевом рынке. Когда она едет за товаром в Карасу (Республика Киргызстан) 2 раза в месяц, дочка заменяет ее. Данный бизнес является основным источником дохода семье. После женитьбы сына летом этого года оборотный капитал у нее уменьшился и чтобы восполнить оборотный капитал она нуждается в финансовой поддержке.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Tuti

texts.ru:
Tuti H. has been a business woman for over 7 years, and her business is the main source of income for her family. In her family, 5 people do not work and depend on her income (husband, son, son's wife and 2 grandchildren). Tuti needs financial assistance because she wants to purchase shoes wholesale for her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Хаитова Тути занимается предпринимательской деятельностью более 7 лет и ее бизнес является основным источником доходов в семье. В семье имеет 5 иждивенца (невестка, 2 внука, муж и сын). На данный момент она нуждается финансовой поддержке и хочет оптом приобрести товар у оптовиков по низкой цене.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of shoes

loans.name: Mashura

texts.ru:
Mashura J. has been involved in an entrepreneurial business for 6 years. She got married after graduating from a technical school and has 4 children. Mashura's husband helps her with the business. She buys goods from local wholesale dealers and sells them retail. She needs a loan to renew the assortment of the clothes for the coming season. She also keeps a job as an accountant for the joint venture "Gulbogh". Mashura J. is a responsible, punctual person.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Чабборова Машхура после окончания техникума вышла замуж. Опыт прдепр инимательской деятельности 6 лет. Имеет 4 детей. Муж клиентки помогает ей по бизнесу. Товар приобретает у местных оптовиков и перепродает в розницу. В связи с сезонностью у нее возникли финансовые потребности для обновления ассортимента. Является бухгалтером группы солидарной ответственности «Гулбог». Ответственная и пунктуальная.

loans.use: Purchase of modern clothes.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru:
Muhayo J. has been selling fabric for 7 years. She is married with 6 children. Her husband is doing odd driving jobs which don't provide a stable income for the family. After her 5th and 6th child were born Muhayo had to start trading at the market leaving the kids in her mother-in-law's care. At first she bought some fabric from a wholesale dealer to sell retail. In the beginning of 2006 she found out about the "Microinvest" loan program. With her first loan from "Microinvest" she was able to start buying and transporting goods from the wholesale store "Atush" in the Hagend city. Now she sells her goods to small retail vendors in the villages which is beneficial to all parties involved. She spends a part of her profit for her family needs and uses the rest of it to benefit the business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Sheyner, Kiva Volunteer.

Чурабоева Мухайё Иркабоевна в течение 7 лет торгует тканями. Замужем. Имеет 6 детей. Муж работает на частном извозе и при этом не имеет постоянного дохода. После рождения пятого и шестого ребенка в семье Мухайе вынуждена была выйти на базар торговать оставив детей на попечение свекрови. Сначала она приобрела товар у оптовиков под реализацию. В начале 2006г она узнала о программе кредитования «Микроинвест». Получив первый кредит она начала сама привозить товар из оптового рынка «Атуш» г.Худжанда. Теперь она сама дает под реализацию мелким торговцам из кишлаков, что взаимовыгодно обоим сторонам. Часть прибыли она тратит на нужды семьи, а оставшуюся часть направляет в свой бизнес.

loans.use: to purchase new fabric.

loans.name: Ruon

texts.en: Mrs. Ruon Sinoeun, aged 26, is a housewife who helps her husband with his work.  Her husband works as a fish broker, buying and selling fish to earn about $8 per day in revenue.  They have two young children who are both students.  She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase a large quantity of fish to expand their business.  This will allow them to take advantage of cost savings by buying in bulk, thus raising their profit margins.  The increase in their inventory will also meet growing customer demands and increase their revenue and income overall.  They plan to use the increased income to reinvest in their business and fund their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to expand their business.

loans.name: P. Herlin

texts.id:
Herlin has been in Bali since 1988. However his meatball business he started in 2004. Every day he prepared his items and also sells it. He sells it by travelling from one village to another using a push cart. Daily income is about Rp75,000 (about Us$8)/day, with nett profit of Rp50,000 (about US$5.25). As head of household, Herlin is responsible for his wife and 1 child. His wife is stay at home mom, and his child sits in 5th grade. Herlin hopes that his business could expand well. Daily expense of Rp20,000 (Us$2.10) and room rent of Rp115,000 (about US$12)/month is one of his calculations.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Herlin sudah sejak tahun 1988 berada di Bali. Sedangkan usaha bakso ini baru dimulainya pada tahun 2004. Setiap hari dia mempersiapkan barang dagangannya sekaligus menjualnya. Dia menjualnya dengan cara berkeliling dari satu kampung ke kampung yang lain menggunakan rombong. Keuntungan yang dia peroleh mencapai Rp 75.000,00/hari dengan keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp 50.000,00. Sebagai kepala keluarga, Herlin bertanggung jawab menghidupi seorang isteri dan satu orang anaknya. Isterinya sebagai ibu rumah tangga, sedangkan anaknya masih duduk di bangku sekolah dasar kelas 5. Herlin berharap usahanya ini dapat berkembang dengan baik. Biaya hidup per hari sebesar Rp 20.000,00 dan biaya sewa kos sebesar Rp 115.000,00/bulan menjadi salah satu pertimbangannya.

loans.use:
To buy a pushcart

Membeli rombong.

loans.name: Agus

texts.id:
Together with his wife, Agus is running this business. They started since 2006. They decided on this business, since they see a good opportunity. Raw materials are obtained from production leftover of jackets and bags. The loan, is planned to be used to increase raw material inventory. Each bracelet is sold between Rp2500.00 - 5000.00 (between 30-55 US cents). Profit could reach up to Rp650,000 (about US$67)/month. They both live in a rented house. Their living expense of Rp20,000 (about US$2.10)/day was derived from this business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Bersama dengan isterinya, Agus menekuni usaha ini. Sejak tahun 2006 yang lalu mereka memulai usaha ini. Mereka memutuskan untuk menekuninya, karena melihat peluang yang bagus dari usaha ini. Bahan mentah yang mereka perlukan banyak mereka dapatkan dari sisa - sisa hasil produksi jaket dan tas. Pinjaman yang mereka peroleh, rencananya akan mereka pakai untuk menambah jumlah persediaan bahan mentah tersebut. Harga per gelang mereka jual berkisar antara Rp 2.500,00 – Rp Rp 5.000,00. Keuntungan yang mereka peroleh mencapai Rp 650.000,00/bulan Mereka berdua tinggal di rumah kontrakkan. Biaya hidup Rp 20.000,00/hari dapat mereka penuhi melalui usaha ini.

loans.use:
To buy raw materials

Membeli bahan baku.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar is an experienced business woman, as she has been in business for 15 years. She was compelled to earn money for family needs because her husband met with an accident and became an invalid. These hard life conditions have made her a strong and tolerant person.

Muyassar has three children and due her business earnings she has been able to bring them up appropriately and help them to find good jobs for their future life. Today she earns money for herself and for her husband.

Her business is located in Istaravshan's wholesale market. She sells galoshes and traditional shoes which always are in good demand among the local population, as Tadjikistan is montainous country and they are suited to the environment. She currently has good turnover of her goods. For the coming winter season, Muyassar wants to buy the next batch of warm galoshes, "massi" (traditional-style boots) and slippers for indoor wear.

loans.use: Purchase of warm types of galoshes and slippers for indoor wear

loans.name: Subgroup C Of Group Sungura

texts.en:
Hironius, age 55, has owned his beer and soft drinks shop for over 23 years. Over time, his business has expanded and now brings in about $35 in profit every week. He hires 4 workers to assist him at his shop.

Hironius is the leader of Subgroup C of Group “Sungura” (Swahili for “rabbit”), which totals 31 members. Hironius’ wife is also a member of Sungura, although in a different subgroup. He and his wife have 4 children and take care of 2 orphaned relatives.

Hironius will be sharing this loan with his subgroup members Grace M. (selling lotions), Johari J. (selling charcoal), Prosper T. (selling motorcar accessories), Yahaya R. (a carpenter), and Lidya M. (selling food). They all live and work in the same locality. In the past, they have taken out 3 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to enhance their businesses and were able to pay them back successfully.

Hironius used the previous loans to purchase inventory for his shop. He hopes to also use the new loan to once again increase his stock of soft drinks and beer.

loans.use: To expand businesses.

loans.name: Bibiniso

texts.en: Bibiniso Odirmatov  is a very cheerful person who loves animals. Her whole life she has been doing livestock-breeding. She has a big family which consists of 5 children, husband, and grand-parents. Her business is raising sheep and billy goats and selling them at  "Oppon va Bulok" animal market in the Asht region, Tadjikistan. Currently she has 10 sheep and three billy goats. She has a big yard for her animals and her children help her to take care of them.Often, her children bring the sheep to graze on near-by montainsides. At present, Bibiniso wants to receive a loan to buy fodder for her animals for the winter months.

loans.use: Purchase of fodder for domestic animals

loans.name: Farishta

texts.ru:
Farishta B., 30, is married and has 3 chidlren. Farishta has a college degree in psychology. She works as a psychologist at Khatlonskiy regional labor exchange for women. In addition, to make up for her modest work pay, on Saturdays and Sundays Farishta sells slippers, shoes, bedding and fabrics on Bahtarskiy regional market. Farishta plans to use this loan to purchase additional inventory to help attract more clients. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Бердиева Фаришта, возраст – 30 лет, образование высшее, по специальности психолог, замужем, имеет 3-х детей. Основным местом работы Фаришты является «Биржа труда женщин Хатлонской области», где она работает в качестве психолога. Помимо этого она занимается торговлей по субботам и воскресеньям на рынке Бохтарского района. Товар которым она торгуе это калоши, женские тапочки, материал для пошива постельного белья и ткани для пошива женской одежды. На полученный кредит Фаришта хочет пиобрести новый ассортимент товара и продавать его на этом же рынке. Это поможет ей увеличить свой товарооборот и получаемый доход, так как получаемой заработной платы не хвататет на проживание, а жители получать возможность приобрести необходимый товар на своём районном рынке. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Hurshedgon

texts.ru:
Hurshedgon A., 22, owns and drives a taxi in Kurgan-Tube. At present, his car runs on gas, but, with gas prices rising every month, Hurshedgon plans to use this loan to convert his car to run on natural gas. The villagers of Kurgan-Tube would benefit from lower taxi fares. Hurshedgon plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахроров Хуршеджон, возраст – 22 года, образование среднее. Хуршеджон имеет собственный автомобиль и занимается оказанием услуг такси для населения города Курган-Тюбе. В настоящее время он работает на бензине, так как цены на бензин ежемесячно растут, что повышает стоимость проезда и бьёт по карману граждан, на полученный кредит он хочет приобрести газовое оборудование и установить его на автомашину с соблюдением всех условий безопасности по его эксплуатации. Установка газового оборудования намного снизит стоимость проезда, так как этот вид топлива намного дешевле и цены на него увеличиваются не так быстро, как на бензин. Так как в городе почти что отстутсвует транспортное сообщение между микрорайонами, это даст возможность местным жителям добираться в любую точку города по приемлемым ценам и не будет загрязнять экологию города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Installation of natural gas fuel system

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Suhrob B., 22, is married. He owns a photo studio that provides a variety of services to the residents of Kurgan-Tube. At present, to print his photo orders, Suhrob must travel to Dushanbe located 80 km from Kurgan-Tube. Suhrob plans to use this loan to purchase photo processing equipment. Having all the needed equipment at his studio, Suhrob will be able to reduce photo processing time and expenses and pass on the savings to the residents of Kurgan-Tube. Suhrob also hopes that by offering better service, he will be able to acquire new clients. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Беков Сухроб, возраст – 22 лет, образование среднее, женат. Беков Сухроб занимается оказанием услуг фотопечати населению города Курган-Тюбе, а именно делает фотографии различных размеров на официальные документы и фото на память по заказу клиентов. В настоящее время Сухробу чтобы распечатать фотографии небходимо ездить в город Душанбе, который находится в 80 км от Курган-Тюбе, так как в его городе это будет стоить намного больше, что соотвественно увеличивает его расходы и заставляет клиентов ждать свои заказы некоторые время. Сухроб на полученный кредит хочет приобрести необходимое оборудование для печати фотографий. Сухроб приобретя такое оборудования будет иметь возможность улучшить качество обслуживание клиентов: во-первых снизится цена за фото, во-вторых, печать фоторграфий будет делаться в короткие сроки, в-третьих – он планирует увеличить количество обслуживание клиентов, что позволит ему расширить свой бизнес. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase new photo processing equipment

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Cafarov Rustem is 33 years old and the father of two children.  He was born in Sumqayit City which is located in eastern  Azerbaijan. He lives in Sumgayit City, with his family, including his father and mother.. His parents are old and ill. Cafarov is the only breadwinner in his family. Fifteen years ago, he began his home repair business. He is a good craftsman who does repairs and offers trades on home items. He is requesting a loan of $500 in order to buy tools and equipment which will improve the service he provides to his customers. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment to improve his home repair and trade services

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura is 44 years old. She has been in the clothing business for over 6 years. She is married and has two children. Her business located in the Istaravshan clothing market, Khujand, Tadjikistan. She is renting a small stand and has good turnover of her goods. She buys her goods from the wholesale market here for resale at her stand. She generally sells tights and socks. For the coming winter she wants to purchase 50 pairs of warm tights and  50 pairs of leg-warmers, as that kind of goods will be in high demand.

loans.use: expand her inventory of clothing for the winter season

loans.name: Bihol

texts.en: Bihol I. has good profitable stand at the fabrics market in Istaravshan, Khujand. She has been in business for over 15 years. She has good experience and sells her goods skillfully. She has a lot of repeat customers and her fabrics are more competetive than others'. She perfectly understands her customers' needs and she always helps to her customers to choose fabrics. Now she also sells traditional dresses from a local workshop which sews dresses from her fabrics. She is planning to purchase warm, high-quality fabrics for winter and she needs a loan of US$ 475 to be able to do so.

loans.use: Purchase warm fabrics appropriate to the season

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael X.  is a 39-year-old, married man with two children. He is from Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Fizuli region in western Azerbaijan.  Rafael began his business of repairing and trading cars eight  years ago,  and he is the only income earner in his family. In 2006, Natig borrowed $300 from Normicro, expanded his business and bought necessary tools and equipment for his repair area, increased number of his clients, and improved his income. He now requests a loan of  $700 loan to expand and upgrade the repair area. This will greatly improve the service he provides his clients. He will repay the loan within six months.

loans.use: To expand and upgrade car repair area

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Description

Alba M. is 35 years old, and married to Valentin Caceres who is 41 years old. They live in their own house, with the basic necessities. They have 3 children, two sons and one girl, all teenagers who study at the public school.

Alba has been the owner of a small general store for more than 5 years. She sells items for every day use such as rice, oil, drinks, flour, etc. She runs her business from her home, and her children help her. Her husband has worked for the railroads for more than 20 years and has a monthly salary which helps cover the costs of taking care of and educating the children.

The motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business, such as ciders, wines, beer, soft drinks, etc. because the demand for these items is always high at the end of the year. One of the projects Alba has for next year is to open another business, selling clothing, items for the home, office, gifts, etc. There is currently no such shop in the neighborhood and her customers are requesting it.

Descripción: DESCRIPCION necesidad La señora Alba M. de 35 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Valentín Cáceres de 41 años, viven en casa propia, equipada con las necesidades básicas del hogar. Tienen tres hijos aún menores de edad, dos son varones y una mujer; todos ellos son adolescentes y están estudiando en colegios públicos.

La señora Alba es propietaria de una despensa con más de 5 años de antigüedad, vende artículos de primera necesidad como ser arroz, aceite, bebidas en general, harina, etc., su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa, que es atendida por ella y por sus hijos. Su marido trabaja como empleado ferroviario hace más de 20 años y tiene un salario mensual, con la que ayuda a cubrir los gastos de alimentación y la educación de sus tres hijos.

El motivo por el cual solicitan el crédito es para la compra de mercaderías en oferta como ser: vinos, sidras, cervezas, golosinas, productos enlatados, etc. ya que en épocas de fin de año la demanda de estos artículos es bastante alta.

Uno de los proyectos de Alba para el próximo año es la de abrir otro negocio, esta será en el ramo de mercería y bazar (venta de artículos varios como ropa, artículos para la casa, librería, regalos, etc.). ya que en el barrio no existe ningún comercio dedicado a esos rubros y sus propios clientes le solicitan este tipo de artículos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER STORE SUCH AS CIDERS, WINE, BEER AND SODAS, AS DEMAND FOR THESE ITEMS IS ALWAYS HIGH AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

loans.name: Mahmadusuf

texts.ru:
Mahmadusuf S., 23, has a college degree in teaching. Mahmadusuf owns a store in the village of Samoni, Bokhtarsky region—15 km from the center of Kurgan-Tube. Mahmadusuf sells clothing for adults and children, kitchenware and other essential items. He has been in business for 6 years. Mahmadusuf plans to use the loan to purchase new inventory to generate more sales. The residents of Samoni, Mahmadusuf’s main customers, would benefit from having more items to choose from at the local store. Mahmadusuf plans to repay the loan within 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Солиев Махмадюсуф, возраст – 23 года, образование высшее педагогическое. Махмадюсуф имеет свой магазин в посёлке Сомони, Бохтарского района, который находится в 15 км от центра города Курган-Тюбе. Товар которым он торгует это детские и взрослые вещи, кухонная утварь и другие вещи первой необходимости. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 6 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести новый ассортимент товара, тем самым увеличив свой товарооборот. Основными его покупателями являются жители посёлка Сомони и близлежащих населенных пунктов, которые расположены ещё дальше от центра города. Увеличив свой ассортимент товара он даст возможность местным жителям приобретать необходимые им вещи и товары необходимые для ведения домашнего хозяйства при этом не покидая пределы своего района, при этом не неся дополнительных денежных и временных затрат. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 3 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Ceveriano

texts.es:
Ceveriano is married and is 50-years-old. His wife's name is María Nidia and they have 3 young children. They have their own house that they are still paying a mortgage on. Ceveriano has had a grocery store for 7 years. He started it with a small amount of capital that he saved, and little by little, he has been able to progress and to expand it.

Ceveriano and his wife help each other mutually with the handling of the business and they help their family move ahead together. They are very hard-working and sacrificing, and they start their days very early to go to the market in the city to by supplies.

Considering that the year-end celebrations will be upon us soon, they hope to take advantage of the low prices to buy merchandise in large quantities since the demand for articles in this season is rather high. Among the articles they hope to acquire are: sugar, milk, canned goods, candy, meat, wine, cider, fruit, rice, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Ceveriano es casado y tiene 50 años; su esposa se llama María Nidia y tienen 3 hijos aún menores. Tienen casa propia que aún están pagando a una inmobiliaria.

Ceveriano tiene una despensa hace 7 años, comenzó con un pequeño capital ahorrado con el que logró montar el negocio y de a poco, gracias a la s ganancias, pudieron ir progresando y ampliándolo.

Ceveriano y su esposa se ayudan mutuamente con el manejo del negocio y juntos llevan adelante a la familia. Son muy trabajadores y sacrificados ya que todos los días empiezan su jornada a tempranas horas para ir al mercado de la ciudad a comprar las mercaderías.

En vista de que estamos a poco tiempo de las fiestas de fin de año, ellos desean aprovechar los bajos precios para comprar mercaderías en grandes cantidades, ya que en esta época la demanda de artículos es bastante alta. Entre los artículos a ser adquiridos podemos citar: azúcar, leche, productos enlatados, golosinas, carne, vinos, sidra, frutas, arroz, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like sugar, milk, canned goods, candy, meat, wine, cider, fruit, rice, etc.

loans.name: Aída

texts.es:
Virginia is married with Roberto and together they have a mini-market in the San Juan barrio of Ciudad del Este. They have 3 small children that are in elementary school.

They opened their business a while ago as a small project and with time it grew thanks to the high sales and good earning that they had.

Today they ask for a loan to acquire merchandise such as canned goods, pop, candy, fruit, vegetables, meat, soap, fabric softener, etc. With the purchase at wholesale prices, they can obtain greater discounts from their suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Virginia esta casada con Roberto y juntos tienen un mini mercado en el barrio San Juan de Ciudad del Este. Ellos tienen 3 hijos menores y que aun están en la escuela primaria.

Ellos abrieron su negocio hace un tiempo atrás como un proyecto pequeño y que con el tiempo fue creciendo gracias a las altas ventas y buenas ganancias que obtenían.

Hoy solicitan un crédito para adquirir mercaderías como productos enlatados, gaseosas, golosinas, frutas, verduras, carne, jabones, suavizantes para ropas, etc. Con la compra al por mayor de sus mercaderías, ellos obtienen mejores descuentos de sus proveedores.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as canned goods, pop, candy, fruit, vegetables, meat, soap, fabric softener, etc.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor is 42 years old, married, with 2 children. He is owner of a business dedicated to the selling of sculptures and artwork of all kinds related to saints. He has been doing this for over 12 years and is located right in front of the Caacupé basilica.

Victor says that November and December, Caacupé receives a large number of visitors from all over the country, so the number of items he sells during those months is high and generates large earnings.

For the upcoming year he has a project to open a branch store, where he can also sell games, clothing and cell phone accessories; so he is gathering savings to make this dream a reality. Today he is asking for a new loan to be able to buy more Saint-related artwork and sculpture as the holidays are approaching and the demand for these items is rather high.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Victor tiene 42 años está casado y tiene 2 hijos, el es propietario de un negocio que se dedica a la venta de imágenes y esculturas de todo tipo de santos, la misma lo tiene desde hace más de 12 años y está ubicado frente mismo a la basílica de Caacupé.

Victor comenta que los meses de Noviembre y Diciembre la ciudad de Caacupé recibe a gran cantidad de visitantes de todas las ciudades del país, por lo que la venta de sus productos durante esos meses es bastante alta y produce grandes ganancias.

Para el año que viene tiene en proyecto abrir una sucursal, en donde también incorporaría a las ventas juguetes, ropas y accesorios para celulares; por lo que está juntando unos ahorros para poder concretar su sueño. Hoy solicita un nuevo crédito para poder comprar más imágenes y esculturas de santos pues ya se acercan las festividades y la demanda de estos artículos es bastante alta.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of artwork and sculptures of Saints

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children. He makes and sells ice cream which he makes in a small production facility in his home. He has been doing this for more than 10 years. He also sells plants. Both businesses are going well, as during winter he primarily sells plants and in the summer he primarily makes and sells ice cream.

With the loans he has received from the Fundación Paraguaya he has invested in the purchase of more freezers which enable him to store a larger quantity of ice cream. Oscar affirms how important it is to have a good amount of working capital so people can work independently so as to be able to purchase products at discounted and wholesale prices.

One of Oscar's wishes is that during the Virgen de Caacupé festivities in December, that this year is like previous years where there is a lot of business and activity that contribute to his earnings. He hopes to obtain a loan in order to improve the infrastructure of his business and thereby prepare himself for the upcoming holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Oscar tiene 41 años está casado y tiene 3 hijos, el se dedica a la fabricación y venta de helados, su pequeña fábrica lo tiene en su mismo domicilio y en éste rubro está hace más de 10 años, como actividad adicional también vende plantas, en ambos negocios le va muy bien ya que en la temporada de invierno se dedica en gran porcentaje a la venta de plantas y en el verano a la fabricación y ventas de helados.

Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya los ha invertido en la adquisición de más congeladores que le permita almacenar gran cantidad de producción de helados, el señor Oscar afirma lo importante que es contar con un buen capital de trabajo para las personas que trabajan en forma independiente porque esto le permite obtener los productos a precios mucho menor y al contado.

Uno de los deseos de Oscar es que ésta temporada de las festividades de la Virgen de Caacupé que se realiza en el mes de Diciembre, sea como los años anteriores dónde hubo mucha concurrencia de personas y que contribuyó a obtener mayores ganancias. El desea obtener un crédito para mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y de esta forma prepararse ya para las festividades de este año.

loans.use: Remodel the infrastructure of his business (paint and repairs)

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery is 48 years old, married, with 3 children. He is the owner of a mechanic shop and in addition he buys and sells cars. He has been doing this for over 10 years and states that this is an industry with quite a bit of movement, for on the vehicles that he buys he makes small repairs and then resells them for a good profit.

He is asking for a loan to purchase car parts and accessories. For the next year he hopes to incorporate motorbikes in his sales, as this year the production and sales of motorbikes has increased substantially.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Nery tiene 48 años está casado y tiene 3 hijos, el es propietario de un taller mecánico y además como actividad adicional tiene la de comprar y vender automóviles. Se dedica a ésta actividad hace más de 10 años y afirma que es un rubro que tiene bastante movimiento, ya que los vehículos que compra él les realiza pequeños arreglos y posteriormente los vuelve obteniendo un buen margen de ganancias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos y accesorios para vehículos. Para el año que viene desea incorporar a sus ventas, las motocicletas, ya que este año ha crecido bastante la producción y ventas de las mismas.

loans.use: Purchase car parts and accessories

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan lives in south Lebanon in the region of Saida. Hassan is a 25-year-old barber who is intending engaged to be married. He would like a loan to purchase enough cosmetic products to generate revenues for his wedding. This is the third loan Hassan has requested from Al Majmoua, and he has a responsible history with them. Hassan would like a loan of $1200 to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan Jose works as an assistant at a law firm and his wife at the social security depository. He has two daughters who study at the La Paz school. His home is located in the Villa Copacabana section of the city of La Paz. This is his first request for a loan. The amount he is asking for would be used to pay for the enrollment and boarding fees for his two daughters. His work allows him access to this credit given that he has experience as a legal assistant and his financial evaluation is favorable. This type of credit is part of our development program in the Educational Sector.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Jose trabaja como asistente en una firma de abogados y su esposa trabaja en la Caja Nacional de Seguro Social. Tiene dos hijas que estudian en el colegio La Paz. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado el pago de inscripción y pago mensual del colegio de sus dos hijas. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como asistente legal y la evaluación socio-económica es favorable. Este tipo de crédito es parte de nuestro programa de Fomento, Sector Educación.

loans.use: Payment of enrollment and boarding fees for school.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en: Sharif is 24 years old and lives in south Lebanon in the region of Nabatieh. Sharif loves everything that is related to computers and his business is to provide computer maintenance. He needs to buy the required computer parts in order to make his business successful. He would also like to decorate his shop to attract more clients. Sharif would like a loan of $1000 to help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: To buy computer parts and decorate his shop

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia is 50 years old, and is married with four children. She is the owner of a business where she sells a wide variety of beverages and products for daily consumption, an enterprise she has owned for more than 15 years.

Of the items she sells we can list sugar, noodles, dairy products, canned products, etc. She notes that, for a few months she was sick and on bed rest, an episode that caused her to business suffer and did not allow her to restock her inventory.

For this reason she is today asking for a loan, given that she would like to reactivate her business with the purchase of basic necessities such as oil, sodas, candy/confections, noodles, flour, fruits and vegetables, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucia tiene 50 años está casada y tiene 4 hijos, ella es propietaria de un negocio donde vende todo tipo de bebidas y productos de consumo diario, posee el negocio hace más de 15 años.

Entre otras cosas que vende podemos citar azúcar, fideos, productos lácteos, productos enlatados, etc. Comenta que hace unos meses estuvo enferma y con reposo, por lo que el negocio quedo descuidado y sin posibilidades de reponer las mercadearías vendidas.

Es por eso que hoy solicita un crédito, ya que desea reactivar el negocio con la compra de mercaderías al por mayor tales como aceite, gaseosas, golosinas, fideos, harina, frutas, verduras, etc.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as oil, sodas, candies, noodles, flour, fruits and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Aquiles

texts.es:
Aquiles is a devoted father who has formed a family together with his wife Saturnina. He dedicates himself to the raising and selling of cattle, an activity he manages efficiently thanks to the experience he has gained year after year. He performs this activity with passion and energy, given that his efforts are for the benefit of his four children who live in the shelter of his humble home. The wish of this model father is to provide them the opportunity to finish their higher educations, something he himself was not able to achieve when young due to a lack of resources. To realize their plans, they ask for a loan to invest in the daily activities of the business to help increase their earnings through the sale of the cattle. Both commit to repaying the loan within a period of eight months. Aquiles and his charming wife appeal to your generous heart to help them meet their objective.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Aquiles, es un empeñoso y ejemplar padre desde que formó su familia junto a su esposa, Saturnina, se dedicó por completo a la labor de crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno; actividad que realiza eficientemente gracias a la experiencia que fue adquiriendo años tras año. Esta noble y laboriosa labor que desempeña apasionadamente lo va llenando de dicha y alegría, porque su esfuerzo se desplega en beneficio de sus cuatro queridos hijos que viene cobijando en su humilde hogar.El deseo de este ejemplar padre es otorgarle la oportunidad de concluir los estudios superiores a sus hijos, oportunidad que el nunca tuvo por los escasos recursos económicos con los que contaba su hogar cuando era pequeño. Para concretar sus planes solicitan un préstamo de dinero, capital que invertirá en su actividad diaria a fin de obtener mayores ganancias con la venta de los animalitos, ambos prometen reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses. Aquiles y su encantadora esposa apelan a tu generoso corazón para concretar sus planes.

loans.use: Purchase of additional livestock to help meet the needs of their children.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Mrs. Kem R., aged 57, is a widow who works selling second-hand clothes in front of her home earning around $6 per day in revenue.  She has three children who are married and live separately.  She would like to request a loan of $1000 to increase her inventory of clothing to meet growing customer demands.  She anticipates that this will increase her revenue and her income in the long term.  In the future, she plans to reinvest the income to expand her business further.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum S., aged 38, raises ducks at her home and earns about $3 in profit each say from selling duck eggs at the market.  Her husband works as a police officer earning about $1 per day.
