They have three children.  Two are students and one is unemployed and helps do the housework.  She would like to request this loan of $750 in order to purchase more ducks to lay eggs, which will increase her inventory of eggs to meet customer demands.  The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase duck feed to feed the additional ducks.  She expects this increased inventory to raise her revenue and the income level for her family so that she can finance her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase ducks for egg production and sales.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is a loving mother who works diligently every day selling a wide variety of candies, cookies and sodas. She travels around to market her products using a cart that she outfitted for this purpose. She has labored at this endeavor for five years, an activity she conducts with great optimism and happiness given that it allows her to meet her living expenses. The wish of this enterprising mother is to offer her products at wholesale, an effort she feels will bring her increased financial benefits with which to improve the standard of living of her 85-year old mother, Petronila, and most importantly, provide continued education for her 21-year old son James. María asks for a loan to help her reach her goal, and is thankful for your assistance toward her cause.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

María, es una amorosa madre que diligentemente trabaja a diario vendiendo gran variedad de golosinas, galletes y gaseosas en forma ambulatoria en una pequeña movilidad que acondicionó para dicho trabajo, esta labor a la que se dedica hace cinco años la esta llenando de optimismo y alegría, debido a que le permite apaciguar satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar.El deseo de esta emprendedora madre es ofrecer sus productos al por mayor, negocio con el que ella cree que obtendrá mayores beneficios económicos, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su querida y anciana madre Petronila de 85 años y sobre todo estudios superiores a su hijo James de 21 años de edad. En esta oportunidad María solicita un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con su propósito y agradece gentilmente tu disposición de colaborar con su causa.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise (candy, etc.) to offer at wholesale and increase earnings for the benefit of the family.

loans.name: Lik

texts.en:
Mrs. Lik S., aged 51, has built a public bathroom near a ferry pier to serve the many passengers who use the ferry.  By charging for admission, she earns up to $10 per day in revenue.  Her husband works on the passenger ferry making about $10 per day as well.  They have five children; one works selling hats near the port earning $10 per day in revenue, two work selling soft drinks on the street, and two are students.  Mrs. Lik would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to build a proper home for her family.  She anticipates having no problem paying back the loan over a 12 month period and is grateful to be able to built a proper home for her family to sleep in.

Her husband is pictured in the photo as Mrs. Lik was not available at the time.

loans.use: To build a proper home for her family.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio and his determined family have been through difficult financial times. At one time, he worked in a repair shop/garage. Thanks to his restless nature and self-initiative, he was able to learn a great deal and now – thanks to great effort and sacrifice – has decided to open his own garage. His objective, with the assistance of his wife and children who help and support him in his daily endeavors, is to provide an excellent level of service and to make his small garage the busiest in his native town of Ayaviri. To achieve his goals, he asks for a loan that he commits to repay within eight months. Your generous support will be a wise investment in the hands of this family, giving them the opportunity to prosper with their new project.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Eusebio y su empeñosa familia, desde que formaron su hogar pasaron por momentos económicos muy difíciles; en un principio él se desempeñaba como empleado en un taller de mecánica; gracias a su inquietud, iniciativa, e interés pudo adquirir mayor conocimiento y ahora a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio decidió abrir su propio taller y a través de esta actividad brinda un eficientemente servicio a su comunidad en compañía de su inseparable esposa e hijos, quienes lo acompañan y apoyan en su labor diaria.El deseo de este ejemplar padre es implementar su pequeño taller y hacer de este local el más concurrido de su ciudad natal, Ayaviri. Para concretar sus anhelos solicita un préstamo de dinero que se compromete a reembolsarlo en un lapso de ocho meses. Tu generoso aporte será una inversión sabia en las manos de esta familia, dales la oportunidad de prosperar con su nuevo proyecto.

loans.use: Establish a small garage and make it one of the busiest repair shops in the city.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun C., aged 23, works selling drinks in front of her house earning, on average, $7.50 per day in revenue.  Her husband, aged 34, works as a taxi driver earning $10-$12.50 per day in revenue before expenses.  They have two children who are too young to attend school yet.  She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to build a proper house with a tin roof to shelter her family from the rain.  This will also give her a place to store her inventory of drinks.  In the future, Mrs. Hun would like to open a stand for selling rice, food, noodles and drinks to increase her income and the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To build a better house to protect her family and merchandise from the rain.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy C., aged 26, is a housewife.  Her husband works selling ice cream, earning $10-$15 in revenue per day before expenses.  They have one child who is too young to attend school yet.  She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to build a better house to keep her family and her husband’s inventory safe and dry in the rainy season.  She anticipates having no trouble paying back this loan in 18 months.

Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To build a stronger house to keep her family and her husband's inventory dry in the rainy season.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
We find Casilda eagerly tending to her small store, which she has also outfitted in part to bring internet services to her community. She began her work two years ago, with the support and encouragement of her three adolescent children. She projects the same love and enthusiasm she shows to her business activities to her work as a teacher, a job which fills her with happiness and satisfaction as it allows her to guide and share her knowledge with her students. She is the sole means of income for her family, and for this reason she works tirelessly with one objective: to provide a first-rate education for her children who, thanks to the good example she has given them, fill her with great pride. The wish of this exemplary mother is to upgrade her equipment and to expand her business location to be able to offer her customers better services and a more comfortable environment. To reach her goals, she asks for a loan and promises to repay such over a period of eight months. Let’s help Casilda continue her noble aim of seeking to improve her life and those of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a Dora Casilda atendiendo afanosamente su pequeña bodeguita, lugar en el que también habilitó un espacio para brindar servicios de internet a su comunidad, trabajo que emprendió hace dos años con apoyo e iniciativa de sus tres hijos adolescentes.El mismo amor y afán con el que se desempeña en sus actividades económicas, también lo demuestra cuando se desenvuelve como profesora en un centro educativo del medio rural, este trabajo la llena de alegría y mucha satisfacción porque le permite guiar y transmitir sus conocimientos a sus queridos alumnos. Ella es el único sostén económico de su hogar y por esta razón trabaja diligentemente con un solo objetivo, ofrecerles estudios superiores a sus queridos hijos, quienes por el buen ejemplo que inculcó en ellos la llenan de gran orgullo y dicha.El deseo de esta ejemplar madre es mejorar los servicios que presta, repotenciando sus máquinas y ampliando su local con el objetivo de ofrecer una mejor atención y comodidad a su exigente clientela. Para cumplir sus objetivos solicita un préstamo y promete reembolsarlo en un lapso de ocho meses. Ayudemos a Casilda a continuar con su noble propósito en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.

loans.use: Upgrade of equipment and expansion of location to offer a better and more comfortable service to customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard-working mother of three. She sells some cloth, but mostly pots and other light-weight metal containers. The most amazing part is that she walks around the city in search of customers while balancing all of her stock on a piece of cloth placed on top of her head. This type of selling strategy is called “hawking.” It is common in Ghana, but normally for lighter-weight items. A lot of hawkers complain of neck and head pains from hawking, but Elizabeth, at the age of 55, says the only challenge that she has encountered is not having enough profit to expand her business.

Much of Elizabeth’s profits went to her children’s education fees, but now 2 have completed school, so she is able to focus more on her business. Her goal is to eventually sell from an indoor store so she is able to carry more stock. With the profits that she will be making, she plans to pay for the education of her youngest child and to finish building a house for her family.

Elizabeth is a member of the Bisa Ewurade group. The group lending system allows several people to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount.

(*Photo Note: in the photo a friend helps Elizabeth lift the heavy load onto her head to start her day hawking).

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing metal pots and containers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria has wonderful hands, with them she creates precious works of art of high quality, which are admired by her clients and have made her one of the preferred artisans for commissioning a craft job well made. Victoria has been working full time on creating embroidered cloth crafts. Her grandparents taught her how to embroider, and the experience of many years have made her an expert, as well as efficient in finishing commissioned jobs. With time, Victoria was encouraged to devote herself to embroidering as a means for survival, was offered an opportunity in a workshop not too far from her home. Now she is capitalizing her profits with which she hopes to open a general store in the future with the purpose of enhancing her quality of life. All this is motivated by the unconditional love she feels for her four children to whom she will keep giving her love every day. This is why she is requesting a loan with the goal of acquiring a greater quantity of thread, cloth, and needles to be able to optimize and improve her work. Remember that this hardworking mother and her little ones await soon the reply from your generous heart.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

Victoria, tiene unas manos maravillosas, con ellas realiza preciosas obras de arte y de mucha calidad que son admiradas por sus clientes y la hacen una de las preferidas para encomendarle un trabajo manual bien elaborado. Es así que victoria desde sus diez años se dedica de lleno al bordado de fustanes de manera artesanal, sus abuelos le enseñaron a bordar, y la experiencia de años la hicieron una experta y también ágil para terminar un trabajo encomendado.Con el tiempo victoria fue animada a dedicarse al bordado como un medio de supervivencia, le ofrecieron una oportunidad en un taller no muy lejos de su hogar y ahora está capitalizando sus ganancias con la cual espera a futuro abrir una tienda de abarrotes con el propósito de incrementar su calidad de vida, todo esto impulsado por el amor incondicional que siente por sus cuatro hijos a los cuales seguirá dando cada día todo su cariño.Es por ello que solicita un préstamo con el fin de adquirir mayor cantidad de hilos, telas y agujas a fin de optimizar y mejorar su trabajo. Recuerda que esta laboriosa madre y sus pequeñas esperan pronto la respuesta de tu generoso corazón.

loans.use: Buying more cloth, needles, and embroidery thread to continue and consolidate her craft for the benefit of her beloved children. (Compra de mayor cantidad de telas, agujas e hilos para continuar y consolidar su ocupación para beneficio de sus qeridos hijos.)

loans.name: Luo

texts.en: Mrs. Luo S., aged 50, works with her husband growing and selling vegetables to earn around $7.50 each day.  They have 11 children.  Three are employed at a garment factory, earning together about $190/month, seven are students and one is unemployed.  She would like to request a loan of $1000 to build a house for her family to live in.  This will not only allow her children to work and study more efficiently, but also give her a workspace to prepare her vegetables for sale in the market.  She anticipates having no trouble repaying this loan over 18 months.

loans.use: To build a house for her family, and to have a workspace to prepare her vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Vilma Maria

texts.es:
Vilma is an exemplary mother who has demonstrated to her children the value of life and what it takes to be able to get ahead in our society. She has four children, 3 of whom are already independent, although one is still of school age.

Vilma started her business with a capital of US $200.00 selling merchandise on credit, door to door, in diverse companies (to the workers). However, when the new market (Israel Lewites) was opened, she was able to get a hold of a section and she installed herself there, even though the conditions were not the most appropriate. This is how she got started, motivated by the need to support her family. Little by little she has been maintaining and remodeling her locale thanks to loans given to her by CEPRODEL.

Her record is of 14 loans in two and a half years. Vilma says during this time she has felt happy and satisfies for the support offered by CEPRODEL and the trust given to her and her business. Vilma has prospered and as proof of that is the fact that her sales used to be of US$50-60/week and now she sells around US$30.00/day. Similarly, when she started with CEPRODEL her credit was of US$180.00 and now it is of US$580.00 thanks to her hard work to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

Vilma es una madre de familia ejemplar, ha demostrado a sus hijos el valor de la vida y lo que cuesta poder salir adelante en nuestra sociedad. Sus hijos son cuatro, 3 de ellos ya son independientes y uno aun esta en edad escolar.

Ella inicia su negocio con un capital de US$200.00 vendiendo mercadería al crédito de manera ambulante en diversas empresas (a trabajadores), sin embargo cuando abren el nuevo mercado (Israel Lewites) ella se logra apoderar de un tramo y se instala en el mismo aunque las condiciones no eran las mas apropiadas. Es así como ella comienza impulsada por la necesidad de la manutención de su familia. Poco a poco le ha ido dando mantenimiento y acondicionando su local gracias a los créditos que se le ha brindado por parte de CEPRODEL.

Su récord es de 14 créditos en 2½ años, tiempo en el cual dice sentirse contenta y satisfecha por el apoyo que CEPRODEL le ha brindado y la confianza depositada en ella y su negocio. Vilma ha prosperado y prueba de ello es que antes sus ventas eran de US$50-60 dolares semanales, y hoy vende alrededor de US$30.00 diarios. Así mismo cuando inicio con CEPRODEL su crédito era de US$180.00 ahora ya es de US$580.00 gracias a su ardua labor por prosperar.

loans.use: Buying various products.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
Valeriana’s talent has taken her to constantly perfect the jobs she makes, and for the past 30 years the embroidered clothes she creates have become themselves her best recommendation. In the beginning, she depended and worked with others, and now she makes the embroideries independently and looks to the future with optimism, seeing a better future for herself and the new family that receives her in their home. Hard work and her unconditional love for her parents did not allow Valeriana to formalize a family, but she loves the children who live in her home as if they were hers, and in the same way she hopes to offer them what she could not have or even wish for in her youth. This is why she wants to build a promising future and is requesting a loan to invest in buying the materials necessary for embroidering clothes. Unite with Victoria who works every day to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

El talento de Valeriana la ha llevado a perfeccionar constantemente los trabajos que realiza y desde hace treinta años los bordados de fustanes de manera artesanal se han convertido en su carta de mejor presentación. Al principio trabajaba para otras personas de manera dependiente y hoy los realiza de manera independiente y mira al futuro con el optimismo de ver un mañana mejor para ella y la nueva familia que la acoge en su casa.El trabajo arduo y el amor incondicional hacia sus padres no permitieron a Valeriana a formalizar una familia, pero ama a los niños que viven en su casa como si fueran los suyos y de igual manera espera ofrecerles lo que no pudo tener ni añorar durante los años de su juventud. Es por ello que desea construir un futuro prometedor y solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de materiales necesarios para el bordado de fustanes. Solidarízate con Victoria que cada día trabaja y lucha para salir adelante.

loans.use: Buying the materials necessary to continue her excellent work (cloth embroidery) (Compra de implementos necesarios para continuar con su excelente labor.)

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is an enterprising woman, always willing and able to learn. These qualities have allowed her to perfect her embroideries with practice and have made her one of the best embroiders in her area. This skill was acquired when, 17 years ago, her sister-in-law taught her the techniques of clothe embroidery and she started embroidering the pieces she was commissioned little by little. Then she became independent to be able to get ahead and now she has a great demand. Thanks to this craft, Graciela has been able to responsibly take on her role and the care of her three children, and she will continue working because she wants to give them a promising future. Among her plans is buying knitting machines to be able to obtain greater profits for the benefit of her children. This is why Graciela is working hard with the goal of saving and buying what she hopes for in the medium term. She would like to produce more and is requesting a loan to buy cloth and embroidery thread with the goal of continuing to create her crafts. Your contribution will be wisely invested, please help.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

Graciela, es una mujer emprendedora con mucha disposición al aprendizaje, estas cualidades le han permitido perfeccionar con la práctica sus bordados y la han convertido en una de las mejoras bordadoras de su zona. Esta habilidad fue adquirida cuando su cuñada hace 17 años le enseñó las técnicas del bordado de fustanes y comenzó bordando poco a poco los encargos que le encomendaban; luego se independizó para poder seguir adelante y hoy tiene gran demanda. Gracias a este oficio Graciela durante años ha podido asumir su rol y el cuidado de sus tres hijos responsablemente y seguirá trabajando porque quiere otorgarles un prometedor futuro. Entre sus planes está el de comprar máquinas de tejer para obtener mayores ganancias en beneficio de sus hijos y es por ello que Graciela está trabajando arduamente con el objetivo de ahorrar y comprar lo que anhela en un mediano plazo.Ella desea producir más y solicita un préstamo para comprar tela e hilos a fin de seguir realizando sus trabajos. Tu aporte será sabiamente invertido, anímate a colaborar.

loans.use: Buying cloth and thread to continue her work for the benefit of her beloved children (Compra de tela e hilos para continuar con su labor en beneficio de sus queridos hijos.)

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia is virtuous and self-sacrificing mother who always tries to give the best to her family. Since she got married, Celia has demonstrated her diligence and for the past five years she has been able to gain the sympathy of her mother in law who is now one of her best friends. As a show of this friendship and the closeness of this family, Celia's mother-in-law left her as a life lesson the art of cloth embroidery, which she now very gratefully works on making Celia an important player in the support of her young household. Her husband, on his part, also works very hard, and thanks to the hard work of both of them they can satisfy completely the family expenses demanded by their home. This is why Celia would like to continue working in this field, to take care of and not neglect her three young children who are the center of her attention and daily motivation and give her energy to enjoy the best in life. Celia requests a loan to invest in buying thread and cloth for embroidering with the goal of ensuring a good future for her children. Let’s make Celia’s efforts be long lasting for the benefit of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

Una madre virtuosa y abnegada que siempre busca dar lo mejor a su familia, esa es Celia, quién desde que contrajo matrimonio ha demostrado su diligencia y desde hace cinco años tuvo la habilidad de ganarse la simpatía de su suegra quién ahora se ha convertido en una de sus mejores amigas y en señal de esa amistad y apego familiar le deja como lección de vida el arte del bordado artesanal de fustanes, que hoy muy agradecida ejerce y trabaja siendo así una protagonista importante en la manutención de su joven hogar. Su esposo por su parte también trabaja arduamente y gracias a su desempeño ambos pueden satisfacer plenamente los gastos familiares que demanda su hogar. Por esta razón desea continuar dedicándose a este rubro para atender y no descuidar a sus tres pequeños hijos que son el centro de atención y motivación diaria que le otorga energía para disfrutar lo mejor de la vida.Solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de hilos y telas para el bordado con la finalidad de asegurar un buen futuro para sus hijos. Hagamos que los esfuerzos de Celia sean duraderos en favor de su familia.

loans.use: Buying greater quantities and variety of cloth and thread to continue with the embroidery and beautifying of her family's dreams. (Compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de telas e hilos para continuar con el bordado y embellecimiento de los sueños de su querida familia.)

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Carlos starts his business 14 years ago with CS$2,000.00 (cordobas). His inventory was small because the first thing he invested on was buying the floor to set up his business. Before that, he worked on construction, as a helper.

The state of the locale were average, however, thanks to his effort, he has been able to make improvements in the place's infrastructure. Similarly, thanks to the loan given by CEPRODEL he has been able to increase his inventory, which translates into more profit for him.

He has been with CEPRODEL for about 2 years and has 10 loan in his record.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

Carlos comienza su negocio hace 14 años con CS$2,000.00 (córdobas). Su inventario era poco ya que lo primero en lo que invirtió fue en la compra de piso para colocar su negocio. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la construcción como ayudante.

Las condiciones del local eran regulares sin embargo gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado ir haciendo mejoras en la infraestructura del local. Así mismo gracias al financiamiento otorgado por CEPRODEL ha incrementado su inventario traduciéndose en ganancia para el.

Con CEPRODEL ya tiene alrededor de 2 años con un récord de 10 créditos.

loans.use: Buying products.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is very talented when it comes to knitting, and every day she creates beautiful pieces. She began knitting when she was ten years old, because her brothers noticed her talent and pushed her to try to sell her pieces. With practice, she has improved a lot and can now make her garments much more quickly. Her skill and talent have enabled her to get through times of economic difficulty that her family has suffered on many occasions, when their income was not enough to cover the costs of 4 children and their education.

Juana's husband is a bricklayer, and often times his work is seasonal. For this reason, Juana sometimes sells her garments in front of schools and cinemas around the city. She also has plans to build a chicken coop and acquire more chickens to sell. Right now they keep chickens in the house, using them for their own consumption. She hopes to achieve her goals and is requesting a loan to invest in more wool, as well as a number of chickens for the coop she'd like to build. She appreciates your support.

El arte de tejer se materializa finamente en las manos de Juana, quién cada día con dedicación elabora bellos trabajos de tejido a crochet; ella viene tejiendo desde hace diez años porque sus hermanos al observar su talento la animaron a que se dedique para comercializar lo que produce día a día. Ya con la práctica ha mejorado y tiene mayor velocidad al tejer sus prendas y es así que produce con sus bellos tejidos a crochet chalinas, ropones para bebés y fustanes de lana.Este talento que posee le ha permitido superar los tiempos de crisis económica que su familia ha sufrido en muchas ocasiones en que los ingresos económicos han sido insuficientes para cubrir los gastos de manutención de sus cuatro hijos que están en edad escolar. Su esposo es un humilde albañil y muchas veces los trabajos son temporales es por ello que también , Juana, en ocasiones vende canchita en bolsa en las puertas de algunas escuelas y también los cines de su ciudad.Tiene planes de construir una pequeña granja de pollos que por el momento sólo mantiene en casa para consumo familiar. Todos estos deseos espera cumplirlos con perseverancia y ayuda del talento que posee y solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de lana y de una cantidad considerable de gallinas para la granja que desea implementar en casa.Juana agradece tu noble deseo de apoyarla.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE WOOL FOR THE GARMENTS SHE KNITS AND SELLS, AS WELL MATERIALS FOR A CHICKEN THEY WANT TO BUILD BEHIND THEIR SMALL HOUSE

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en: Alusine started his business 10 years ago during the war.  His business expanded after joining the SMT loan program.  At 45 years old and married with 3 children, Alusine can now purchase more bails of used clothes than before.  He said that, the profit from his business has enabled him to educate his children and cater for other school requirements.  Alusine’s aim is to expand his business and he would like one of his children to take over the business in the future.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $300.

loans.use: To purchase additional bails of clothing to sell in order to increase his profits

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu C. is a successful business client that has seen her business grow as a result of the loan program.  She started her business five years ago at a very small scale.  Mariatu was a hawker and then she established a small table shop in the open air market.  After 5 loans, Mariatu rented a small shop for the business.  She is a thirty five year old mother of four children who is married to a social worker, whose income is insufficient to meet her family expenses.  Mariatu’s income supplements her family’s income and Matiatu’s husband supports her in managing the business.  She is requesting a $1200 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Mariatu wants to continue to grow her business now that she has a store front.

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en: Gibrilla is 49 years old and married with 5 children.  4 children are in school and his business is the sole source of income for their school costs. He learned soap production skills 11 years ago and started his business.  With his previous loans, Gibrilla expanded the production and could sell wholesale to retailers who are mainly women.  He would like to increase his production and extend his market to other districts.  Gibrilla would also like to buy modern appropriate soap production equipment.  He is therefore requesting a $375 loan.

loans.use: He would like to expand his business by entering new markets in other districts.  To do this he will have to increase his production.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 23 years old and married with 2 children.  Her husband is a local mechanic who has an irregular income.  Fatmata sells firewood and she has been running the business for two years.  Her income supports the family expenses.  She transports wood from the source by cart, which she said is very slow and expensive.  To use vehicles for transporting wood, Fatmata needs to purchase the wood in a large quantity, but she does not have sufficient capital to do this at present.  She is therefore requesting a $275 loan to expand and increase her stock.

loans.use: To purchase her firewood stock in bulk to increase her profits.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is married with 2 children.  Married to a local court chairman, she has to supplement her husband’s meager income to meet family expenses.  She runs a small business of selling firewood and tie and dye production.  She would like to increase the tie and dye production and is therefore requesting a $300 loan to purchase 5 bails of cotton material, caustic soda and some dyes. This Kadiatu believes will increase her market and income.

loans.use: She needs to purchase cotton fabric and other supplies to help her production of tie and dye materials.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en: Mbalu is 28 years old and married with 3 children.  She is expecting a 4th one.  Mbalu’s husband is also a petty trader in a different location in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Both work together to meet their family expenses and their future plans are to educate their children and build a family home.  With her previous loans, her business increased and she was able to generate income, which she contributed to the purchase of the family land for their home.  Mbalu is a visionary and she would like to diversify her business.  She is therefore requesting a $300 loan for this purpose.

loans.use: She would like to add different types of clothing to her clothing shop to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa started her business in 2001. With her first loan in 2003, she managed to purchase one bail of cotton material in cash instead of by the meter.  She is 48 years old, married and has 6 children all in school.  Her husband works for the government department of agriculture as an agro-technician, but the income is irregular and insufficient to take care of the children’s education.  Theresa’s business income therefore supports the family expenses.   Her husband also supports Theresa by selling the materials to other government officials.  She needs to increase her stock to generate more income for the family. Theresa is therefore requesting a $300 loan.

loans.use: She wants to increase her stock of cotton material for doing tie and dye by purchasing it on wholesale

loans.name: Zenayda

texts.es:
Zenayda has been working for 7 years selling dairy products such as cottage cheese, creme, milk, buying them directly from the small producers who travel from the country to the city to sell their products. She began her business thanks to the first loan she received, equal to about $36. Starting with a small stand outside the Terminal market in the city of Leon. She lacks a good infrastructure in her business and part of the loan she is requesting is to make needed repairs to keep out the rain.

She takes care of 4 children and is a single mother. Life has been hard for Zenayda, but with perseverance and love for her children, she has managed to improve the quality of their lives, working hard to make sure the house had food and her children could go to school. She has received ten short term loans which have helped her a lot, growing her profits and allowing her to invest more in the business, ensuring her customers of the quality of the products she offers.

Doña Zenayda ha trabajado desde hace 7 años vendiendo productos lacteos como Cuajada, crema, leche, y esto lo compra directamente a los pequeños productores que viajan del campo a la ciudad a vender este producto. Recuerda que el negocio lo comenzó gracias a un primer préstamo que hizo por la cantidad de 700 córdobas ( equivalente a 36 dólares). Empezó en un puesto fijo al aire libre fuera del mercado La Terminal en la ciudad de León. Ella carece de una buena infraestructura en su negocio y parte de este crédito lo solicita para poder mejorar sus condiciones porque cuando llueve, el agua se mete en su negocio, cuando hay mucho son tambien.

Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo y es madre soltera, la vida ha sido muy dura con ella pero con la perseverancia y el amor a sus hijos ha logrado salir adelante, trabajando fuertemente para que en su casa no le falte alimento y a sus hijos no les falte educación. Actualmente lleva trabajando con 10 créditos a corto plao y esto ha sido para ella de mucho beneficio, mucha utilidad porque las ganancias son mucho mejores, pues invierte un poquito mas en el negocio y esto le permite darle seguridad a sus clientes ya que la leche y otros productos lacteos son de calidad.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE DAIRY PRODUCTS AND GROW HER BUSINESS, ENABLING HER TO CONTINUE TO CARE FOR HER 4 CHILDREN AS A SINGLE MOTHER.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 38 years old and married to a local builder in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.

She has 4 children and all are in school. Mariatu’s income is mostly spent on their education. Mariatu would like to diversify her business by including rubber buckets, plates and other utensils. To enable her to meet her dream, she is requesting a $275 loan.

loans.use: Diversify her business and attract new clients by adding a variety of kitchen utensils to her stock

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad went in search of business opportunities to improve the economic situation of her family. She decided to dedicate herself to creating clothing woven by hand, a skill she learned when she was very young. She knows how to create all kinds of pieces by hand as well as by machine, having worked for a time in a factory. This served her well for her goal of acquiring a loom in order to produce her own designs. Her husband also contributes to their family with his work in agriculture.

Soledad has taught her family about team work and participation, so that she has the support and commitment of all the family members. Her businesses have had good results and Soledad's goal is to invest in a greater quantity and variety of wool to continue producing her work, as well as set up a small local shop. Let's help this enterprising family who with Soledad's help, continues to improve their standard of living.

Soledad, va en búsqueda de oportunidades de negocio para mejorar la economía de su hogar, impulsada por el gran amor de madre que alberga en su corazón. Y en esa búsqueda decidió dedicarse a la elaboración de prendas de vestir tejidas a mano; oficio que viene desarrollando desde que tenía doce años de edad; hoy hecha toda una mujer valiente y esforzada ha logrado vivir de su desempeño en este oficio con la producción de chompas, gorros y chalinas, se ha desarrollado con tanto talento en la vida que aprendió no sólo a tejer a mano sino también a máquina y estuvo un tiempo trabajando en una fábrica. Esto le ha servido de experiencia para que a futuro anhele adquirir una máquina de tejer para producir sus propios diseños. Por otra parte la contribución de su esposo es a través de su desempeño en los trabajos agrícolas en los que también Soledad como buena compañera aporta. Ella se ha convertido en la protagonista principal para impulsar a su familia hacia el trabajo en equipo haciéndolos participes necesarios y muy importantes, de esta manera cada uno de los proyectos que desea realizar siempre tiene acogida y mucho compromiso de parte de sus miembros activos. Cada uno de los negocios que se emprendió teniendo a este equipo de por medio ha tenido excelentes resultados y ahora el reto personal de Soledad es invertir una suma de dinero en la compra de mayor variedad y cantidad de lana para seguir produciendo sus coloridas chompitas y también para implementar la pequeña tiendita familiar. Apoyemos a esta familia emprendedora que a través de Soledad sigue adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE WOOL IN  GREATER VARIETY AND QUANTITY TO PRODUCE MORE CLOTHING, AS WELL AS SET UP A SMALL LOCAL SHOP.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata learned bread making at the age of 20, and started a micro business soon after the training.  Married with 2 children, her husband is a tailor in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  She supplies bread to restaurants and also to retailers who are hawkers in the town.  With previous loans, she managed to purchase her ingredients wholesale and this increased her production and income.  Fatmata’s aim is to construct an adequate brick bakery outside the family house and increase her production.  She believes a loan of $375 will enable her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To construct a bakery where she can produce her own bread

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en: Sorie K. is 37 years old and married with 6 children.  He sells wholesale rice and wheat flour but, he travels several times a month to make the purchases due to lack of capital.  With several trips taken to make purchases, Sorie’s income is reduced because of higher traveling expenses.  He is interested in increasing his stock and is requesting a $375 loan.

loans.use: Increase stock of wholesale items for sale

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed learned bread-baking in one of the skills development centers established by an NGO for school dropouts. After the training, Mohamed started his business with $20 in capital, using a local bakery. With his first and second loans from SMT, his business expanded and production increased. With his third loan Mohamed built a small bakery from bricks. He has seen his business growing, and has been able to pay his loans on time. He is requesting more loans to hire laborers, purchase more supplies and expand his market outlet. Mohamed is 22 years old and married with one child. His vision is to eventually see his children through their educations and for them to not drop out of school like him.

loans.use: To hire more laborers to help increase his productivity.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu S. is 38 years and married with 6 children. She has been running her bakery business for 17 years on a very small scale. She was renting the bakery from other bakers but after her third loan, S. built a small bakery within her home. She does her housework in addition to the business, and it is really hard. With no one to assist her, she could not increase production. She would like to expand her business and hire 2 workers to assist her in the production. Kadiatu is therefore requesting a $375 loan.

loans.use: She would like to hire to employees to help her in the production of her bread.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa J. is 40 years old and married with 8 children. Her husband is also a small goods trader, and both work hard to maintain their family. Hawa started her business 4 years ago, selling food in the street of Makeni town of Sierra Leone. With her second loan, she expanded her business and was able to purchase the food items in cash and on wholesale. She plans to construct a small shelter for the business and is therefore requesting a $250 loan.

loans.use: She would like to build a small shelter to house her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a cosmetics shop in Sierra Leone town of Makeni. Aminata’s husband is also a small trader. She has been in business for 4 years. Before the loans from SMT, Aminata used to take the goods from a Lebanese merchant on credit. She said it was expensive and the daily repayments could not allow her to make a good profit.  With her previous loans, she reduced the purchases on credit and her income increased. Although she still takes some goods on credit, her aim is to build her own capital, and the loan from SMT with monthly repayments will help her do that. She is therefore requesting the loan for that purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more goods with cash instead of credit, to increase her income.

loans.name: John Borbor

texts.en: John is a small trader, married with 6 children. Life was very difficult for John after the war. With some small savings, he started selling a few packets of cigarettes. When SMT expanded its activities in Makeni town of Sierra Leone, John obtained loans and diversified his business.  His children have school fees now, so he also needs to expand his business to be able to generate more income for future high school requirements. He is therefore requesting a $300 loan for the purpose. John is 52 years old.

loans.use: Expand his business in order to generate more profits for future school tuition.

loans.name: Talaleu

texts.en: Talaleu is 42 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband works as a mechanic for a local company in town. They have lived on their farm for many years and with the money they make they are able to pay for their children's education. When her husband started working, she looked after the farm, and with the help of her two brothers she has tried hard to improve and develop it. She is delighted to have this opportunity to be able to help support her family.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en: Alusine is 45 years old and married with 6 children. He has been running his business for 4 years, and the small loans from SMT enabled him to expand his business. Alusine is very grateful for the loans obtained from SMT because he is now able to generate income to meet his family’s expenses.  He is planning for a refrigerator to cool the drinks to enable him to make good sales during the summer.  He is therefore requesting a $375 loan to get a refrigerator.

loans.use: Expand his business to offer cold drinks during the summer months.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en: Alie started his business 7 years ago and has accessed several small loans from SMT. Each loan enabled Alie to increase his stock of soft drinks by 10 crates. With his last loan, Alie established himself as a supplier who purchases the drinks directly from the factory and sells them to small bars and restaurants. According to Alie, he has many orders but could not fulfill them due to lack of capital. Alie is 43 years old and married with 4 children, and his plan is to build a family house and provide the children with the best education possible.

loans.use: Increase his stock of soft drinks to meet the market demand.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is 28 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband works for one of the supermarkets in town. Luisa lives with her parents and three brothers. They had difficulties starting up their farm but through the years of hard work they have managed to overcome many problems. This is Luisa's 3rd loan with SPBD and she is very thankful for this great opportunity to help support her family.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Mummy Fatou

texts.en: Mummy is a mother of 7 children. At the age of 50 years, she runs a small grocery in the open air market of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Married to a daily laborer, Mummy has to work hard to generate enough income to meet the family’s expenses. With her previous loans, she increased her stock. She is planning to increase her stock and diversify her business so that her husband could also participate in selling of other items in the village. This, she said, “could enable them to generate sufficient income for the family.”  She is therefore requesting a $375 loan.

loans.use: Increase her stock and diversify her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu C. is 40 years old and married with 2 children. With her previous loans, she managed to increase her grocery stock.   With assistance from her husband, she rented a small shop in Makeni town of Sierra Leone. Her vision is be a progressive business woman and be able to meet her family’s expenses. She plans to expand her business and become one of the suppliers of the town. She is therefore requesting $275 for the purpose.

loans.use: To increase her stock to become one of the main grocery suppliers for the town.

loans.name: Tuli

texts.en: Tuli is 23 years old and single. She lives with her parents and through the years they have worked hard weeding and clearing an area so it would be suitable to cultivate crops. She heard of SPBD through other women of the village, and she decided to join. This is Tuli's first loan and she will spend it buying weed-killing chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and other gardening supplies. With the help of her brothers, she will make good use of their new tools so as to work faster and more efficiently.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools for her farm

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora S. is 35 years old and married with 5 children. She owns a small shop in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Her husband serves as a local court clerk, and Dora has to earn an income to supplement his meager income. She started her business by selling in the open air market, and with previous loans she managed to rent a small shop. Her plan is to increase her stock and diversify the business. She is therefore requesting a $300 loan.

loans.use: Diversify and increase her stock of goods for her general store.

loans.name: Ivonne Nilda

texts.es:
Ivonne, is a multifaceted and enterprising woman. She has great initiative to work and dedicates herself to what she learns. In spite of the difficulties she has faced, she has a strong will, inspired by her two children, to improve the quality of life for her family. Now, because her husband is very ill and unable to get out of bed, Ivonne has found herself responsible for maintaining the house and the family. She needed to put into practice something she learned from her family and friends, embroidery of handicrafts which she sells from her home. Even though it's very hard, she manages the hours needed for her work and her family. She feels satisfied that she can maintain the family. Her goal is to expand her shop and buy the materials needed to make her crafts. She is requesting a loan for this and needs your kind support to help her reach her goals.

Ivonne, es una mujer multifacética y emprendedora, estas cualidades son merecidas en su personalidad porque ella tiene ese gran ímpetu e iniciativa para trabajar y desempeñarse plenamente en lo que le encomienden. A pesar de las circunstancias difíciles que le ha tocado vivir tiene una inmensa fortaleza inspirada en sus dos hijos para sacar a flote a su familia, ahora aún más debido a que su esposo se encuentra delicado de salud y la enfermedad se ha tornado grave ya que no puede liberarse de su postración de una humilde cama.Por estas circunstancias apremiantes Ivonne ha asumido la dirección de su hogar y la manutención es directamente su responsabilidad. Esta necesidad ha hecho que ponga en práctica lo que una vez aprendió de sus familiares y amigos; el bordado de fustanes, la elaboración de artesanías llamadas mates burilados y la atención personalizada a las solicitudes de sus clientes en su pequeña tienda ubicada en casa. El tiempo muchas veces suele ser corto para, Ivonne, pero no la desanima pues ahora se ha adecuado para distribuir las horas del día en la atención de su familia y el de sus negocios. A pesar de la penosa situación por la que atraviesa su familia ella se siente satisfecha de poder sostener a su familia aunque con mucho esfuerzo; su inmenso deseo es implementar su tiendita y comprar para las demás actividades que realiza las materias primas necesarias para continuar con la elaboración del resto de sus productos y por esta razón solicita un préstamo para cumplir con lo que se ha propuesto. Recuerda que Ivonne necesita tu desinteresado apoyo para ver sonreír pronto a su familia otra vez.

loans.use: TO BETTER STOCK HER SMALL SHOP AND BUY MATERIALS NEEDED TO CONTINUE MAKING HER HANDICRAFTS.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is the happiest client that we interviewed. She gladly explained that the loan has made her relationship with her husband very cordial because she contributes greatly to meet the family’s income from her profits. She started her business with $70, and with previous loans from SMT she has increased her capital to $400. Esther is 37 years old and married with 5 children. Together with her husband, Esther plans to provide the best to their children. She is requesting another loan of $375 to increase her stock. Esther would like to purchase 125 more gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: She would like to buy additional stock of palm oil wholesale for distribution.

loans.name: Unavau

texts.en: Unavao tends to her vegetable garden every day. It is her hobby and also a source of her family’s income to complement her husband’s earnings. Having ten children is not easy and money is always needed for food and school fees. Unavao makes a profit of 180 Tala (US$ 72) per week from the sale of her vegetables. She sells both in her village as well as at the larger market in town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rakes, knives, weed-killing chemicals, and other supplies for her farm

loans.name: Maumau

texts.en: Maumau is a middle-aged mother of three children and owns a vegetable garden. She works on her garden after all her daily chores are finished. In the evening she goes around the village to sell her produce, which nets her 150 Tala (US$ 60) per week if sales are good. This money is used to make her loan repayments and most of all for providing her family with food every day and also for other family and church obligations.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools for her farm

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocio is a hardworking woman who grew up in a family whose business was making furniture such as beds as well as manufacturing mattresses. During her years growing up, Rocio dedicated a lot of time to learning about the sales of furniture and that's why five years ago she decided to start selling the furniture produced in her parents factory on her own. Now, with the experience she has gained, she would like to set up her own furniture shop. Every week she produces pieces to sell, trying to build a better future for her own family. It's hard work, but she produces pieces made with metal which are beautiful and high quality. She would like to grow this business and is requesting a loan to buy the paints and metals needed to produce her furniture. Your help is very important in helping her reach her goals.

Rocío, es una mujer valerosa con gran disposición para el trabajo, ella creció en una familia que se dedica a la fabricación de muebles de metal entre ellas camas y camarotes (camas de dos pisos), también confeccionaban colchones. Durante todos estos años Rocío aprendió y se dedicó durante mucho tiempo a la venta de muebles y es así como hace cinco años se animó a vender lo que producen en la fábrica de su padre de manera independiente.Hoy con el paso de los años y con la experiencia adquirida piensa implementar su propio taller de fabricación de muebles debido a que el conocimiento y buen manejo de recursos le provienen de familia. Por ahora día a día sale todos los domingos a comercializar lo que produjo durante los 6 días anteriores en búsqueda de un futuro mejor para sus dos hijos que la motivan y fortalecen para superar situaciones de escasez económica. A pesar del trabajo duro que requiere la fabricación de muebles asume esta labor sin miramientos y realiza bellos trabajos en metal de excelente calidad y de magnífica presentación. Desea acrecentar su negocio y es por ello que solicita un préstamo para comprar pinturas y algunos fierros que son insumos básicos para la fabricación de los bellos muebles de metal y acude a aquellas personas solidarias que decidan apoyarla. Recuerda tu aporte es muy valioso.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PAINT AND IRON TO USE IN THE PRODUCTION OF THEIR FINE FURNITURE.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
It's been more than four years since Luis Alberto decided to build a business he had inherited from his grandmother in the market called Israel Lewites in the city of Managua. He sells plastics, buying them wholesale and selling them individually at his small shop. Luis is married and has three children, two of whom attend school and the other is still a baby. He would sacrifice anything for his family. It's key to him that he provide his children with a good education, enough food to eat and a father's love. The infrastructure of his shop isn't great and there's not much security. He began with an investment of $37 and now he is able to offer a good selection of plastic products. Slowly, his business has been growing. He's increasing his income and profits and feels grateful to the help from CEPRODEL, who has been by his side supporting his efforts for three years. He has had 8 loans which he's used to invest in his business.

Hace más de cuatro años Luis Alberto decide seguir con el negocio que su abuela le heredo en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua. Sus productos los obtiene de la compra que realiza al por mayor en el mercado Oriental y los vende al detalle.

Casado, padre de tres hijos, un bebe y los otros dos en edad escolar. Su familia es su razón de existir y por quienes se sacrifica para así poder brindarles a ellos educación, alimentación y sobre todo amor de padre. La infraestructura del local es regular ya que no hay mucha seguridad sin embargo está cerrado por tablas. Empezó con un pequeño capital de US$37.00, ahora ofrece un amplio surtido en los plásticos.

Paulatinamente este negocio ha ido creciendo, sus ganancias han sido mayores y parte de esto él dice que siente que se lo debe a CEPRODEL quien ha estado a su lado apoyándolo durante casi tres años, tiempo en que ha solicitado 8 créditos.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HIS PLASTICS BUSINESS, GROWING HIS INCOME AND PROFITS IN ORDER TO PROVIDE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HIS THREE CHILDREN.

loans.name: Tulipeuliuli

texts.en: Tulipe is a widow who was motivated to work on her farm and set up her own elei (a traditional Samoan printing material) printing business because she does not want to be a financial burden to her children. She works in her own small garden plot outside her house and sometimes on the farm if she is not busy with the elei printing. Tulipe’s earnings enable her to make her loan repayments in a timely manner and also are helpful for her own family needs and home improvements.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Tise Suli

texts.en: Tise is 39-year-old lady from the village of Tulaele who sells ice cake and pancakes, serving and satisfying her community's needs and at the local primary school. She lives with her husband and 3 kids, all in school.  She works hard during the weekday, making 170 Tala (about US$ 68). This profit helps to pay her children's school fees and also for repaying her loan. She is applying for her current loan in order to expand her business and to renovate her home.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as plastic bags, Kool Aid, and sugar for her ice cake business; also for home renovations

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela is a brave lady who works each and every day to support her four children. They drive her life and energize her to continue moving forward, despite having suffered the abandonment of her husband a year ago. This episode was a very painful chapter in her life, but it did not destroy her. She always worked in food sales, and her strength has become an example to many people. She has decided to continue in her endeavors to support her children, particularly the needs of her seven year old who has been greatly impacted by the abandonment of her father. For Estela, the days of highest sales volume are Sundays which have the greatest flow of customers. She sells her foods by traveling around the local areas and her sales are steady given how well-received her dishes are by her clientele. This, and the help of her beloved children, has motivated her to continue and succeed over her recent crisis. She has plans to improve her business, and to reach this objective asks for a loan. The investment and any profits thereof are to help pay for the educational costs of her children. A brave and strong heart cannot be left unsupported. Let’s join together to help build a bright future for Estela and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Estela, es una valiente dama que día a día trabaja para sostener a sus cuatro hijos, que impulsan su vida y la animan a seguir adelante alentándola siempre a pesar de haber sufrido el abandono moral y material de su esposo hace un año, este hecho fue un capítulo muy penoso pero no la derrumbó.Siempre ha trabajado en la venta de comidas y se ha convertido en un ejemplo de fortaleza para muchas personas; está decidida a seguir desempeñándose en su ocupación eficientemente para apoyar a sus hijos y sobre todo a la pequeña de siete años que la necesita más debido al enorme impacto que causó en ella el abandono de su padre.Para Estela los días de mayor venta son los domingos porque tiene mayor afluencia de público y adicionalmente reparte de manera ambulante los pedidos de comida de sus clientes ya que su buena sazón le aseguran la venta completa de los platillos; esto y la ayuda de sus queridos hijos la animan a continuar y a superar la crisis que tuvo.Ella ha planeado mejorar su negocio y para cumplir con su objetivo solicita un préstamo. La inversión y la ganancia son en beneficio de solventar los gastos educativos de sus hijos.Un corazón valiente y lleno de fortaleza no puede dejar de ser apoyado, solidaricémonos para construirle a Estela y sus hijos un futuro prometedor.

loans.use: Capital to increase production of delicious traditional foods.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna is a talented women who always works with an incredible and good sense of humour and looks to offer the best of herself in every artesanal work of every decoration of her engraved mate-gourds. Beginning ten years ago, she has made these beautiful art-works in the company of her oldest son, after having suffered the painful death of her husband which left her with serious economic difficulties, and her work embroidering skirts wasn’t sufficient to cover the household expenses that were presented to her. Her six children had to stop studying in order to help steady the household income. With the great effort and energy that each one has put in to working as a team, her great art-making talent in her beautiful works have been recognised in competitions at interprovincial: the family representative was her oldest son and now everyone is in search of new innovative designs for their engraved mates. As part of this innovation they intend to capture in the mates that which they previously used to in the skirt-embroideries that Digna abandoned for health reasons previously and thus with her unlimited creativity in design, a spring mate-gourd shows the various colours and diverse flowers of the lush valleys fields in which they live. Without doubt this new production will be one of the most values in the local market during this season, and in her interminable zeal to progress, she wishes to export her mates with the object to cover education expenses with the profits generated by this investment. For this reason, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase the materials that she will use in the elaboration of her new artesanal designs. Help this family who through their admirable mother appeal for your generous contribution.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Digna, es una mujer talentosa que siempre trabaja con un increíble y buen sentido del humor y busca ofrecer lo mejor de sí en cada trabajo manual en cada adorno de sus mates burilados.Hace diez años realiza estos bellos trabajos en compañía de su hijo mayor tras haber sufrido el penoso fallecimiento de su esposo que la dejó en serios problemas económicos y los bordados de fustanes no eran suficientes para cubrir los gastos económicos que se presentaban en aquel entonces. Sus seis hijos tuvieron que dejar de estudiar para ayudar a reflotar la economía en casa, con el gran esfuerzo y empeño que han puesto cada uno de ellos al trabajar en equipo, su gran talento hecho arte en sus bellos trabajos han sido reconocidos en concursos a nivel interprovincial y el representante familiar fue su hijo mayor y ahora se encuentran todos en búsqueda de nuevos diseños que innoven la elaboración de sus mates burilados.Como parte de esa innovación tiene en mente plasmar en estos mates lo que antes hacia en el bordado de fustanes que por razones de salud abandonó tiempo atrás y así con su ilimitada creatividad diseño un mate primaveral eligiendo variados colores y diversas flores de los frondosos campos del valle en el que habita.Sin duda esta nueva producción será una de las más cotizadas en el mercado local durante esta temporada y en su interminable afán de progreso desea exportar sus mates con el objetivo de cubrir los gastos de educación con las ganancias que genere su inversión. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de los materiales e insumos que utilizará en la elaboración de sus nuevos diseños artesanales. Apoya a esta familia que a través de su admirable madre apela tu generosa contribución.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to continue capturing on mate-gourds the beautiful designs of Digna.

loans.name: Delma Eugenia

texts.es:
Delma Eugenia is a home maker, a loving wife and mother, and an owner of her own business. Their marriage has given Delma and her husband three children, who they have worked to help progress. Two of the children are of school age, and the oldest helps out in the business.

Approximatly four years ago Delma had to leave behind her life of working only as a housewife, and open a business in the Isreal Lewites market in the city of Managua. It was not easy for her in the beginning, as she hadn't yet learned to deal in plastics. Nevertheless, she took the risk for the well being of her family. She began with $800 in capital. Her location is not very well placed, as she must take her products out to display them.

She came up with the idea of opening her business as the need arose to pay bills and to pay for things that her husband's small salary didn't cover. Currently, Delma sells about $80.00 in product per day. Thanks to CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve the infrastructure of her location, and purchase more merchandise. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 2 years, and has a history of 9 loans.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Delma Eugenia es propietaria de su negocio, ama de casa, madre incondicional y esposa dedicada. Tienen tres hijos fruto de su matrimonio a los que en conjunto con su esposo han tratado de sacar adelante. Dos de sus hijos están en edad escolar y el mayor le ayuda en el local.

Hace cuatro años aproximadamente Delma tuvo que abandonar la vida únicamente de ama de casa e iniciar su negocio en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua. El inicio de su negocio no fue facil pues como todo comienzo ella no manejaba muy bien el asunto de los plásticos, sin embargo aun así se arriesgo por el bienestar de su familia.Comenzó con un capital de U$800.00. Su local no esta muy bien ubicado ya que para exhibir su producto tiene que sacarlo.

La idea de poner su negocio surge debido a la necesidad de sufragar gastos y cubrir necesidades que el salario devengado por su esposo no cubría. Hoy en día Delma vende aproximadamente U$80.00 diarios, gracias a CEPRODEL ha podido ampliar la infraestructura de su local y comprar más mercadería. Tiene 2 años de trabajar con CEPRODEL con un récord de 9 creditos.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Tafale

texts.en: Tafale is a married mother of 26 years of age with 2 children. Her husband used to be a farmer but when he got a carpentry job in town, he decided to leave the farm because of having hard times durning a taro blight which destroyed many farms in the islands. Tafale heard of SPBD through some of the women in her village, so she thought this could be a great opportunity to develop their farm again.Tafale joined SPBD in 2005, and with her first loan she bought chemicals and other farming equipment. She's very thankful because of the chance she has had to develop some things in her family which she could not do before.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools for her farm

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, is a native of Cochas GranD.. She was born and raised in a family of farmers and artisans, and this training has helped her succeed. When she was about 10 years old, her parents taught her the art of carving the "burilados" mats and she has trained her six children who also work making these mats. Carmen feels very satisfied with the work she does, she is delighted that she developed fine strokes, and what especially pleases her is when one of her animals goes to graze in the field, and she draws inspiration from the blue skies to incorporate in her work. Now, that most of her children are adults, and all that is left is to look after her young ones, she'd like to continue with her work in order to ensure that her children have a better future. Carmen would like to move forward applying for this loan to invest in the purchase of materials and supplies and continue creating her beautiful mats. She would also like to buy fodder for her animals. Let's join with Carmen and continue generating prosperity for her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen, es natural D. Cochas GranD., nació y creció en una familia netamente agricultora y artesanal, esta formación la ha ayudado a salir adelante debido a que desD. los diez años sus padres le han enseñado el arte D. tallar los mates burilados y ahora ella transmite estos conocimientos a sus seis hijos que también trabajan realizando estos trabajos con mucho esmero.Carmen se siente muy satisfecha del trabajo que realiza, a ella le agrada mucho elaborar finos trazos y lo hace muy gustosa aún más cuando se va a pastar a sus animales al campo y aprovecha la inspiración del azul del cielo para hacer finos trazos del dibujo que desea plasmar.Ahora que la mayoría D. sus hijos están en edad adulta sólo le queda velar por los menores y desea continuar con su labor para asegurar en sus hijos un futuro mejor y también su vejez. Para seguir adelante solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra D. materiales e insumos para seguir elaborando sus bellos mates y también para comprar forraje para sus animalitos. Solidaricémonos con Carmen para que continúe generando bienestar a su querida familia.

loans.use: To purchase material and supplies in order to continue creating her beautiful crafts/decorations. (Compra de materiales e insumos para continuar con la fabricación de sus bellos adornos.)

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es:
For the last seventeen years, this woman has possessed a small but well stocked fruit stand. In her own words, she has had to work hard to grow her business, and has dedicated herself to it since she was very young. Before she had this location, she worked in the Diriamba market. She began by walking through the city, selling out of a hamper, with initial capital of $500, her husband’s savings.

Thanks to her sacrifice and perseverance, she has succeeded in making adequate use of her own resources and those from the credits she has received; she is earning better profits at her stand, while at the same time stretching herself to increase the stock in her business to have just a little bit of everything. Mrs. L. is married, and her partner supports her with the household expenses, though not 100% due to her low salary that supports eight school-age children being raised alongside her partner.

With CEPRODEL she has had 14 credit loans in two years, and says she is pleased with the work alliance she has with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora posee, desde hace poco más de 17 años, un pequeño, pero bien surtido puesto de ventas de frutas. Según manifiesta ella misma, ha tenido que luchar duramente para hacer crecer su negocio, ya que desde muy joven se ha dedicado al comercio. Antes de tener este local, trabajaba en el mercado de Diriamba. Empezó vendiendo en un canasto de manera ambulante con un capital de US$500.00 los cuales eran ahorros de su esposo.

Gracias a su sacrificio y perseverancia ha logrado hacer uso adecuado de sus propios recursos y de los recursos provenientes de los créditos que ha recibido, realizando mejoras en el puesto que posee y a su vez esforzándose por aumentar el surtido de su negocio, es decir, tiene de todo un poco, aunque en menores cantidades. La señora L. esta casada, su pareja le apoya con los gastos del hogar, aunque no en un 100%, debido a su bajo salario q, tiene ocho hijos, todos ellos en edad escolar los cuales está formando junto a su pareja.

Con CEPRODEL lleva 14 creditos en 2 años y dice sentirse satisfecha de esta alianza de trabajo con esta Institucion.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina creates finely embroidered products with her artistic hands, working diligently day by day to sustain her family. Thanks to this activity she has been able to keep her family together, with the support of each and every member, and will continue to put forth great effort for their benefit. Today she is applying what her mother taught her as a child, an art she has perfected over the years and her work is in high demand in the local market. She meets embroidery requests from her loyal customers, and also rents out traditional costumes for use during festivals/celebrations. She has a great desire to succeed, and wishes to increase her customer base. For this reason, she asks for a loan to buy thread and fabric to improve her business and increase earnings to maintain her family. Let’s support this hardworking and diligent woman. Your collaboration is very important.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Armandina, realiza trabajos de bordados finamente elaborados con sus artísticas manos, día a día trabaja diligentemente para poder llevar el sustento a su familia.Gracias a esta actividad la ha podido mantener unida porque cuenta con el importante apoyo de cada uno de los integrantes que trabajan para el bienestar de su y seguirá esforzándose con ellos y en beneficio de ellos.Ahora está aplicando lo que un día de niña su madre le enseño y el trabajo con el correr de los años ha ido perfeccionando su técnica de bordado y sus trabajos están siendo cada vez más cotizados en el mercado local, ella atiende pedidos de sus fieles clientes que acuden a su bordaduría familiar, además, no sólo se dedica a adornar los bellos fustanes de las damas de su localidad sino también a alquilar trajes típicos para las festividades que celebra cada comunidad.Ella tiene grandes deseos de superación y desea incrementar su clientela mejorando notablemente sus trabajos, es por ello que solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de hilos y telas para seguir afrontando los gastos de manutención de su familia con las ganancias que genere su actividad.Apoya a una mujer trabajadora y diligente, tu colaboración es muy importante.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread for embroidery business to help meet the dreams of her children.

loans.name: Apaau

texts.en:
Apaau is 37 years old, married with 2 children. She lives with her parents and 8 other relatives all of whom rely on the farm as their main source of income. Apaau joined SPBD’s loan program in 2006 when all the farms in the island were destroyed by the taro blight. They almost gave up because there was no cure to stop spread of the blight. Through the years they have planted other crops such as bananas, taamu, and yams.

Today Apaau and her family have started to earn more than in previous years. They have renovated their home; they also own a taxi which they bought from the money they earn from the farm. Apaau is very thankful for this opportunity to borrow money which has changed her family’s lives.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools for her farm

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is a 47-year-old mother of seven children. She comes from a family of 7 brothers and 5 sisters. Her family is very poor and sometimes they sell coconuts and cocoa along the roadside or around town. When Sina got married 20 years ago, her husband came from a family who relied mostly on vegetable farming. Sina heard of SPBD through women of the village, and this is her second loan with the program. She is very thankful for the chance to develop her business and help financially support her family.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a married mother of 33 years of age with 4 children. Her husband works for a local carpentry company in town. Through the years they have had hard times in raising their children and dealing with family commitments. Her husband is paid every two weeks, but unfortunately his salary is not sufficient to support their family. Daisy decided to do something to assist her husband in supporting their children, especially in terms of school fees, bills, and other family obligations for funerals, weddings, and church donations. She is working hard on her sewing and earning 160 Tala (about US$ 64) per week. The extra income really helps in improving their family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Tafiga

texts.en:
Tafiga is a 27-year-old married mother with 3 children (aged 5, 4, and 2). When Tafiga got married she decided to move out of her parents’ house, but unfortunately they were very poor and could not afford living on their own. They moved in with her husband’s family, who owned a farm. Tafiga decided to join SPBD so they could can develop the farm and earn more money.

Through years of struggling they have managed to improve many things in her home and increase the size of their farm. Just recently her husband bought a second-hand taxi which has really helped in earning additional income. Tafiga is very thankful for the support SPBD has given her, which has helped to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
This young businesswoman is single with 2 children, with great wishes to succeed. Thanks to her parents and partner they gathered US$1000 a few years ago and established a modest and humble business.

This business has been located in the Israel Lewites market for more than 19 years. Prior to having this business she was a housewife, but she had to go to work due to the dificult economic situation that confronted her family.

Today her business has grown and she feels happy to have propered. She has worked with CEPRODEL for more than 2 years and has a very good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta joven emprendedora, es soltera con 2 hijos y con grandes deseos de superación. Gracias a que sus padres y compañero de vida reunieron un capital de US$1,000.00 (dolares) con lo que hace varios años establecieron un modesto y humilde puesto .

El puesto que actualmente ella posee está ubicado en el mercado Israel Lewites desde hace más de 19 años, antes de tener su puesto ella era ama de casa, condicion que tuvo que abandonar debido a la situacion economica dificil que enfrentaba su familia. Hoy en dia su negocio ha progresado y se siente muy dichosa de haber prosperado. Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace más de 2 años con quien tiene muy buen récord crediticio.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Levaai

texts.en: Levaai T. is a widowed mother of 8 children. Her husband passed away 4 years ago, and at that time she had 5 children still in school. She struggled very hard to support her family. When her two eldest sons completed their schooling, they were able to help her in terms of monetary support. The extra hands really helped her as she tried to run canteens in secondary schools in the village. Now she is earning more than 1000 Tala ($400 US) per week. Levaai is so thankful for the support of SPBD.

loans.use: To buy inventory and supplies for her canteens

loans.name: Mataumai

texts.en: Mataumai is a 50-year-old married mother. She lives in the eastern side of the island of Upolu which is about 50 kilometers from the main town. Her husband has been a farmer all his life. In Lona Fagaloa most of the people live on farms that produce Ava (a Samoan plant whose juice is used in traditional ceremonies) since the type of soil in the area is a bit dry as it is mostly surrounded by mountains. For so many years they have struggled to improve their family’s living standards. When she joined SPBD, Mataumai managed to improve things gradually. With her second loan, she will buy equipment for her Ava plantings as well as for home renovations.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her farm

loans.name: Martha Gilma

texts.es:
Martha and her husband are in the food business, and besides food they sell sodas and pastries. Another part of their it is to provide phone services. Martha started this business 10 years ago, with US$ 800 that she and her husband had saved. They have a son. He has been the inspiration that help them keep going. They didn't want him to lack anything, specially their love and the possibility to go to school. And it was because of their support that Martha's son grew up and became self-sufficient. Now they have a grandson.

Before Martha had her own business, she used to sell clothes made in Panama. Then she started the food business from scratch, and little by little it has grown in size and clientele. They are making profits. Martha says that CEPRODEL has been a great help, because it has always being there for them. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years and she has repaid 7 loans.
