Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva volunteer.

Este negocio se caracteriza por la venta de comida, gaseosas, repostería, además consta de alquiler de telefonía. Martha comenzó con este negocio desde hace 10 años con un capital de US$800.00 que eran ahorros de ella y su esposo. Tienen un hijo el cual era la razón del sacrificio de esta pareja, ya que no deseaban que le faltara nada a su hijo, principalmente educación y amor. Gracias a este sacrificio ya el hijo es mayor e independiente y les ha brindado un nieto

Antes de tener su propio negocio, ella se dedicaba a la venta de ropa nueva panameña. Su negocio comenzó con pocas condiciones, sin embargo poco a poco ha logrado ir creciendo tanto en clientela como en ganancias. Ella comenta que CEPRODEL ha tenido un fuerte impacto en su negocio ya que siempre ha estado a su disposición a la hora que lo ha necesitado.

Lleva más de 2 años trabajando con CEPRODEL con un récord de 7 créditos.

loans.use: Buying goods to sell

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en: Susitina is a woman of forty-five, married with four kids. She has applied for her latest loan in order to buy all the chemicals needed for her farm as well as for repairing the back of her house which is badly need of repair. Her first loan was used to start up her farm, which is doing well now. She also hopes to repair the roof and the front of her house with her next loan. And she is very thankful for the help she get from this loan program.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals for her farm and for home improvement

loans.name: Leaia

texts.en: Leaia is a 27-year-old single lady who just finished school but is still unemployed. She started working on her vegetable garden for a source of income. She applied for her loan in order to buy chemicals and new vegetables seeds for expanding the garden. She sells her produce at the market 3 days a week, and makes a profit of 130 Tala (about US$ 52) per day. When she has a surplus left over, she sells it in her village. She is now comfortable with her business and is glad that she can financially support her parents.

loans.use: To buy supplies and tools for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Raising 3 school aged children has been quite challenging for Hoàng Thị Diện, a 34 years old mat weaver. Despite the fact that she worked very hard, her family living condition was difficult. She joined TYM to borrow money to buy material for mat weaving. She started with a small loan. To date, she had borrowed and reimbursed all her loans totaling a few thousands US dollars. Her family living condition had improved. Her husband, Mr Nguyễn Khắc Thơi, is very supportive of her. This time after discussing with her husband, Ms Diện would like to borrow 375 USD to buy material for mat weaving.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Nuôi 3 đứa con trong độ tuổi ăn học, chị Hoàng Thị Diện, 34 tuổi, dù rất chăm chỉ dệt chiếu nhưng kinh tế gia đình vẫn gặp rất nhiều khó khăn. Vì thiếu vốn mua nguyên liệu chị đã tìm đến Quỹ TYM. Bắt đầu với các mức vốn nhỏ, đến nay tổng số vốn chị đã vay và hoàn trả lên đến vài nghìn USD. Nhờ sử dụng vốn có hiệu quả, kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển hơn. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Khắc Thơi luôn là người hỗ trợ chị trong việc sử dụng và hoàn trả vốn. Vòng vốn này, chị đã bàn với chồng đề nghị Quỹ cho vay 375USD đầu tư mua thêm cói làm chiếu.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make mat.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
In 2003, Ms Hoàng Thị Tín was one of the poorest member in her village. At first, she applied for a small loan because she wasn't confident about the weekly payment. To her surprise, it was quite easy for her to make the weekly payment with the money from the sales of the mats the she weaved. The profit was good. So in later rounds, she always applied for maximum amount. After 4 years, she has renovated her house and bought tools. This time she's requesting a loan of 450 USD to buy sedge for mat weaving. She's 39 and she looks younger than when she first joined TYM.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Năm 2003 chị Hoàng Thị Tín là một trong những hội viên nghèo trong thôn, nhà tranh tre tạm bợ. Vòng vốn đầu chị không dám vay cao vì còn sợ việc trả hàng tuần. Nhưng việc dệt chiếu trả tuần đối với chị không ngờ lại dễ dàng như vậy. Lợi nhuận thu được cũng khá. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay mức vốn tối đa. Qua 4 năm tham gia Quỹ chị đã sửa được nhà, mua sắm được một số trang thiết bị. Vòng vốn này chị Tín đề nghị vay 450USD thêm vào mua cói để dệt chiếu. Ở tuổi 39, trông chị tươi trẻ hơn nhiều so với ngày đầu tham gia Quỹ.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make mat.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Before joining TYM fund, the family of Lê Thị Bính was in difficult condition because they only had a small piece of land, 3/10 acre. She joined TYM fund and with the loan, she bought a boat and fishing net for her husband who is a fisherman. Everytime he comes back from the sea with fishes, she sells them at the market. The family income has raised and their lives have changed for the better. Today her children are grown up and they do earn their living. This time she's requesting a loan of 575 USD to buy a tractor to augment her farm's productivity also she can rent it to make money

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Trước đây vì chưa có vốn làm ăn nên gia đình chị Lê Thị Bính chỉ trông chờ vào 3 mẫu ruộng. Từ ngày có Quỹ Tình Thương cho vay lớn trả nhỏ chị xin vay vốn đầu tư vào mua lưới và thuyền đi đánh cá. Cứ sau mỗi lần anh đi biển về, chị lại mang cá ra chợ bán. Thu nhập tăng lên đáng kể và cuộc sống cũng có nhiều thay đổi. Đến nay con chị cũng đã lớn và biết làm ăn. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 575USD mua thêm máy cày để sản xuất đạt hiệu quả cao hơn, ngoài ra còn đi cày thuê nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập.

loans.use: Buy tractor-pulled plough

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is 32 years old, married, and has two kids. She applied for this loan in order buy inventory for her small shop. She is very happy because this is the only opportunity for financial support that she can get to help out her small business. She says that in the past she didn’t make much profit, but things are going better now that she is able to expand her inventory. She thinks she is going to stay in the program for a long time and get more loans.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her small shop

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Luu Thi D. is 43 years old. She lives in Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa with her husband and three children. All the children are at school ages therefore her family expenses are rather high. Her husband, Mr. Le Van Oanh, is a farm worker (he ploughs fields). She raises pigs at home to make ends meet. Their family income is around $180 USD/month. This time she requests a loan of $375 to buy more pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, a Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lưu Thị D., 43 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Cả 3 cháu đều đang trong độ tuổi ăn học cho nên chi phí trong gia đình rất lớn. Anh Lê Văn Oanh, chồng chị, đi cày thuê để kiếm tiền trong khi đó chị ở nhà chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình hiện nay khoảng 180USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 375 để mua thêm lợn về chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy pigs.

loans.name: Aiofaiva

texts.en: Aiofaiva is a 33-year-old lady who is married with two children. She has applied for this loan in order to buy materials and supplies such as sugar, cordials and plastic cups for her business. Aiofaiva sells the ice cakes (popsicles in bags) at the local school five days per week and in the village during the  week. She wishes to get another loan to buy  a big freezer for her ice-cakes because the one she has now is very small and old.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her ice cake (popsicle) business

loans.name: Leta

texts.en: Leta is a 45-year-old lady, married with four kids. She is working very hard at her business because it is her only source of income to support her family and provide for her children’s education. She applied for this loan in order to buy all the tools and chemicals needed for her vegetable garden. Leta sells her produce at the village during the week and at the town market during weekends. Her business is going well now thanks to the financial support from previous loans.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 27 years old, married, and has three kids. She is a very hard-working lady and her family owns a vegetable garden and plantation. She has applied for this loan in order to buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, and tools for her garden. Rita is thankful for the loans because it helps her to make ends meet, and she hopes to remain in the loan program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Potoae

texts.en: Potoae is sixty six years old with four kids. She is an active woman in her community where she is known for her hard work and her support of her family. Even though she is old, she still wants to help support her family financially. Potoae has  applied for this loan (her second) which is for the same amount as her first loan, in order to pay for the things needed for her plantation such as chemicals and tools.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Ous

texts.en: Mrs. Ous S., age 43, works with her husband on their plot of farmland. They grow rice crops, together earning around US$5 a day. They have three children, two of whom are employed at a garment factory making about US$75 a month each, while their third child is unemployed. Mrs. S. would like to receive a loan of US$700 to purchase a small plot of land and seeds for cultivation. She hopes that, by expanding her output to meet customer demand, she will be able to earn more and raise the family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of land and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Matiliana

texts.en: Matiliana is a single lady of thirty years of age who is very talented in sewing different kinds of clothes. She has been in the loan program for three years and has always made her repayments very quickly and obeyed the rules of the program. She applied for this loan to buy an industrial sewing machine and other supplies such as threads, needles and fabrics. Matiliana sells her garments at the market every week but most of her clients come over to her place to get their clothes sewn. She said she plans to stay a long time in the loan program because it helps her business and to support her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Mrs. Try R., age 52, sells rice in her community, earning around US$1.60 a day. Her husband is employed by the non-profit HOPE organization, earning US$5 a day. They have seven children, several of whom work in garment factories. Mrs. R. would like to borrow US$800 in order to purchase a grinding mill to separate the rice from the husk, as well as buy large quantities of rice from local farmers. She would then process the purchased rice in the grinding mill and sell it at a nearby market.

loans.use: Purchase of a rice-grinding mill and large quantities of rice

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen S., age 48, raises and sells domestic animals, including pigs, chickens, and ducks, earning less than US$1 a day. Her husband works as a chef at a restaurant, earning about US$5.80 a day. The couple (pictured in the photo) has seven children. Mrs. S. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase more utensils and kitchen equipment for her husband's work. Being able to cook a wider variety of food, he will earn more, and be better able to support the family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen tools to expand their business.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Mrs. Pen S., age 48, raises and sells domestic animals such as pigs, chickens, and ducks, earning less than $1 per day. Her husband works as a chef at a restaurant, earning on average about $5.80 per day. They have seven children. She would like to request this loan of $1000 in order to purchase more utensils and kitchen equipment for her husbands work. If he can cook a wider variety of food, she anticipates business will increase and their family’s income will rise. She is pictured with her husband in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen tools to expand their business.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi is a forty two year old lady and a mother of four kids. None of them are employed so her plantation is their only source of income. She applied for this loan in order to buy the necessary chemicals and tools. Aliitasi sells vegetables and crops at the market  three days per week and makes a profit of 210 Tala ($84 US) per day. She will use her next loan  to improve her vegetable garden which goes together with her plantation business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary F. is 43 years old,  married with four children. Her plantation is her only source of income, but she is experienced in running it as she grew up on a plantation. She has applied for this loan in order to buy weed-killing chemicals. She sells her crops at the market three days per week and makes a profit of 230 Tala ($92 USD) per day. Mary plans to use her this loan to expand her plantation in order to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai T., age 23, is a housewife. Her husband (pictured in the photo) is a recycler, earning about US$1 a day from selling the items he collects to a recycling plant. They have two small children who are not yet in school. Mrs. T. would like to borrow US$600 in order to purchase five piglets to raise, feed, and house in a barn. By then selling the grown pigs, she will be able to increase the family’s income, which will help finance her children’s education one day.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai T., age 23, is housewife. Her husband is a recycler, earning about $1 per day in profit from reselling the items he collects to the recycling plant. They have two small children who are not yet in school. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase five piglets to raise, feed, and house in a barn. Once she resells the grown pigs, she will increase her family’s income which will help finance her children’s education one day. Her husband is pictured in the photo as his wife was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai T., age 23, is housewife. Her husband is a recycler, earning about $1 per day in profit from reselling the items he collects to the recycling plant. They have two small children who are not yet in school. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase five piglets to raise, feed, and house in a barn. Once she resells the grown pigs, she will increase her family’s income which will help finance her children’s education one day. Her husband is pictured in the photo as his wife was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao M. is a 43-year-old lady who is married with five kids. She is very talented in making and designing handicrafts such earrings, rings and traditional Samoan mats. She has applied for this loan in order to buy supplies for her business and also to build a small house for her family. Mao hopes that future loans will be used to finish off the house and furnish it. Mao is very happy to participate in the loan program and she hopes to remain with it for a long time to come.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti K. is  35 years old and married. She is a creative lady capable in making and designing elei (a traditional Samoan fabric) materials and she wishes to use her talent to earn a living. She has applied for this loan in order to buy the materials she needs, such as paints, brushes, and fabrics. Koreti delivers her products to big shops in town. She works  three days per week and make a profit of 260 Tala ($104 USD) per day. Koreti is very proud of her business especially now that she has some financial support through loans.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her elei (traditional Samoan fabric) printing

loans.name: Susana Mila

texts.en: Susana M. is 62 years old and married with seven children. She is a good tailor with a great reputation among her customers. She learned to sew from her parents, who are now retired, and thus she is looking to become financially independent. Susana applied for this loan in order to buy the materials and supplies she needs. She is very happy to participate in the loan program.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Malofou

texts.en: Malofou L. is a 65-year-old widowed lady with six children. She enjoys running her handicrafts business in her spare times at home because she too old to perform physically-demanding duties. She makes bags, hats, fans, and Samoan table mats and sells them at the market and in the village too. She makes them four days per week and gets a profit of 180 Tala ($72 USD) per day. Malofou  is glad that it provides financial help for her family and her personal needs.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Atalani

texts.en: Atalani Samailia is 42 years old and married with three children. She is very good at baking cakes, pies, scones, donuts and buns. She applied for this loan in order to buy the ingredients needed for her mixtures and baking. Atalani delivers some of her goods to shops in the village but mostly sells in town where she is developing a great reputation. This is all thanks to the loans that she has received so far.  She hopes to remain in the loan program for a long time to come.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Sailiga

texts.en: Sailiga S. is a 62 year old woman with six children. She is very talented in sewing different types of clothes, which she learned from her mother who has passed away. Sailiga applied for this loan in order to buy the materials she needs to run her business. Most of her clients come to her place to get their garments sewn, but if it is slow she sews and delivers to the flea market.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Foketi

texts.en: Foketi F. is 33 years old, married with four kids. She applied this loan in order to buy supplies for her bingo business. She runs the bingo two nights per week and she can make 420 Tala ($160 USD) per night. Foketi  is thinking of running the bingo three times a week if possible. She plans to use her next loan to attract more clients. She is very happy with her business and she is thankful for the help she gets from the loan program.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her bingo business

loans.name: Vaoesea

texts.en: Vaoesea T. is 34 years old, married with two kids. She applied for this loan in order to buy the ingredients needed to make her ice cakes (popsicles in a bag). She sells them at the village during the entire week, mostly at the local school where sales are the quickest. She can earn 84 Tala ($34 USD) per day. She hopes to use her next loan to buy a bigger freezer for her business in order to sell more.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her ice cakes business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena H. is a 25-year-old lady who is married with a daughter. She applied for this loan in order to buy ingredients and a second hand freezer for her ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) business. Elena sells the ice cakes at the village school every week and makes a profit of 120 Tala ($48 USD) per day which is very helpful for her family’s needs. She hopes that her next loan will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Tumama

texts.en: Tumama F. is a 43-year-old woman who is married with four children. She is one of the oldest members of the loan program and has always repaid her loans regularly. She applied for this loan in order to buy a new electric oven for her baking as well as foods to sell at her stall. Tumama is very comfortable with her business now as it is starting to become more sustainable. She hopes that her next loan will help her renovate her family’s house.

loans.use: To buy a new electric oven and inventory for her fast food stall

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli H. is 31 years old, married with two kids. She applied for this loan in order to buy supplies she needs to run her fast food  business. She sells at the local school every week and makes a profit of 160 Tala ($64 USD) per day which is a great financial help to her family. Kalameli hopes to use her next loan to build a special place to sell. She is very happy to be in the loan program and hopes to remain in it for a long time.

loans.use: To buy supplies and inventory for her fast food stall

loans.name: Mohammad Azim

texts.en: Mohammad Azim lives in District 7 of Kabul Afghanistan and is married and since he is the only son, he has the responsibility of helping his family which he is happy to do. He is a tailor who has a lot of experience in his work so he wants to expand his business by taking out an individual loan. With this loan he hopes to buy new machines and increase his stock which will help him make a good income. He also wants to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new machines and expand his stock

loans.name: Shahjahan

texts.en: My name is ShahJahan B. and I have two children. I have always been eager to help my husband with the household expenses. So, after my marriage, I started a clothing business. I buy clothes from a busy nearby market and sell them from my house to my neighborhood clientele. I make a good profit from this business and that has enabled me to help support my family. My son has recently joined in this clothing business and he travels to various parts of the city and sells clothes door to door. I would like to expand my clothing business by adding new types of clothing to the existing inventory. I would like a loan of $350 to expand my business.

loans.use: Buy a greater variety of clothes for the business

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: My name is Mussarat B. and I'm from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married with six children. My husband and I do not work anymore, as we have grown old. My eldest son feels that it is time for us to rest and time for him to work. He has started a business making steel rulers (a strip of wood, metal, or other material that has a straight edge and usually marked in inches or centimeters, and is used for drawing lines, measuring, and so on). I am requesting a loan of US$350 for my son’s business. With this loan, he will be able to buy steel in bulk and use it to manufacture these rulers. Buying in bulk is relatively cheaper and will enable us to produce more rulers.

loans.use: Buy steel in bulk to manufacture rulers

loans.name: Amin Allah

texts.en: Amin Allah lives in District 7 of Kabul Afghanistan, is married and lives with his extended family.  He owns a retail grocery shop which he started seven years ago in Kabul and wants to now enlarge his shop in order to increase his income. He will use this loan to buy extra goods like bags of chocolates, bags of sweets, and triple-packs. He is very happy to be supporting his family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like bag of chocolates,bag of sweets,twin-pick,triple-pack

loans.name: Alberto José

texts.pt:
Alberto José C., age 33, lives with his partner and 5 children in the neighborhood of Laulane, Mozambique. He sells leather goods (shoes, belts, brief cases, etc) in the Magoanine's central market. Since he joined the program, in January of this year, his business has grown from a small stand to a much bigger one, where he now sells clothing in addition to leather goods.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Alberto José C. tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 5 filhos. Vive no bairro Laulane e tem o seu negócio no mercado de Magoanine.Vende diverso calçado, cintos, capulanas,pastas, etc. Entrou para o programa em Janeiro do presente ano com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Está no terceiro ciclo e vai tomar 20.000MT para pagar em 6 meses. Teve um crescimento assinalável no negócio: quando entrou para o programa tinha apenas um pequena banca e agora tem uma barraca bem grande na qual vende diverso vestuário e calçado.

loans.use: stock increase

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: I am Rehana B. from Lahore. I have two children, a son and a daughter. My daughter is in first grade and my son attends kindergarten. A couple of years ago my husband went abroad to find better employment for himself. However, he has not yet settled there and is currently unable to send us any money. To run my household expenses, I embroider clothes. I would like my children to continue with their studies but that is difficult to do with my current income. I would like a loan of $350 to expand my existing business. I would use the loan to buy cloth, threads and sequins in bulk. I hope to generate higher profits, which will help me put better food on my table and continue sending my children to school.

loans.use: Buy cloth and other embroidery supplies in bulk

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: I am the mother of three children, two boys and one girl. My children attend school, except the youngest one who is too young to attend. My husband has been abroad for the last few years. I thank God he is doing well over there and is able to send us money. I live with one of my brothers, who operates a cosmetics business. He is working very hard to make it a success. He needs to buy shampoo and other inventory items in bulk for his business, but lacks the necessary funds. He would like a loan of $350. I assure you that he is responsible and will repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To help her brother buy cosmetics and increase store inventory.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun V. was married in 1983 and has four children: one son and three daughters. Currently, she plants and sells vegetables in front of her house. In addition to the vegetables she grows, she buys some vegetables from the market and some from a neighboring village for reselling. She began to farm and resell vegetables in 1990. Her husband is a soldier. One of her children is helping her sell vegetables, and the other three are studying.

She has borrowed $200 from MAXIMA before. She will use this loan to purchase vegetables to resell in front of her house.

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables for reselling in front of her house.

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.en: Golibjon Kudoinazarov is an active client of Microinvest. He is 25 and he is not married. He lives with his parents. His business is cattle breeding and he has been in it for 10 years. He loves his work very much and his parents help him to take care of his animals.  His farm is located in the Ovchikalacha region, Khujand, Tajikistan. Currently he has 4 steers. They have fattened enough for sale and he is going sell them soon. He wants to receive good profit from the holiday trade. From KIVA he is requesting a loan which he plans to spend for reconstruction of his cowshed.

loans.use: Reconctruction of cowshed

loans.name: Rahmonberdi

texts.en: R. Rahmonberdy has been a stockbreeder for 10 years. He is father of one child. He has a big farm at his house in Ovchikalacha, Khujand, Tajikistan. Currently he has 4 bulls and two calves. He needs extra capital to rebuild his cow barn. In future he wishes to increase the number of his bulls.

loans.use: Reconstruction of a barn for his cattle

loans.name: Maria Moisés

texts.pt:
A single mother of six children, Maria José Z. sells cashew nuts at the central market in Maputo, Mozambique. The big sacks of pre-peeled cashew nuts she buys at wholesale price are seasoned in various ways (with sugar, salt, pepper, etc) and sold at the market in 16 oz. packages. Maria has paid all previous loans timely, and is now on her third loan cycle. The business steady (since joining the program) growth has allowed her to start putting money into a savings account regularly.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Moisés Z. é solteira e mãe de 6 filhos. Entrou para o programa em Dezembro de 2006 com um empréstimo de 4.000MT. Vende castanha de cajú no mercado central na baixa da cidade de Maputo.Ela compra castanha já descascada , prepara (com sal, açúcar, piri-piri) e vende em embalagens de 700 gramas.Vai para o 3º ciclo e vai tomar 9.000MT em 6 meses. O negócio tem estado a crescer gradualmente, é pontual nos pagamentos e deposita poupança a 15%.

loans.use: To buy more cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun V. married in 1991 and has three children: two sons and one daughter. Currently, she is weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 1992, and she started her silk production in the same year. All of her children are studying. Her husband, Mr. Sok Vai, is a fisherman and a boat repairer, too. He fishes every day along the Mekong river around his village and sometimes in the lake. He has finished high school. They both work hard every day to support their children in school, and they hope that all of their children will get high education in the future.

This is her second loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $700. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, and buy one boat and a fishing net for her husband.

loans.use: Purchase silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, and one boat and fishing net.

loans.name: Jumaboi

texts.en: Jumaboi Jalabnoev is an experienced cattleman as he has been in this business for over 12 years. He has his own farm where he has 6 bulls and two cows. Additionally he has agrarian property where he handles wheat. Every season he gives his harvest to the collective farm and uses the hay from the fields for his livestock. Currently he is requesting a loan for purchasing fertilizer to improve the harvest.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to grow more wheat for hay

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
N. Shuhrat has been a young cattleman on an Ovchikalacha collective farm called “Urunhodjaev” for 3 years. He is 27. He is married and lives with his grand-parents. His parents are old and his wife looks after them. So Shuhrat is the one member of the family who earns money for family needs.

When he heard about Microinvest, Shuhrat decided to have his own farm at home and with his first loan he bought two calves. His business is raising livestock and selling them at the animal market. Now he wants to receive a loan to purchase 1 ton of mixed fodder for his livestock.

loans.use: Purchase 1 ton of mixed fodder

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan Y., age 45, is a widow who makes her living by producing mortar and pestles, earning on average US$4 a day in revenue. She has four children: two work at a garment factory earning US$80 a month each, and two are students. Mrs. Y. would like to borrow US$700 in order to buy more rocks to increase the mortar and pestle output and her income. She will use the additional income to raise her family’s standard of living and fund her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of rocks to produce mortar and pestles

loans.name: Khanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Khanthy A. married in 1979 and has four children, three sons and one daughter. She began her farming after she got married. In addition, she is also weaving silk at home since 1980. Her husband plants vegetables and food crops in their farm. Her daughter is working in a garment factory. One of her sons is an air conditioner repairman and the youngest son is studying at university in Phnom Penh. Khanthy’s family live on an island called Koh Uk Nhatey along the Mekong River. This location provides a lot of opportunity to the people who live in this commune, including Khanthy’s family, for doing farming and also fishing.

Khanthy has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice; she is presently asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to purchase seeds for about $250 and the other $250 will be used to rent more land for expanding their vegetable garden.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and renting land for expanding vegetable garden

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en: Mrs. Tuon H., age 33, works producing and selling mortar and pestles, making about US$2 a day in profit. Her husband is a carpenter who makes about US$10 a day in revenue. They have one child who is a student. Mrs. H. would like to receive a loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase a larger supply of rocks for mortar and pestle production, and to purchase an electric saw to make her husband more productive at his job. Investing in both of their businesses will lead to an increased income for the family, which will allow them to afford a better quality of life, pay for their child’s education, and re-invest in their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of rocks to produce more mortar and pestles, and purchase of an electric saw

loans.name: Boin

texts.en: Mrs. Boin H., age 38, works on her plot of land raising pigs, earning less than US$1 a day. Her husband sells firewood and charcoal, earning $7 a day. They have two children, one of whom also works selling wood, earning about US$100 a month, while the other one is a student. Mrs. H. would like to borrow US$1,200 in order to purchase more wood to invest in her family’s business. By purchasing large amounts of wood, she can take advantage of bulk discounts which will increase their profit margins. The additional inventory will also meet growing customer demand, thereby increasing the family's income revenue.

loans.use: Purchase wood for sale

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Mrs. Tem S. N., age 25, grows vegetables on her plot of land. She sells the produce in a market, making about US$3 a day in profit. Her husband works as a horse-cart driver, transporting goods and passengers, earning around US$2 a day. They have one child who is too young to attend school. Mrs. S. N. would like to receive a loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase more seeds and expand the production of crops to meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds for crop production expansion

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chorn C. S., age 20, sells grocery products and fresh vegetables at a market, earning on average US$3 a day in revenue. Her husband is employed at a private company as a driver, making about US$2 a day. They have one child who is too young to attend school. Mrs. C. S. would like to request a loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase more grocery products for her inventory and buy a horse cart. The cart would allow her husband to generate additional income by transporting passengers when he is not working at his full-time job. The couple plans to use the additional income to re-invest in their business, raise the standard of living of their family, and save for their child’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products and a horse cart

loans.name: Mamurdjon

texts.en: M. Mamurdjon is father of three children. His wife is a housewife. He supports his family and additionally he helps his grandparents.He started his business in 1999 selling fabrics. Gradually, as he was able to expand it further, he concluded an agreement  with a workshop for sewing traditional clothing to sell at his stand. Currently his business is going well. He has shown himself to be a punctual client of Microinvest and now he is taking advantage of applying to the Kiva porgram with the purpose of receiving a loan to purchase warm traditional fabrics.

loans.use: Purchase of warm fabrics

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 48 year old father of four children. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. This is the third time Hassan is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. This time he needs $1200 USD to buy a new oven for his bakery. His wife is also helping in the business since she bakes a special kind of bread that is called 'markouk'. Hassan's bakery is visited by the inhabitants of the region who are faithful customers.

loans.use: To buy a new oven for his bakery

loans.name: Rahbaroi

texts.en: Rahbaroi has been in business for over 4 years. Her business place is located  in Istaravshan market, a district of Khujand, Tajikistan. She is mother of 5 children and they are old enough to help their mother.Often her eldest son helps to carry heavy bags from the wholesale market to her stand. Every day they  arrange her stand together and at the end of her working day, her son comes again to help her gather up her goods. At home she additionally has a milk cow and her daughters sell milk in their village. All her profit is spent for family needs. By taking part in KIva's program, she wants to increase her working capital and be able to save money for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: Purchase 4 cartons  of candles, 2 cartons of shampoo, and other household products for resale

loans.name: Sirri Margaret Chi

texts.en: Margaret C.'s family was too poor to give her any education at all, and she is determined that her eight children will not suffer the same fate. She and her husband know this will not be easy, because they do not have a regular income, but they are committed to work as hard as needed to send each of their children to school or to learn a trade. They hope to make this dream come true with a loan that will allow them to buy seeds to raise crops on their land. Once those crops are sold, they will use the profit to pay school and apprentice fees for their children.

loans.use: Buy seeds to grow cocoyam, corn and yam

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophat K. married in 1999 and has three sons. She learned to weave silk from a neighboring villager in 1987 and started her silk production in the same year. Her husband is a construction worker and is currently doing farming, raising animals, and also driving a horse cart when he has enough time. They both did not finish high school. Sophat and her husband try to work hard for a bright future for their children.

Mrs. Sophat K. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 100. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Funwi Gideon

texts.en: Some time ago, Funwi's wife left him and their three children because his income was not sufficient to meet her needs. Funwi's distress over the end of his marriage caused him to take a GHAPE course on how to go into business and then begin selling second-hand dresses. Now that he has some experience running a business, he has come to us for a loan that he will use to buy more clothing to sell, buy piglets that he can raise and sell in local markets, pay fees to educate his children and pay his rent. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan because his company is doing well, and his training has given him the skills he needs to succeed as a businessman.

loans.use: To buy young pigs to raise and second-hand dresses to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
At first glance, Grace’s shop is an odd collection of “stuff”.  Some pots here, some parts to smoking pipes in a bowl on the table, behind him on a clothes line one can see bark cloth, under his table is what appeared to be a large collection of weeds, and a rather large collection of various sized cooking pots. In the center of all this is the work table, a bench and Grace. Normally, one can discern what the business is when one walks inside, but with Grace’s business it was anybody’s guess.  When asked, he said he dealt in cultural items. Then it all made sense. Grace doesn't really deal in artifacts, his shop is more of a second hand store. And Grace uses his bench to make needed repairs to some of the items.

The bark cloth behind Grace is commonly seen in Uganda, used mostly now as canvas to paint on and to make items for tourists. But this was not its original use. Bark cloth has a long history of use for clothing and in the more remote villages it is occasionally used as such. The “weeds” under his table are herbs and Grace was proud to tell say that he uses them to cure people of illnesses, mostly stomach upset, nerves, etc.
Grace is 51 years old, has fathered 15 children with 3 wives and cares for 2 grandchildren. There’s a story in itself. Grace is requesting a loan of $600 to add cement, paint, and iron sheets to his business. These items will help him attract new customers. The world needs eclectic people like Grace.

loans.use: To purchase cement, paint and iron sheets for his business.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng D. married in 1996 and has three children, one son and two daughters. She learned to weave silk from a relative who was living in the same village in 1995. Then she started her silk production in the same year. She has never attended even primary school. Her husband also weaves silk at home. In addition, he is a construction worker, doing farming and raising animals. He did not finish grade 3 at the primary school.

Mrs. Sokheng D. has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 400. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 32 year old father of four children. He lives with his family in south Lebanon in the region of Nabatieh. Mahmoud sells and fixes car exhausts. He is very good at his job and has many customers. This is the fourth time Mahmoud is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He now needs one to buy a small van for his business. Mahmoud wants to develop his business and this transportation means will help him increase his productivity.

loans.use: To buy a small van for his business

loans.name: Ngwa Julius Ngwa

texts.en: Julius has been in the business of making pots for more than eight years, but sales are slow lately because of the high price of aluminum. This is a big problem for him and his family because he needs money to pay his children's school fees and support his elderly mother. To meet these needs, Julius has applied for a loan to buy tools that will allow him to make new types of pots that will be easier to sell. He will also use some of the money to buy more aluminum and also poultry that he will raise and sell in local markets. He believes that these steps will allow him to increase his income, support his family and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy tools, aluminum and baby fowl

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun K. married in 1985 and has four children, two sons and two daughters. She learned to weave silk from a friend in Koh Dach commune in Kandal province back when she was single. She started her silk production in 1983, two years before she got married. She finished the primary school in Prek Ampil village. Her husband is a construction worker, also doing farming and raising animals.

Mrs. Aun K. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom. Also, she will use some borrowed money so her husband can grow rice in the dry season.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, and growing rice in the dry season.

loans.name: Abdul Jalil

texts.en: Abdul Jalil lives in District 8 of Kabul Afghanistan, is married, and lives there with his extended family. Abdul has a gas shop and is very hard worker with a lot of experience in his work, so he wants to expand his business. He is requesting an individual loan to expand his stock and increase his monthly income to help his family; this makes him happy to help all of his family.

loans.use: To expand the stock in his shop

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
There’s a lot going on in this picture. In front is Regina with one of her daughters. She has a restaurant in Kyebando on the outskirts of Kampala. The banana leaves in the pot are simmering matooke, unripe bananas, which is the largest staple in the villager’s diet. To make matooke, get a big pot, put a little water in the bottom, buy a clump of green bananas still on the stem with maybe 100 bananas on the stalk. Everything gets used, so cut the stalk in slices and place in the bottom of the pot and cover with banana leaves. Now peel those green bananas and place them on top of the leaves and cover with more leaves, so that the heat doesn’t escape. Losing heat means wasting charcoal which costs money. Let it simmer for 3-4 hours, remove, mash and presto: matooke!

Behind Regina is her restaurant where the cooking is always done outside. After all that’s where the hubbub is and the cooking is done with charcoal. The restaurant is simple: benches, no tables, no cutlery, people eat with their hands. Behind Regina are a lot of people. When a reporting agent goes into the field, a crowd follows. It makes for great fun as the children always call our mazungu, meaning white person. This is a kind recognition and all smile and laugh.

Regina is 30 years old, single with three children and one dependent. She has operated her restaurant for 9 years on the busy pathway in her village. She is requesting a loan of $300, which she will use to expand her business. Regina dreams of one day building commercial houses to rent to villagers.

loans.use: To purchase matooke, rice, posho and cassava for a restaurant business

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida Kurbanova is an active client of Microinvest in the Istaravshan region, Khujand, Tajikistan. She has been in business since 2005. During these two years she has became one of the good sellers at the market and she has learned a lot about what her customers want. She often changes out her inventory and tries to have only stylish goods. Currently she is requesting a loan to use as extra capital to buy new stylish clothes for the winter season.She hopes to get a good profit from holiday trade.

loans.use: to expand her inventory to be ready for the winter season

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs.Em C. married in 1997 and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She has been in business selling fish since she took over from her mother in 1994. She is currently also selling vegetables that she buys from her neighbor in the village. She used to weave silk at home. Her husband, Mr. Phan Sophal is a fisherman. He fishes along the Mekong River around his village and gives his catch to his wife to sell in the market.

Mrs. Em C. has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 600. She will use this loan to purchase a motorbike so that it will be easier for her to transport the fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: Purchasing motorbike to transport fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 5 seats and a blow dryer

loans.name: Mohammad Dawood

texts.en: Mohammad Dawood lives in District 8 of Kabul Afghanistan with his extended family, is married, educated, and owns a copy shop. During the war in Afghanistan, he lived in Pakistan for about six years.  When he returned, he opened his photocopy shop and has been operating it ever since. He wants to enlarge his shop, therefore is requesting an individual loan which will help him increase his stock and make a better income to support his family. Helping his family would make him happy and he would also wants to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey, pictured here in our loan office in Stryi, is an enthusiastic entrepreneur from western Ukraine. He operates a business selling special filters used in the cement industry. Andrey’s father originally started the filter business and Andrey has now taken it over. Prior to that Andrey was involved in another business where he proved to be a stable business-owner. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and open his own manufacturing facility. Andrey is single and is able to use his income to help his parents.

Andrey has requested a short-term loan of $500 to purchase material used in making filters. We are happy for this opportunity to assist Andrey in operating a successful, profitable business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married with a 20-year-old daughter. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. Before Gennadyi started his taxi business, he worked at a radio factory as the head of a department. Today he works as taxi driver, providing transportation services all over Ukraine. His business is the only source of income for his family. He has been in this business for 8 years. His daily income is about $40-45.

Gennadyi doesn’t own his own vehicle. He rents a car and uses it as a taxi. He has many orders for transportation, but his car needs maintenance. That is why he is requesting a loan of $1000 to do major repairs on the car. One of his long-term plans is to buy the car he is renting at the moment. Gennadyi has promptly repaid previous loans and we are confident of his full repayment of the current loan.

loans.use: Major car repairs

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is father of 4 children. He lives in Istaravshan, Khujand. His business is located in the big wholesale market in Istaravshan.

Hamza's business is going well. He has good turnover of his goods.He has been in business for over 7 years. Currently he has many constant clients and always tries to meet all their needs. For the winter season he wants to purchase warm woman's boots, as this kind of shoes are in high demand in winter.

loans.use: Purchase of warm women's shoes for resale

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is an experienced entrepreneur from Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. For the past ten years she has been developing a successful women’s clothing and shoe sales business called “Odezhda Magazine” or Clothes Store. She has worked hard and gained many friends and loyal customers over the years. Her customers appreciate the quality service she offers. Irina is married. She and her husband Uriy have five children - three daughters and two sons. Her business is a valuable source of income as she and Uriy raise their family.

Irina has requested a loan of $1000 to help buy new inventory for her business. She’d like to purchase new kinds of clothing and attract new customers. Irina has been a great client with Nadiya Ukraine and has benefited from previous loans. We are happy to be able to continue assisting her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Horácio Silvestre

texts.pt:
Horácio Silvestre C. is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 children in the neighborhood of Ferroviário, in Maputo. He sells clothes, which he buys from South Africa, in the market of Xiquelene. He is new to the credit program and is requesting a loan of 6.000mt to be repaid in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Horácio Silvestre C. tem 31 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro Ferroviário em Maputo e tem o seu negócio no mercado de Xiquelene onde vende roupa nova. É novo no programa e vai tomar como 1º empréstimo 6.000MT pagáveis em 5 meses. Faz compras na Àfrica do Sul.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married. She and her husband live in Zaporozhye, Ukraine. Oksana works in the Yubileinyi market selling cosmetics. She started her small venture 10 years ago. Today she has about $3000 in inventory, her working capital is about $2400, and her monthly net profit is about $1200.

Oksana is very determined and focused, which helps her climb the ladder of success. In a timely and balanced manner, she addresses key elements essential to overall business success. Oksana manages to maintain optimum efficiency and keep her customers happy. She knows that one unhappy customer can multiply into many, costing her profit and lost sales. That is why she tries to serve her clients well and pay due attention to this measurable and significant factor of her trade. At this time Oksana would like to get a loan of $1200 and hopes to repay it in six months.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Ngat

texts.en:
Mrs.Ngat K. is a widow with five children, two sons and three daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor who is living in the same village. She started her silk production in 1970. However, during the Khmer Rouge regime, like other Cambodian people she moved to another province and stopped weaving silk. She began her silk production again in 1979. She also purchases silk finished products from other villagers and resells them in the market. Currently, all of her children are living under her roof. One of her daughters is assisting her to weave silk at home. One is sewing clothes. One is planting ginger in the village. Only one of her sons is studying in higher education.

Mrs. Ngat K. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of US$ 500. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and pay for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, plus paying for selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga has a small business selling dishes and kitchen supplies in Melitopol, Ukraine. Her little sales kiosk is located in the lobby of a supermarket grocery store, which helps give her business good sales exposure. Olga sells high-quality products and has few competitors in the same business. She also carries specialty dishes that are good for people who suffer from gastro-intestinal problems. Olga is married and has one son. Her family recently experienced tragedy when they had a fire in their apartment. One of Olga’s goals is to make enough money so that they can remodel their apartment.

Olga has requested a loan of $600 to increase her business inventory. Olga has been an outstanding client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. We are happy for another opportunity to assist her with her business and help her provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and a blow dryer

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana has a small sales business located at the central grocery market in Kolomiya, Ukraine, near Ivano-Frankivsk. She sells a variety of bedding supplies as well as a selection of pajamas. In business for two years, she has built up about $2400 worth of inventory and makes about $600 in profit per month. Svetlana has a good location at the center of her market. Because the market is primarily a grocery market there are no other competitors selling the same items as Svetlana, so the demand is high for her products. Svetlana is not married but plans to get married next year. Her business is her main means of supporting herself.

Svetlana has requested a loan to increase her inventory of bedding, blankets and pajamas. She has been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. We are glad for another opportunity to assist her with her business and livelihood.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Vladislav

texts.en:
Vladislav is a talented entrepreneur with a successful business selling men’s sports apparel at a busy market in Energodar, Ukraine near the city of Kamenka-Dneprovskaya. Vladislav started his business about six years ago out of a desire to earn a living and meet people’s clothing needs. He sells clothes that are both popular and affordable, which helps to ensure a strong demand for his products. Vladislav is a serious business-owner who wants his business to be the best it can be while continuing to grow and be profitable. Vladislav is married and has a seventeen-year-old son. One of his goals for the future is to remodel his apartment and improve living standards for his family.

Vladislav has requested a loan of $1000 to purchase new inventory. The change of seasons makes this a busy time of year for business-owners like Vladislav. This loan will help him keep a good supply of inventory on hand so he can meet customer demand and make a good profit.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a seller of children's clothes. She has 12 years of experince in this line of business at the market. Her business stall is located in Istaravshan's clothing market, in Khujand. Her business is developing more every month and she receives a good profit from it.

Matluba spends her loans expanding her inventory and tries to have goods of high quality. She also wants to include jeans in her assortment of goods. She saysthat jeans are always in good demand.

Matluba wants to purchase the next batch of goods for the winter season and is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1000.

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal clothing for resale

loans.name: Cristina Mapoissa

texts.pt:
A single mother or six children, Cristina B. operates a small grocery store from home, where she sells rice, sugar, sardines and other staples. She joined the program in November of 2006 and is now on her third loan cycle. Cristina plans to use the requested amount of $250 to increase her store's stock.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina B. é solteira e mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro Malanga e tem o seu negócio na sua residência. Vende diversos produtos de mercearia como arroz, açúcar, sardinhas, pasta dentífrica, cremes para pele, etc. Entrou para o programa em Novembro de 2006 e começou com um empréstimo de 3.000MT. Está no terceiro ciclo e vai tomar 6.000MT para pagar em 6 meses com vista a compra de mais produtos para a sua pequena loja.

loans.use: stock increase

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.en:
Yekaterina is married. She lives in Zaporozhye, Ukraine, and sells clothing and footwear in a local market called Yubileinyi. She has been in this trade for about ten years. Currently, Yekaterina has about $3000 in inventory, her turnover capital is about $1400, and her net profit is about $700 a month.

Yekaterina is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase her working capital and improve her income and family situation. She is hoping to repay this loan within six months. Yekaterina is a hard-working and persevering entrepreneur. She is a service-driven individual and brings a high level of accountability and professional service to every customer. She understands the challenges her business faces every day and appreciates each and every client because she realizes her venture is totally dependent on demand from happy customers.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer

loans.name: Georgina Adelina

texts.pt:
Georgina Adelina T. lives in the neighborhood of Malanga in Maputo. She is 39 years old and has 5 children. She joined the credit program in May and borrowed 6.000mt which she repaid. Georgina buys legumes and vegetables in Maputo and sells in the Tembissa in South Africa. She buys kitchenware and plastic utensils in South Africa then sells them in the Ximpamanine market, in Maputo. Georgina is requesting a loan of 8.000MT to increase her inventory. The loan will be repaid in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Georgina Adelina T. vive no bairro Malanga em Maputo. Tem 39 anos, é casada e mãe de 5 filhos. Entou para o programa em Maio do presente ano e tomou 6.000 e pagou sem problemas. O seu negócio consiste na compra de legumes em Maputo e posterior venda em Tembissa na Àfrica do Sul e de lá traz diversa loiça e utensílios plásticos para venda no mecado Xipamanine em Maputo(as fotografias retratam os dois negócios). Agora vai tomar 8.000MT em 6 meses para aumentar o stock dos dois negócios.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Yum

texts.en:
Mrs.Yum K. married in 1992 and has two sons. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in 1987 and began a business weaving silk in the same year. Her husband, Mr. Von Theara, is a construction contractor. Both of them did not finish high school. They are sending their two children to study at the high school in the local community.

Mrs. Yum K. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of US$ 600. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and buying construction materials. Yum hopes that this loan will enable her family to prosper and secure a better future for them all.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom as well as buying construction materials

loans.name: Maysar

texts.en: Maysar is an active client of Microinvest. She is in this business for over 10 years. She has big family: 4 children, husband and his parents. Her husband is a farmer but his income was not enough for family needs. Muyasar says that she loves children very much and that is why she decided to sell children's clothes. It is pleasant  for her to help to choose clothes for little clients and to see thier happy faces. Every day Muyasar goes to her  placeof business with great pleasure .Currently she has good turnover of her working capital. She wants to expand her inventory before the holiday season and wishes to make a nice profit.

loans.use: expand her inventory with seasonal goods

loans.name: Mohammad Zahar

texts.en: Mohammad Zahar lives in district 7 of Kabul Afghanistan and is married with four children: two sons and two daughters. His daughters are at University and his sons are no longer in Afghanistan so he is the only one supporting his family.  Mohammad operates a retail shop in one of the more crowded areas of Kabul. He would like to expand his business so he is requesting a loan in order to have a better range of stock to attract more clients. This loan will help him earn more income to help his family and this would make him happy.

loans.use: To purchase more comprehensive goods for his shop

loans.name: Nabuvat

texts.en: Nabuvat is mother of 4 children and, like every mother in the world, she wants that her children will not be in need of anything vital to their welfare. She works hard every day without days off. Her clothing stall is located in the centre of the market in Istaravshan, Khujand. She has good turnover of her goods.She is very polite and an honest person.She repays her loans on time without delay. She is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders with the purpose of increasing her working capital and purchasing seasonal goods.

loans.use: Purchase of warm clothes for resale

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en:
Heyderov Rauf is 45 years old and the father of 2 children. He lives with his family in Sumgayit, in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He is a cab driver. He began his business 4 years ago.

Rauf is an experienced driver, but this job is very hard. He bought a car to earn enough money for his family. He had already gathered some money for building a garage for his car. But it is not enough. So, he needs to borrow money.

Rauf would like to receive a $1200 loan in order to build a garage for his car and to buy some necessary tools and equipment. He will repay the loan within 12 months. He hopes to eventually expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To build a garage for his car and to buy necessary tools and equipment.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en: Mrs. Rosanna A. is 38 years old and married with 4 children. The family lives in Benin City. Rosanna specializes in the production of Polythene bags and needs a loan of $250 to buy more materials for the production of Polythene. This is a business she learnt for 5 months and then established her own business in 2006. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more material for the production of Polythene bags for sale

loans.name: Jug Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Jug Maiya M. is a 48 year old lady who lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the famous villages for agricultural farming. She lives in with her husband, son and daughter. Her son is studying in BBS level and her daughter is studying in grade 12.

Her husband, Mr. Govinda M., has no work. So Mrs. M. and her husband opened their grocery shop nine years ago. They sell different types of grocery goods in their shop like rice, maize, pulse, noodles, biscuits, etc. All the requirements of the family are fulfilled by the income of the shop. Mrs. M. is requesting her third loan of Rs20000 to buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Sanu

texts.en:
Mrs. Sanu T. is a 54 year old lady who lives in Sainbu Bhainshepati VDC, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her son works in a private office and her younger son helps her with her work.

Mrs. T. and her husband, Mr. Krishna Bahadur T., opened their grocery shop four years ago. They sell different types of grocery goods in their shop like rice, maize, pulse, noodles, biscuits, etc. She meets her family's expenses from her shop’s income.

So Mrs. Maharjan is requesting her first loan of Rs10000 to buy grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 40 years old and married with 3 children. The family lives in Benin City.

Dorcas' business deals in foodstuffs and other provisions. She is asking for a loan of $475 to enable her to improve her business. Dorcas learnt the business for 3 months and then opened her own 1996.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
After hearing about the widely publicized activities of the TYM, Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., thirty-nine years old, thought that taking a loan and paying it back weekly would be manegeable for her family. She discused with her family and her husband, Mr. Pham Van Tuan approved for her to go ahead. From a small start-up capital, she dared to open a litle grocery store. Being a skillful, attractive lady with nice personality, she has more and more customers coming to her store. She is anxious to expand the business and carry more merchandises. She requests for a loan of $US 450 to buy wine, beer ,candies, cookies to sell to the community in the upcoming lunar New Year (Tet).

Translated from Vietnamese by a Kiva volunteer.

Sau khi nghe tuyên truyền về hoạt động của Quỹ Tình thương, chị Nguyễn Thị Đông, 39 tuổi, nhận thấy việc vay vốn hoàn trả tuần rất phù hợp với gia đình mình. Chị đã bàn bạc với gia đình và nhận được sự ủng hộ của chồng, anh Phạm Văn Tuấn. Từ nguồn vốn ban đầu rất ít ỏi chị đã mạnh dạn mở quầy hàng để bán. Là ngưòi phụ nữ khéo léo đẹp người đẹp nết nên hàng chị ngày càng đông khách. Cửa hàng của chị làm ăn phát triển nên việc đầu tư thêm hàng hoá và sửa sang cửa hàng được chị rất chú trọng. Vòng vốn này chị Đông đề nghị vay 450USD để mua thêm hàng bia rượu bánh kẹo phục vụ bà con trong dịp Tết..

loans.use: Buy wine, confectionary for her grocery store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
In the village of Quảng Đức everyone knows Ms Nguyễn Thị Hà and her husband Lê Văn Cẩn. Both are 43, the husband and wife are butchers for the last 10 years. Everyday he buys 2-5 pigs, butchers them and sells at the market. Since they are very experienced, they know how to select pigs that are meaty, not too fat. The customers trust them and appreciate the quality of their pork. This time Ms Hà is requesting a loan of 450 USD to buy more pigs to stock up the inventory.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Ở xã Quảng Đức không ai không biết chị Nguyễn Thị Hà và anh Lê Văn Cẩn. Cùng ở độ tuổi 43, vợ chồng anh chị làm thịt lợn bán đã được 10 năm nay. Mỗi ngày anh đi mua 2 đến 5 con lợn, sau đó về làm thịt cho chị đem ra chợ bán. Làm nghề đã lâu nên chị biết chọn con lợn nào nhiều thịt ít mỡ và ngon nữa nên thịt lợn anh chị bán rất chạy và uy tín. Có nguồn trả hàng tuần tốt chị Hà đề nghị vay mức 450USD làm vốn mua thêm lợn để có nguồn dự trữ cho việc làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy pigs.

loans.name: Oyinye

texts.en:
Oyinye I. is 48 years old and married with 3 children. The family lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Oyinye has a store where she sells foodstuffs. She is asking for a loan of $400 to enable her buy more foodstuffs to sell. She has been with LAPO for 5 years and she is faithful and dedicated. She has been in her business since 1983.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Mrs. Parbati N. is a 33 year old lady who lives in Sainbu Bhainshepati VDC, Lalitpur. Sainbu Bhainshepati VDC is one of the fastest developing villages of Lalitpur. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Shanker N., works in a private office.

Mrs. N. opened her tailoring shop two years ago. She makes different types of custom-fitted ladies' dresses in her shop. She prefers to makes ladies' dresses like kurta-salwar, blouses, petticoats, ladies long dresses, and dresses for newborn babies. She received six months of training in tailoring from a local tailoring shop. Now she is asking for her first loan of Rs10000 to buy raw materials like cloth, thread, and a cutting machine for her tailoring works.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 43 year old mother of four children. She lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. Samira owns a bookstore in which you can find school books, bags and even toys. Samira needs a loan to buy enough merchandise to keep her business going. Samira is an ambitious woman who keeps on striving for the enhancement of her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her bookstore

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is a 58 year old woman who is married with 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Agnes sells foodstuffs, a business she learnt for 3 months. She has been in the business since 1988.

Agnes is requesting a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Lân is 34 years old. She lives in a poor rural village in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa. She is married and has 2 sons aged 6 & 9. Her husband is 31. She works as a mat weaver. After joining TYM fund 5 years ago, she has become familiar with the process of weekly repayment toward the loan. Now she has the confidence to borrow big amount. The revenue from the sales of her mats helps her make repayment and cover the living expenses of her family. This time she's requesting a loan of 450 USD to buy sedge for mat weaving.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lân, 34 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và hai con tại miền quê nghèo thuộc huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Chồng chị năm nay 31 tuổi và 2 đứa con trai trong độ tuổi 6 - 9 đều đang đến trường. Công việc chính của chị hiện nay là dệt chiếu. Sau 5 năm tham gia vào Quỹ TYM chị đã hoàn toàn quen với việc trả tuần và không ngại vay các mức vốn lớn. Số tiền lãi thu được không những đủ giúp chị trả tiền tuần mà còn được dùng mua sắm các vật dụng trong nhà. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị được vay mức vốn 450USD để mua thêm cói dệt chiếu.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make mat

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en: Hanaa is a 49 year old widow who lives in the region of Borj El Barajneh with her four children. Hanaa sells cosmetics and accessories in her little shop. She needs a loan to buy enough merchandise to keep her business running and to continue generating revenues. Hanaa is happy to be able to sustain her business and to continuously develop it.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali lives with his family in the region of Saida, in south Lebanon. He has four children and owns a coffee shop. Ali makes deliveries in the surrounding neighborhood. This is the 6th time Ali is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. This 42 year old man is planning to extend his shop for a more productive business.

loans.use: To extend his shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ever since she joined TYM fund, the living condition of Ms Quế's family has improved significantly. Her first loan was 125 USD and in later rounds, she was able to qualify for maximum amount. Her weekly repayment toward the loan is 6 USD. This time she's requesting 625 USD which will be used to buy material (sedge) for mat weaving. Since the selling price of a mat is high, mat weaving has become a popular profession in the region. Ms Quế is 48 years old, she thinks that she can continue to work for another 10 years.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Từ ngày tham gia Quỹ TYM đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Quế phát triển lên rõ rệt. Sau khi vay thử vòng đầu với mức 125USD, các vòng vốn tiếp theo chị đều vay mức tối đa. Mức trả hàng tuần của chị Quế lúc nào cũng trên 6USD/tuần. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 625USD để sử dụng vào mục đích mua thêm cói để dệt chiếu. Với giá chiếu như hiện nay nghề dệt chiếu là một trong những nghề phổ biến nhất tại địa phương. Ở tuổi 48, chị Quế tin rằng mình còn khả năng tiếp tục công việc 10 năm nữa.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make mat

loans.name: Debaki

texts.en:
Mrs. Debaki K.C. is a 30 year old lady who lives in with her husband, and one daughter and one son. She lives in Saimbu Bhainshepati, Lalitpur. Her daughter is studying in grade 11 and her son is in grade 10. Mrs. K.and her husband, Mr. Manar K.C., opened their bakery shop two years ago. They sell different types of bakery items in their shop such as cakes, breads, biscuits, spring rolls, cookies, etc. Both of them are working very hard in the shop to earn and establish themselves well.

Now she is requesting her first loan of Rs10000 to buy bakery items for her shop because demand is increasing.

loans.use: To buy bakery items for her shop

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Mrs. Beauty A. lives in Benin City with her husband and 3 children. She is 41 years old. Beauty sells provisions and foodstuffs. She has 2 years of experience in this business.

Beauty is requesting a loan of $325 to enable her to buy more provisions & foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị S.'s life is hard, strenuous. At the age of 48, she has to work extremely hard to raise her 3 children all by herself. Her husband passed away due to illness. After her husband's death, her family was in great financial difficulties. Since she knew how to weave mat, she applied for a loan from TYM fund. With the loan, she bought material (sedge) to weave mat. Her children helped her out after school, making 1-2 extra mats a week to pay back the loan. Today, her income from the sales of her mats is about 180 USD a month. She's requesting a loan of 375 USD to buy sedge.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cuộc sống của chị Nguyễn Thị S. chứa đầy những gian nan vất vả. 48 tuổi, một mình chị lao động vất vả nuôi ba con khôn lớn. Chồng chị không may qua đời sau một cơn bệnh nặng. Thời gian đầu sau khi chồng mất, chị S. gặp rất nhiều khó khăn về tài chính. Sẵn có nghề phụ là dệt chiếu chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn Quỹ TYM mua thêm nguyên liệu về làm. Các con chị ngoài giờ đi học đều phụ giúp mẹ dệt thêm 1, 2 chiếu lấy tiền hoàn trả hàng tuần. Với mức thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay là 180USD/tháng, chị S. đề nghị được vay mức 375USD mua thêm cói dệt chiếu.

loans.use: Buy sedge to make mat

loans.name: Jalila

texts.en: Jalila is a 39 year old woman who owns a grocery shop. Jalila is an impressive woman who developed her own business even though she suffers from a hearing impairment. She is a professionally active woman who needs a loan not only to buy enough merchandise for her grocery shop, but also to assist her father in painting his gas station.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery shop

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She sells clothing and shoes. In addition, she sells drinks such as soft drinks and beers of all brands. With her earnings, she helps her husband with the household expenses and with the education of thier children.

She's had this business for more than 8 years and has a loyal customer base who sometimes give her orders. Her main provider of shoes is found in Asunción, the capital. She's being doing business with them for more than 5 years. Some of the merchandise that she sells include: t-shirts, shorts, shirts, skirts, children's clothing and different types of shoes.

She would like a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise, because in this way, she can receive the best discounts from her providers and can increase her profit margins.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Mirna tiene 29 años está casada y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, y zapatos, además como actividad adicional, vende bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas de todas las marcas. Con todos estos ingresos ella ayuda a su marido con los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijos.

El negocio lo tiene hace más de 8 años y posee clientela fija a quienes en algunos casos le vende sobre pedido, su proveedor principal de zapatos se encuentra en la capital Asunción con quien ya opera a crédito desde hace más de 5 años. Entre las mercaderías que vende podemos citar remeras, shorts, camisas, faldas, ropa para niños, y diferentes tipos de calzados.

Ella desea un crédito con el que podrá comprar más mercaderías al por mayor, ya que de esta forma, ella obtiene mejores descuentos de sus proveedores y aumenta el margen de sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as t-shirts, pants, skirts, shirts, children's clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 35 year old mother of three children. She owns a grocery shop and grows fruits and vegetables. Fadia has two sources of income: her shop and her agriculture. Fadia first started with A. Majmoua through the group loan and then shifted to individuA. loans. The loan she needs is to purchase merchandise for the grocery shop and to start growing a green bean crop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the grocery shop

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngozi A. is 41 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Ngozi sells clothes. This is a business she started in 2006. She is in need of a loan of $400 to enable her to buy more clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Goma Thapa

texts.en:
