Mrs. Goma Thapa M. is a 64 year old lady who lives in Saimbu Bhainshepati, Lalitpur. Most of the people in this area are engaged in farming. She has four members in her family including herself. Her son works in a private office and her daughter is a teacher at a local school.

Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Kamal Bahadur M., opened their tea shop two years ago. They make and sell tea, and they also sell biscuits, cakes and other fast food. Now Mrs. M. is asking for her first loan of Rs10000 to buy some furniture for the customers.

loans.use: To buy furniture for the customers

loans.name: Trad

texts.en: Trad is a 42 year old father of four. He lives with his family in the region of Saida, in south Lebanon. Trad owns a little shop in which he sells cosmetics, accessories, and toys. He needs a loan to purchase enough merchandise to sustain his business. Trad also works as an electrician to generate enough revenues to provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa C. is 23 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells rechargeable cards to make calls. This is a business she started in 2004.

Theresa is requesting a loan of $800 so that can buy more cards to sell.

loans.use: To buy more recharge cards to sell

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva is 44 years old, she lives with her parents, has four children and is a single mother. Two of her children are grown and two are still in school.

Elva owns a small store which she opened thanks to some savings that she gathered while she worked with her father raising and selling pigs.

Today, her store generates good income, allowing her to live in her own house which she bought with the earnings generated from her store.

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as sugar, milk, canned goods, meat, fruit, vegetables, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elva tiene 44 años de edad, vive con sus padres y tiene cuatro hijos, ella es madre soltera. Dos de sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y los otros están en edad escolar aún.

Elva posee una despensa, lo abrió gracias a unos ahorros que fue juntando cuando trabajaba con su padre, ambos se dedicaban a la cría y venta de cerdos.

Actualmente, su despensa genera buenos ingresos, ellos ahora viven en una casa propia que lograron comprarla con las ganancias que generó la despensa.

Ella solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías como azúcar, leche, productos enlatados, carne, frutas, verduras, etc.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as sugar, milk, canned goods, meat, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en: Majida is a 56 years old woman living in south Lebanon, in Saida. She has one child and owns a grocery shop. This is the 7th time Majida is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. Majida is a very good client and has a solid history with A. Majmoua. Majida had recently suffered the loss of her husband and is therefore trying the best she can to continue providing for her family with the help of her son.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery shop

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience O. is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Patience sells cooking utensils including stoves, pots, dishes and cookers. She is in need loan of $800 to buy more cooking utensils to sell. She has been in business since 1996. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Sanu Thapa

texts.en:
Sanu Thapa M. is a 45 year old lady who lives in Sainbu Bhainshepati VDC. Bhainshepati is located in Lalitpur district, and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband's name is Rajendra Thapa M.. He is a farmer and works on his own land. Her daughter took the SLC exam this year, her older son is studying in grade 6, and her younger daughter is studying in grade 4.

Mrs. M. already owns two cows, and she sells cow's milk door-to-door in her locality.

Now she is asking for her fifth loan of Rs30000 to buy another young cow, because demand for milk is constantly increasing in the area, because people believe fresh cow milk is better for nutrition than dairy milk.

loans.use: To buy another young cow

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is 38 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Mercy sells many different kinds of creams. This is a business she started in 2004. She is in need of $475 so she can buy more creams to sell.

loans.use: To buy creams for sale

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José Fernandez is 23 years old and married to 22 year old Sady Fernandez. José has a mechanic shop and car wash for a little over a year and is located in a busy area of the city. Previously he worked as a mechanic in different shops in the area, where he was able to acquire the technical skill and knowledge necessary to open his own shop.

He is seeking a loan to invest in the construction of an artesian well that will provide water as the car wash uses a large quantity of water and this is a very high expense.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

José Fernandez tiene 23 años y está casado con Sady Fernandez que tiene 22 años. José tiene un taller mecánico y lavadero de autos desde hace un poco más de un año y que está ubicada en una zona de mucho movimiento de la ciudad. Anteriormente trabajaba como mecánico en diferentes talleres de la zona, de donde pudo adquirir las técnicas y conocimientos necesarios para abrir su propio taller.

El préstamo solicitado desea invertirlo en la construcción de un pozo artesiano que le proveerá de agua ya que el lavadero utiliza una gran cantidad de agua y esto representa un costo muy alto.

loans.use: To construct an artesian well

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 38 year old taxi driver. He lives in south Lebanon, in Saida, with his wife and their 4 children. This is the fifth time that Hassan has asked for a loan from A. Majmoua. He needs to register his business in order to stop renting the taxi's registration number he is using. Hassan is an honest man with a solid history with A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To buy the taxi's registration number

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael O. is 38 years, married and has two (2) children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been selling drinks and provisions since 1996.  She is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan of US$800 to enable her to buy more drinks & provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & provisions for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is 34 years old, married and has four (4) children. She has a chemist's shop where she sells drugs. She has been a LAPO member for over 5 years. She has been in business for some years now. She is requesting a loan of US$800 to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a computer and a printer

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 41 year old father of 3. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in Saida. Ali is a carpenter. This is the third time he has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua, and he is a good client who is never late with the repayments. Ali needs a loan to buy the required wood for his carpentry work. You can see him in the picture, in his work environment, with one of Al Majmoua's loan analysts.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.es:
Tranquilina is 60 years old, married, with 3 married grown children. Her husband is 63 year old Máximo Fretes, a businessman, and together they run a mini-market.

Tranquilina worked as a vendor from a very young age, and today she owns her own business where she sells all kinds of basic necessities, such as fruit, vegetables, oil, flour, rices, pop, candy, items for the home, etc.

They have had the mini-market for 3 years and it is going well, they have a solid clientele and ample stock of merchandise with good prices.

She says thanks to the loans she has been able to maintain her business well stocked and obtain the best prices by buying in large quantitites. She is asking fo ra loan to buy merchandise in large quantities, such as sugar, tea, noodles, flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tranquilina tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos todos ya mayores de edad, casados y que viven con sus respectivas parejas. Su marido es el señor Máximo Fretes de 63 años, es comerciante y juntos atienden un mini mercado que tienen.

Tranquilina trabajo desde muy joven como vendedora, hoy día ella posee su propio comercio donde vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, tales como frutas, verduras, aceite, harina, arroz, gaseosas, golosinas, artículos para el hogar, etc.

Hace ya tres años que mantienen dicho negocio y por lo que cuenta le va muy bien, tiene buena clientela formada y un surtido stock de mercaderías con muy buenos precios.

Ella dice que gracias a los créditos obtenidos ha podido mantener su negocio bien surtido y obtiene mejores precios al comprar en grandes cantidades. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías en grandes cantidades, tales como azúcar, yerba, fideo, harina, etc.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in large quantities, including sugar, tea, noodles, flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk from farmers.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther I. is a businesswoman who has a shop in which she sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She is 50 years old, the married mother of 6 children. She is a native of Benin, Edo State and has been in this business over 4 years. She has been a LAPO member over 3 years. Esther is requesting a loan of US$ 1,175. This will enable her buy provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for resale.

loans.use: To buy provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Rachid

texts.en: Rachid is a 36 year old man who lives with his wife and their child in south Lebanon, in Saida. Rachid is a very ambitious young man. He is a blacksmith, and he works on cars. This is the sixth time Ali has asked for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is now planning to buy cars in order to sell them, and will then have two different income sources. Rachid always strives to develop and enhance his business. He has enough commitment and determination to make it.

loans.use: To buy cars

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana E. is a trader. She lives in Benin City of Edo State, Nigeria. She is 48 years old, married and has four (4) children. She has been in business since 1997. She sells provision and drinks. She is requesting a loan of US$ 800 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en: Bisi O. is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has a store in the market where she sells kitchen equipment and has been in business since 1997. She needs the loan of US$800 to buy more kitchen equipment for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen equipment for sale

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 31 year old father of 2 children. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in Saida. He is a car painter but wants to have another source of income. This is why he is asking for $1000, to help him buy a small truck for transportation services. Abdallah started working with A. Majmoua to buy the required tools for his car painting business, and is now planning to expand his professionA. activity.

loans.use: To buy a small truck

loans.name: César

texts.es:
César is 39 years old, married, and has a 6 year old son. César sells electronic items such as radios, calculators, watches, flashlights, batteries, dvds, in addition to sunglasses, cell phone cases, etc.

César has been selling these items for 10 years, previously he sold his products from a little table on the sidewalk on the city center's streets. Today he has his own shop and tells us he has a very good profit margin.

He wishes to continue to grow and increase his stock, so he is asking for a loan to invest in the wholesale purchase of radios, dvd burners, telivisions, calculators, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Cesar tiene 39 años, el vive en pareja y tiene un hijo de 6 años. César se dedica a la venta de artículos electrónicos como radios, calculadoras, relojes, linternas, pilas, dvd, además de anteojos para sol, estuches para celulares, entre otros.

Cesar se dedica a esto hace ya 10 años, anteriormente vendía sus productos sobre una mesita en la vereda de las calles del centro de la ciudad, actualmente ya cuenta con su propio salón y nos cuenta que posee muy buen margen de ventas.

El desea seguir creciendo y aumentando su stock de mercaderías, para ello solicita el crédito que lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de radios, reproductores de dvd, televisores, calculadoras, etc.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of radios, dvd burners, calculators, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn B. is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has a restaurant were she cooks food. She lives in Benin City in Edo State. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a refrigerator and foodstuffs. This she said will help her serve customers better.

loans.use: To buy more food items and ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase extra crates of tomatoes and expand her stall.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy J. is 43 years old, a widow with 6 children. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She has 14 years experience in business. She is from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the loan of US$800 to buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Phythias

texts.en:
Phythias Mutinda K. is 31 years old.  He is married with one child and resides in the town of Mlolongo along the Nairobi-Mombasa Highway.  Apart from his family, Mutinda also assists his elderly father by paying school fees for his twin brothers, who are 16 years old and in secondary school.  He has also taken in his 10 year old nephew after his sister - his nephew's mother - passed away in the year 2000.

After finishing his secondary school education in the year 1994, and not being able to find employment, Mutinda decided to engage into brick making.  Since this work did not require any capital to begin, all he needed to do was learn the skills of brick making.  After learning the basic skills, Mutinda made 5,000 pieces of bricks, which he sold for Ksh 5 per piece.  He earned a total of Ksh 25,000 (USD $368).  From this, he gave his wife Ksh 5,000 for household use, and the rest he saved.  He then made another 5,000 pieces of bricks, which again he sold for Ksh 25,000.  He saved all of this, totaling savings of Ksh 45,000 (USD $662).  With this as his initial capital, Mutinda bought an assortment of goods like spoons, shoes, pencils, books, small transistor radios, shoe polish, plastic plates, sufurias, etc.  He was using a bicycle to sell his wares.

Then, in the year 1996, Mutinda rented a stall in the town of Kitengela, on the outskirts of Nairobi.  The business was doing well, but due to stiff competition from neighbors, he opted to leave Kitengela and decided to try his luck in a neighboring, upcoming town by the name of Mlolongo.  Luck was on his side and he rented a stall, expanding his business by adding TVs, DVDs, and radios.  The business is doing well and Mutinda is still operating from this stall.

Due to the increasing population in Mlolongo, Mutinda wants to add to his inventory so that he can meet the demands of his customers.  He approached one leading micro-finance bank for a loan, but due to the high interest he opted not to take the loan.  Since then, he heard about Action Now Kenya partnering with Kiva, and also saw some of the clients who have benefited from Kiva loans.  Their businesses are flourishing, so Mutinda decided to come to Action Now Kenya to try his luck.
 Mutinda, therefore, requests a loan of $1,175.  With this loan, Mutinda will be able to purchase TVs, radios, dvds, vcd players, vcd discs, and cassettes.  This will greatly improve his business, translating into more income.  Mutinda plans to employ a helper to assist him in the day-to-day operations of the business, and intends to repay the loan within 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase 6 Television sets, 5 Radios, 4 DVD/VCD Players, installation wires and bulbs.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter is 30 years old and lives with his 26 year old wife Delia Delgado in their own home. Walter repairs and sells cellular phones.

He first began as a cell phone accessory seller, then he completed a course in repairing cell phones since there wasn't anyone in the area where he lives that completed this type of service. Now he has his own locale in the center of the city.

He hopes to have a loan in order to purchase more cellular devices, as many of these devices are being sold today.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Walter tiene 30 años y vive en pareja con Delia Delgado de 26 años en una casa propia. Walter se dedica a la reparación y venta de celulares.

Empezó primeramente como vendedor de accesorios para celular, luego realizó un curso para reparación de celulares ya que en la zona donde el vive no existía nadie que realice este tipo de servicios. Actualmente ya cuenta con un local propio en el centro de la ciudad.

Desea obtener un crédito de manera a comprar más aparatos celulares, ya que la venta de estos aparatos es bastante alta.

loans.use: Purchase of different types of cell phones.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: "I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safeguar my capital to ensure continuity in business." All these are the words of Mrs. Victoria O.. She is 50 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks.  She is requesting a loan of US$400 to buy provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Omoyenmwen

texts.en: Mrs. Omoyenmwen B. is 46 years old, a widow with seven children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provision and drinks. She needs a loan of US$400 to buy more provisions and drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet E. is 45 years, married with 6 children. She sells cooked food to people living in her community. She hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. This is a business she has been in for the past 6 years and she is seeking a loan of US$ 400 to buy more ingredients for cooking of food for sale.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for cooking of food

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy I. is 37 years old, married and has 5 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She is requesting a loan of US$400 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She has 19 years experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Sadan

texts.en:
Sadan Wanjiku I. is a 28 year old, single lady with one child.  She lives on the outskirts of Nairobi in a town called Ngong.  In the years 1997-1998, she trained as a salonist in a salon called Winique Salon, situated at River road in Nairobi.  After her training, she started working as a hair dresser in the town where she lives.  In the year 2003, she took money from her savings and opened her own salon in a place called Zambia, in the centre of the town.

Because she does not have the many types of equipment that her saloon requires, Sadan is now requesting for a loan of $775.  With this money, she will buy a dryer, a blow dryer, a pair of tongs, a flat iron, a foot massager and also some chemicals for the salon.  Wanjiku says that if she has these requirements, it will make work easier for both her and her clients.  She will be able to make more money because, right now, the demand for her services is high.  She also won’t have to go to the city to buy things because she will have enough stock.  She will also attract some more customers from her  neighboring salons, which are not providing the services that she will be able to provide.  The business will also be giving her more profits, thus giving her more money to feed and educate her child.  

The repayment Period of the loan will be 8 Months.

loans.use: To purchase salon equipment including a hair drier, blow drier, tongs, flat iron, chemicals and a foot massage basin

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella E. is a 49-year-old married woman who has 7. She lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. Stella sells children's wear. This is a business she started in 2000. She is in need of $400 to enable her buy more baby things and female wear for sale.

loans.use: To buy more baby things and female wear for sale

loans.name: Bimbo

texts.en: Bimbo E.  is married with three (3) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions, cosmetics, foodstuffs and drinks. This is a business she started in 2005. She is in need of $625 to enable her buy more provisions, cosmetics, drinks and foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, cosmetics, drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen lives in a school and works as a caretaker there. She is 43 years old and is an owner of a candy stand. She also sells fish to the teachers of the high school to increase her income, since she is a widow and supports her children. The loan that she is requesting is to buy more merchandise for her candy stand and to be able to offer a better variety of products to her clients (the majority of which are the students of the school).

Because of her previous history with IMPRO (she has been a client of ours since 2002), with a qualification of 1 and a good history of payments, she has been granted this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Carmen vive dentro de una escuela y trabaja como portera; tiene 43 años de edad y es dueña de un puesto de dulces y también vende pescado a las profesoras del colegio para mejorar sus ingresos, ya que es viuda y mantiene a sus hijos. El crédito que solicita es para comprar más mercadería para su puesto de dulces y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes (la mayoría de los cuales son los alumnos de la escuela).

Por su antecedente histórico con IMPRO (ella es cliente nuestra desde el año 2002) con una calificación de 1, buen historial de pagos, Carmen puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús lives in his parent's house on Tacagua Avenue in the Tacagua neighborhood of La Paz. He sells candles, incense, buttons, etc. With this activity, he supports his children. Two years ago he was separated from his wife. The loan that he is asking for will be used to increase his inventory of merchandise in order to continue selling to his customers. He hasn't taken a loan with our institution (IMPRO) before; this will be his first. But the socioeconomic evaluation shows his capacity to pay off the debt, endorsed by his extensive experience in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Jesús vive en casa de sus padres en la av. Tacagua de la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz. La actividad que realiza es la venta de velas, sahumerios, botones etc. Con esta actividad el mantiene a sus hijos ya que hace dos años esta separado de la esposa; el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su mercadería y continuar con sus ventas a sus clientes. No tiene antecedente con nuestra Institución; este será su primer crédito, pero la evaluación socio-económica muestra su capacidad de pago de la deuda, avalada por su amplia experiencia en su actividad.

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es:
Elvis lives in his own house with his parents. His home is located in the Max. Fernandez Avenue, Llojeta zone, City of La Paz, Bolivia. He works as a mechanic and his shop is located in the Tembladerani zone. He started to work as a mechanic on his own two months ago. He used to work on the same trade as an employee but he didn't got paid. Elvis became independent to improve his income plus he is studying Electronics at the university.

The loan he is applying for will be used to buy tools for his shop and be able to accept more jobs which he can't do now due to the lack of the necessary tools for the jobs. In this way, Elvis will improve his income

He doesn't have a record with Impro but because of his desire to built a better future for him and his family and the outlook that this type of work offers him, he deserves the opportunuity to be helped by having access to a loan. Give him a chance!

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Elvis vive en casa propia con sus padres en la Av. Máx. Fernández de la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como mecánico en un taller ubicado en la zona de tembladerani; esta actividad la realiza desde hace dos meses ya que antes trabajaba como empleado pero no le pagaban. Elvis se independizo para mejorar sus ingresos además que estudia electrónica en la Universidad; el crédito que solicita es para comprar mas herramientas de trabajo y poder aceptar más trabajos que actualmente no puede realizarlos por falta de las herramientas necesarias. De esta manera, Elvis espera mejorar sus ingresos. No tiene antecedente con Impro pero por su deseo de superación y las perspectivas que ofrece el tipo de trabajo que él desempeña merecen la oportunidad de ayudarle para que pueda acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Buying tools for his mechanic shop

loans.name: Gentcho

texts.en: Gentcho R. and his wife used to work in the capital city of Sofia but after one of their children began to suffer from a disease they returned to their native village. Gentcho works on a big farm in the village but also breeds 10 sheep. His wife works as a cleaner in the village school. They want to buy 10 more sheep and request $750.

loans.use: To buy 10 more sheep

loans.name: Plamen

texts.en: Plamen B. has worked as a radio and electronic technician in a company in the town of Montana but after the company failed he registered himself as a private agricultural producer. Six years ago he started his farming business. His wife works as a seller in the village store. They have two sons that live independently. Plamen breeds 3 cows and some calves. Now he needs some fodder for the winter. The loan request is for $750.

loans.use: To buy  fodder for his animals for the winter

loans.name: Dimitar

texts.en: Dimitar M. breeds two cows and two calves. He and his wife also work in the village mayoralty. They live in their own house in the village and have about two acres of land on which they produce their own fodder to feed their animals. Now they need to buy a small machine to cultivate the land so they apply for a $ 750 loan.

loans.use: To buy a small machine to cultivate the land

loans.name: Mitko

texts.en: Mitko I. and his wife live in their own house in the village of Medkovetz near Vratza. Mitko works on a big farm in the village and also breeds two of his own cows. His wife is unemployed and takes care of their kids. Now Mitko wants to buy one more cow and needs $750.

loans.use: To buy one more cow

loans.name: Ihtiandar

texts.en: Ihtiandar D. lives in the village of Mihailovo near Vratza. He is single and works on a big village farm but also breeds a cow and wants to buy another one.  He has his own cow shed right next to his house. The loan request is for $750.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Haralampy

texts.en: Haralampy H. lives in the village of Manastirishte near Vratza. He is not married but lives together with his girlfriend and their two kids. Haralampy breeds four cows and has three acres of land on which he produces his own fodder. He has a contract with a dairy that purchases milk.  Now he needs another cow. The loan request  is for $750.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Rumen

texts.en: Rumen D. lives in the village of Butan, near Vratza. He is married. His wife works as a social worker. Rumen cultivates 22 decares of his own land. He grows wheat on it. Dimitar also breeds four horses. He needs a $ 750 loan to buy fodder for his horses.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his horses

loans.name: Metodi

texts.en: Metodi A. is single. He lives with his parents in the village of Rogozen near Vratza. He is unemployed. Metodi breeds cows as his only source of income. Now he wishes to buy a second cow and that’s why he requests a loan of $750.

loans.use: To buy a second cow

loans.name: Kapka

texts.en: Together with her husband Kapka A. has built a café and a grocery in their house. Her husband is a  construction worker. They have two kids. Now they have the idea to start a farming business and need $750 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en: Vasil B. is single. He lives in the village of Ressovo, near Vratza. He has worked as a construction worker in Spain but he has lost two fingers on his right hand in an accident. After the accident he returned to his native village.  His parents helped him by giving him nine sheep to start a farming business. He now has 15 sheep but wants to buy 5 more and to supply some fodder for the winter period. He applies for a $750 loan.

loans.use: To purchase some sheep and fodder

loans.name: Svetlan

texts.en: For several years, Svetlan B. worked in Germany to earn enough money to buy a bar in his native village. He is single and takes care of his elderly parents. The bar is going well but Svetlan still needs some money for equipment. The loan request is $750.

loans.use: To purchase equipment.

loans.name: Georgi

texts.en: Georgi A. works for the railroad company. His mother works in Greece and his father is retired. Georgi has a son that is 6 years old but he lives with his mother. Georgi breeds some chickens and rabbits in the yard of his house and needs some money for fodder. His loan request is for $750.

loans.use: To buy fodder

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en: Jordan D. is a non-contract worker at a construction company. He is married but has no kids. The only sure income for his family comes from two cows that Jordan and his wife breed in their yard. Now Jordan D. requests $750 to buy fodder.

loans.use: To buy fodder.

loans.name: Sasho

texts.en: Sasho R. works as a tractor driver in the cooperative company of the village of Rogozene near Vratza. His wife is a village official in the bureau of labor. They have four kids. Sahso also breeds sheep. He currrently has 10 sheep and wants to buy 10 more and needs $750 for their purchase.

loans.use: To buy 10 more sheep

loans.name: Estefanía

texts.es:
Estefanía is a hard-working mother of four children, who carries out her daily work in the street of her town, offering her delicious pork scratchings (chicharrones). While she dedicates her time to this worthwhile work her husband, Valentín, works in a small metal-soldering workshop and both, as a result of their dedication and much effort have been able to obtain a small amount of capital in order to renovate their humble house with the aim of improving their well-being and providing a better quality of life for their small children, who are currently studying in a modest educational centre in their hometown, Ayaviri. She intends to continue with her work, which often fills her with much satisfaction and happiness because of the good results she obtains.

To continue and expand her sales, she wishes to buy more raw materials in order to make her delicious pork scratching and is asking for a loan in order to acquire products to cook and prepare at home and at the same time to help her husband acquire new work tools. Help us to realise this wish to continue delighting the palates of her customers.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Estefanía, es una diligente madre de cuatro hijos, desempeña su labor diaria en las calles de su ciudad, ofreciendo sus deliciosos chicharrones (carne de cerdo asada). Mientras ella se dedica a esta noble labor su esposo, Valentín, trabaja en un pequeño taller de soldadura metálica y ambos a través de su dedicación y mucho empeño han podido obtener un pequeño capital para refaccionar su humilde casita con el fin de brindarles bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños niños, quienes se encuentran estudiando en un modesto centro educativo de su ciudad natal, Ayaviri. Ella tiene en mente seguir desempeñándose en este trabajo, que a menudo la llena de mucha satisfacción y alegría por los buenos resultados que va obteniendo.

Para continuar y acrecentar sus ventas desea comprar más insumos para la elaboración de sus deliciosos chicharrones y solicita un préstamo para adquirir productos para su cocción y preparación en casa y al mismo tiempo para apoyar a su esposo y adquirir herramientas de trabajo nuevas. Ayudemos a concretar este anhelo para seguir deleitando los paladares de sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and cooking products in order to continue preparing her delicious pork scratchings with the aim of helping her  husband acquire new tools for better daily employment.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 26 years old and married with one child.  She lives in Kayole - an outer district of Nairobi.  Apart from her child, Angelina also takes care of her four siblings who are orphans.  After their mother died in 2003, their father remarried and he no longer gives them any form of assistance.  

Angelina has been a shop-keeper for the last three months now.  She started the business with a capital of $88, which she received from a merry-go-round, and she also added another $44 from her own savings.  She rented a room in the Kayole area for which she paid $29 in rent, and then bought items in small quantities, such as a half bundle of maize flour, a half sack of sugar, a sack of rice, a half carton of cooking oil, and many more to sell.  This purchasing method went on for two weeks, and then Angelina started buying items in large quantities.  She also buys and sells items according to her customers’ demands.  

Previously, Angelina also had a business selling second-hand clothes, which was very seasonal, so there were times when she had no money.  Angelina decided that she couldn’t continue with this business and that is how she decided to open a general shop.  Angelina’s business ideas were inherited from her family, which is business oriented.  Her father also used to own shops and boutiques where Angelina helped in managing.  Therefore, operating businesses isn’t something new to her.  She now hopes that her business will do better with the assistance that Kiva lenders will give to her. 

Angelina requires a loan of $1,100, and the repayment period will be 8 Months.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a general shop including maize flour, sugar, rice, salt, wheat flour, etc

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
We found Fernanda happily and animatedly cleaning her small restaurant. She works daily from 4 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon with the help of her great friend and niece Benita and her dear husband Fulgencio. Thanks to the delicious dishes that they prepare, they gradually obtained a group of regular diners as customers. The greatest desire of this enterprising mother of five children, two of whom are already independent professionals, is to continue the business’ growth in order to launch her three younger children into a profession.

To realise her wishes, she is asking for a loan to invest in the renovation and repair of her small site and also to buy some kitchen utensils in order to improve the restaurant’s service. She has promised to repay the loan punctually and responsibly within a period of eight months. With the help of your collaborative spirit this enterprising mother will be able to make concrete plans in a very short time.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Encontramos a doña Fernanda, muy alegre y animosa haciendo la limpieza de su pequeño restaurante. Ella trabaja diariamente desde las 4:00 de la mañana hasta las 3:00 de la tarde con apoyo de su gran socia y sobrina Benita y su querido esposo, Fulgencio. Gracias a los deliciosos potajes que preparan fueron obteniendo paulatinamente un séquito de asiduos comensales y el deseo más próximo de esta emprendedora madre de cinco hijos, dos de ellos ya profesionales e independientes es seguir creciendo con este negocio para terminar de brindarles una profesión a sus tres hijos menores.

Para concretar sus deseos solicita un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la refacción y acondicionamiento de su pequeño local y adicionalmente comprar algunos utensilios de cocina para mejorar la atención en su restaurante, así mismo se compromete reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses y promete ser muy puntual y responsable.Con la ayuda de tu espíritu colaborador esta madre emprendedora podrá concretar sus planes en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Rennovation of small restaurant and purchase of kitchen utensils to replace those currently in use.

loans.name: Omoyemwen

texts.en: Omoyemwen E. is 37 years old, married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and has been in this business since 2006. She needs a loan of US$550 to enable her  buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks for sale

loans.name: Jessica Tania

texts.es:
Tania is an enterprising 22-year-old girl, who four years ago decided to open her bakery with the support of her beloved parents, Juana and Samuel. Currently, thanks to the variety of bread and mainly to the good treatment with which she attends to every one of her clients' requests, this business is providing her with a lot of happiness with the favorable results that she is obtaining satistying the daily need of her small community. The dream of this beautiful young woman and her charming mother is to make their bakery one of the most popular in their native town, Ayaviri. To secure their dreams, they are willing to work much more and strive to consolidate their business to make their dreams a reality. They are requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials to keep producing their delicious and incomparable breads. With the economic benefits that they obtain from the investment of capital, they will offer a better quality of life to the members of their family. Tania and her beloved mother, Juana, are already very happy for your help and contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Tania es una emprendedora muchacha de 22 años de edad, hace cuatro años decidió aperturar su panadería contando con el apoyo de sus queridos padres, Juana y Samuel. Actualmente gracias a la variedad de panes y principalmente al buen trato con la que atiende cada una de las solicitudes de sus clientes, este negocio les está otorgando alegría, con los favorables resultados que va obteniendo está satisfaciendo la necesidad diaria de su pequeña comunidad.El deseo de esta bella joven y su encantadora madre es convertir a su panadería en una de las más y solicitadas de su pueblo natal, Ayaviri. Para concretar sus anhelos están dispuestas a trabajar mucho más y a esforzarse con el fin de consolidar su negocio y para hacer realidad sus deseos, ellas solicitan un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de insumos para seguir elaborando sus deliciosos e incomparables panes y con los beneficios económicos que obtengan luego de esta inyección de capital ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a los miembros de su familia. Tania y su querida madre Juana desde ya se encuentran muy contentas por tu ayuda y colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to keep producing her delicious bread with the goal of consolidating the family business in a short time.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge is 40 years old, married to 35 year old Gladys, a teacher. They both contribute to the household income.

Jorge is a carpenter. He began working as an assistant in his uncle's shop at a young age, and his uncle taught him the trade. Jorge has been independent and and opened his own shop over 10 years ago.

As his uncle helped him, today he is also helping a nephew who works with him and is supporting his academic studies.

Jorge wishes to have a loan in order to buy an electric plane for his woodworking.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge tiene 40 años, esta casado Gladys, ella tiene 35 años y es docente. Ambos aportan con los ingresos de la casa.

Jorge es carpintero, empezó desde muy joven trabajando como ayudante en el taller de su tío, quien le enseño el oficio. Hace ya más de 10 años que Jorge logro independizarse y abrir su propio taller.

Así como su tío lo ayudo, el hoy día también está ayudando a un sobrino, que trabaja con él y al que le costea sus estudios académicos.

Jorge desea el crédito para comprar una cepilladora eléctrica.

loans.use: Purchase an electric plane for woodworking

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia U. is 26 years old; she lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells drinks and has been in this business since 2006. She is in need of US$250 to enable her buy more drinks for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience N. is 43 years old, married and has two (2) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells Weavon, hair cream and cosmetics. She has been in business since 1996. She is in need of US$550 to enable her buy more Weavon and hair cream for sale.

loans.use: To buy more Weavon and hair cream for sale

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija H. is married with two children and is now expecting a third one. She runs a shop at her home, selling different consumables, including food items. With the profits she looks after her family and can cater to the household needs. She is in need of $900 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nakivoni

texts.en: Nakivoni is a 45-year-old mother of three and a resident of the Lumo area in Dar es Salaam. She has been doing various businesses for the past ten years. She now runs a restaurant at the Ubungo bus terminal in Dar es Salaam. She is in need of $400 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca I. is 42 years old, a married mother of 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and has been in business since 1991. She has been a member of LAPO for 4 years.  She is in need of $475 to enable her buy foodstuffs, which she hopes to cook for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia, who is 55-years-old, after passing through some difficult economic times and trying her luck with many other activities, decided to start her business of selling garments and blankets, merchandise that she takes to the city of Arequipa to sell. Now, thanks to the perseverance she has put into this business, she is obtaining considerable amounts of money for the well-being of her two beloved children. She hopes to have more capital to make one last investment in her business so she can improve it and keep conquering the market with her elegant garments and blankets. To secure her plans, she is requesting a loan, and she offers you her promise to repay it in eight months. Let's help Anastacia keep prospering in this trade that is bringing her so much satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Anastacia, de 55 años de edad, después de pasar por momentos económicos muy difíciles y de tentar suerte con muchas otras actividades, decidió emprender su negocio de ventas de prendas de vestir y cobertores (frazadas), mercaderías que lleva para su comercialización a la ciudad de Arequipa. Ahora gracias al empeño y perseverancia que ha puesto en este negocio está obteniendo considerables sumas de dinero para bienestar de sus dos queridos hijos.Desea contar con más capital para realizar una última inyección de capital a su negocio a fin de consolidarlo y seguir conquistando el mercado con sus elegantes prendas y cobertores; para concretar sus planes solicita un préstamo y les extiende su compromiso de reembolsarlos en un lapso de ocho meses. Ayudemos a Anastacia a seguir prosperando con este oficio que le viene generando mucha satisfacción.

loans.use: Investment of capital to acquire a larger quantity of articles with the objective of improving her small business

loans.name: Iyobo

texts.en: Iyobo O. is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in business since 2004. She seeks a loan of $550 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is 35 years old, married, the mother of 6 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and foodstuffs. She has been in this business since 1995. She is in need of a loan of $250 to buy more foodstuffs and provisions.

loans.use: To buy provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Ladi

texts.en: Ladi Ebibo deals in the sale of clothes by hawking them from one location to another. She started this business in 2007. She is 32 years old, married, the mother of 5 children. She is in need of $550 to buy more female wrappers and clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more female wrappers and clothes for sale

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia is a hard working woman. Since she started her family with Melesio, they decided to open the doors of their small active wear sewing workshop with the small amount of money they had saved. At the beginning, this occupation did not seem to be profitable but as they carried out orders that different people and scholastic centers solicited, they began to gain popularity for the excellent work and finishing details that they gave each garment. Nowadays their small workshop has been satisfying because it is giving them the chance to generate a good income at the same time and it allows them to offer job opportunities to another three people of their community, who feel very content fulfilling their job. Antonia wishes to further implement her workshop by acquiring two sewing machines. Let’s grant the wish of this working family so they soon can consolidate their tailoring center.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

Antonia es una mujer muy luchadora, desde que formó su familia junto a Melesio, con el poco dinero ahorrado que tenían decidieron aperturar las puertas de su pequeño taller de confección de prendas deportivas; en un principio este oficio no parecía ser muy rentable pero conforme iban cumpliendo los pedidos que le extendían diversas personas y centros educativos su taller fue obteniendo una gran popularidad por los excelentes trabajos y finos acabados que le otorgaban a cada una de las prendas.Actualmente su pequeño taller les viene otorgando satisfacción porque les está otorgando la posibilidad de generar buenos ingresos económicos y al mismo tiempo les posibilita la oportunidad de ofrecer trabajo a otras tres personas de su comunidad, quienes se sienten muy contentos desempeñando su labor. El deseo de Antonia es implementar aún más su taller y para concretar este anhelo requiere adquirir dos máquinas de coser.Posibilitemos el deseo de está trabajadora familia para que pronto puedan consolidar su pequeño centro de confecciones.

loans.use: The purchase of two sewing machines to speed up meeting her clients’ demands and consolidate her small tailoring center in the near future.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria G. lives in Anticretico in the Vino Tinto Zone, north hillside of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband and a daughter. Mrs. G. is dedicated to promote, offer, and sell cosmetic products in offices. Her husband is employed with the postal service of La Paz.

The apartment where they live has shown water leaking problems in the kitchen and bathroom and it's causing damage to the home furnishings. The loan that she is asking for will be used to repair and waterproof the kitchen and bathroom so they can solve the water leaking problem at their home.

This is the first time that they ask for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis made, show that they qualify in good standing to have access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria G. vive en anticrético en la zona de Vino Tinto ladera norte de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y su hija; la señora Maria se dedica a promotora ofreciendo productos cosméticos en las oficinas y su esposo es empleado en el servicio de correos de La Paz. El departamento en el que viven presentó problemas de filtraciones de agua en la cocina y baño y están ocasionando el deterioro de sus muebles. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción e impermeabilización de la cocina y el baño para de esta manera solucionar el problema de filtraciones. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Repair and waterproofing two rooms at her dwelling.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana E. is 45 years old, the married mother of 8 children; she lives in Benin in Edo State of Nigeria. She sells provision and drinks and has been in business since 1992. She is in need of a loan of US$ 550 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness is a 46-year-old mother of five and a resident of Yombo-Vituka in Dar es Salaam. She keeps poultry at her home, a business she has been doing for the past seven years. She keeps both broilers and layers. She is in need of $725 to help her expand her stock and get ready for the Christmas season.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
In one of the most frequented markets in the city of Juliaca, we can find Mariluz enthusiastically attending to her small stand where she sells gifts. She does this from 8:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night. Thanks to the strategic location and above all the variety of merchandise that she offers, she has the possibility to obtain considerable sums of money to offer well-being to her family members. This noble young entrepreneur hopes to increase the quantity and variety of her merchandise even more since we are so close to Christmas, and her products are well-received and in high demand. She also hope to keep supporting her beloved parents with the costs of their home, and she knows that by increasing her investment, she can also increase the help that she gives them. We are appealing to your good heart to contribute to the financial growth of this noble young woman.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca, encontramos muy entusiasta a Mariluz atendiendo su pequeño puesto venta de regalos, ella desempeña esta labor desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, trabajo que gracias a la ubicación estratégica en la que se encuentra y sobre todo a la variedad de mercadería con la que cuenta le está dando la posibilidad de obtener considerables sumas de dinero para procurarles bienestar a los miembros de su familia.Está noble joven emprendedora desea aumentar mucho más la cantidad y variedad de mercadería debido a que nos encontramos próximos a celebrar la navidad y desde ya sus productos tienen gran acogida y demanda; así mismo desea seguir apoyando a sus queridos padres con los gastos de su hogar y sabe que acrecentando su inversión podrá también incrementar su ayuda.Apelamos ahora a tu buen corazón para contribuir con el crecimiento financiero de esta noble joven.

loans.use: Increase in capital to acquire a larger quantity of decorative goods to offer before and during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Moshi

texts.en:
Moshi is small entrepreneur dealing with livestock keeping. She is married to M. Maarufu who is a business man. She has five children aged 7, 11, 14, 19 and 22 years. Moshi loves her job dealing with animal keeping after five years experience. Having successfully repaid one loan, she is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator for milk storage. She is proposing to repay this loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: BUYING REFRIGERATOR

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Liliana is very hardworking and enthusiastic. Thanks to her charisma she is well known and loved in both by her family and in the workplace. Ever since she was a child she made outstandingly beautiful crafts with great creativity and patience. Today, with great effort, she has conditioned a small space in her home to install her crafts workshop in search of bettering her and her dear son’s economical situation. Her son Efraín (age 11) is her biggest joy and the reason why she works hard. Due to the location of their home, she has also decided to condition a space for snacks and hence, generate additional income. The desire of this working woman is to prosper even more until she is able to export her beautiful and elegant crafts. This is why she asks for this loan. Liliana waits anxiously your response and your support in order to continue to create her noble job.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

Liliana es muy trabajadora y entusiasta, gracias a su carisma es muy conocida y querida dentro de su entorno familiar y laboral; desde pequeña siempre destacó por realizar hermosos trabajos manuales con gran creatividad y paciencia. Ahora con mucho esfuerzo ha acondicionado un pequeño espacio en su domicilio para instalar su taller de trabajos de fabricación de trabajos manuales en busca de mejorar su situación económica y la de su querido hijo, Efraín de 11 años de edad, quién es su mayor alegría y la razón por la que trabaja arduamente. Debido a la ubicación estratégica de su domicilio también ha decidido habilitar y acondicionar un espacio para abrir un snack y así buscar generar ingresos económicos adicionales.El deseo de esta laboriosa mujer es prosperar aún más con esta hacendosa labor hasta llegar a exportar sus hermosos y elegantes trabajos y para concretar sus anhelos ella solicita un préstamo. Liliana espera ansiosa por tu respuesta y apoyo para seguir desempeñándose en su noble labor.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase raw materials, continue to work and eventually save enough to refurbish an area in her home for snacks.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a small entrepreneur who owns a shop selling different items. She is a widow and has five children. Mariam is a very hard worker and she really struggles to support her family. This is her second loan request. She is asking for a loan to buy a new refrigerator after the collapse of the old one. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: BUYING REFRIGERATOR

loans.name: Renan

texts.es:
Renan is a vigorous and noble father who is 27-years-old. Thanks to his sacrifice, he opened and began his artisan shop, work that he does with his wonderful and charming wife, Gregoria, who is 23. They work very hard together with one objective: to offer a safe and comfortable home to the light in their eyes, their small two-year-old daughter, who is their biggest joy. The wish of this young, eager couple is to expand their shop, and they need to acquire a weaving machine, a tool that will let them speed up the completion of their orders. To secure their wish, they hope to obtain a loan that will let them make the necessary investment in improving their shop with the goal of fixing up their humble house in a short time. In these moments, the young couple is appealing to your generous heart and is hoping to receive favorable responses soon.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Renan es un vigoroso y noble padre de familia de 27 años, gracias a su sacrificio aperturó e implementó su taller de artesanía, labor a la que se dedica junto a su empeñosa y encantadora esposa, Gregoria de 23 años de edad. Juntos trabajan arduamente con un sólo objetivo, ofrecerle una morada segura y cómoda a la luz de sus ojos, su pequeña niña de dos añitos, quién es su mayor alegría.El deseo de esta joven y afanosa paraje es implementar a un más su taller y requieren adquirir una máquina de tejer, herramienta que le permitirá agilizarla conclusión de sus pedidos y para concretar su anhelo desea obtener un préstamo que le permitirá realizar la inversión necesaria en beneficio de su taller a fin de refaccionar su humilde casita en corto tiempo. En estos momentos esta joven pareja apela a vuestro generoso corazón y ansía obtener pronto respuestas favorables.

loans.use: Purchase of a weaving machine to speed up the completion of articles requested by their clients

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a small entrepreneur dealing with livestock keeping. She is a widow and has three children aged 19, 23, and 26 years. She has six years experience in livestock keeping. Sarah is struggling against poverty and helping her family. After successfully repaying two loans, she is asking for a loan to buy a heater and water and food containers. She is proposing to repay the loan in12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: BUYING HEATER AND WATER AND FOOD CONTAINERS

loans.name: Anzerani

texts.en:
Anzerani is a small entrepreneur who owns a small restaurant and small shop selling clothes. She is married to Hamisi Rashid who is also working with her in the business. She has five children. She is very successful in the business and helping her family. After two wonderful loan repayments, she is asking for a loan to buy catering equipments, chairs and tables. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: Buying catering equipment, chairs and tables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy  plastic chairs, tables, and other equipment

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a small entrepreneur who owns a beauty salon. She is married to Mohamed Ngwenda who works with the Port Authority. She has five children aged 5, 8,14, 20 and 24 years. She has a dream to become one of the top hair designers. After successfully repaying two loans, she is asking for a loan to buy a new steamer and electrical stabilizer. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: Buying  new steamer and electrical stabilizer

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a small entrepreneur dealing in livestock keeping. She is married to Isaya M., who is a retired army officer. She has five children aged 7,12,13,17 and 20 years. She is a hard worker and loves her job. She paid back her first loan and she is asking for a loan to buy water containers and containers for storing eggs. She is proposing to repay the loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: Buy  water containers and containers for storing eggs

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a small entrepreneur who owns a small shop selling clothes. She is married to Ernest Martine, who works with the Tanzania police force. She has two children aged 12 and 14 years. She has five years experience in business and she loves her job. This is her second loan request. She is asking for a loan to buy new show cases and hangers for her business. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: Buy new show cases and hangers

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, a young man with great desire to better himself, is a native of the Valley of Mantaro. He has the unconditional love of his mother, who each day encourages him to continue and not settle with what he has achieved. Thanks to this advice, Javier applied to Huancavelica University and was accepted to study the career of agriculture engineering, which filled his mother and himself with pride. In order to continue to study, he is dedicated to farming. In sowing season, which coincides with mid-year vacation, he has taken advantage to sow his lands with many products. He hasn’t finished his job because on the weekends he travels to the lands that still need to be treated for future cultivation. He wishes to finish his career successfully to be able to continue to help his mother. In order for him to earn a profit from the harvest, he needs fertilizers to obtain excellent products from his hard work. Let’s support this young promise. Together we can achieve the amount he solicits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva volunteer.

Javier, es un joven con muchos deseos de superación, es natural del valle del Mantaro y cuenta con el amor incondicional de su madre, quién cada día lo alienta a seguir adelante y a no quedarse atrás ni conformarse con lo que alcanzó. Gracias a estos consejos Javier postuló a la Universidad de Huancavelica e ingreso a estudiar ingeniería agropecuaria y llenó de mucha satisfacción a su madre y por supuesto a él mismo. Y para sostener sus estudios se dedica a la actividad agrícola, en este tiempo de siembra que coincidió con las vacaciones de medio año él ha aprovechado para sembrar en sus tierras con innumerables productos y aún no culmina su labor pues los fines de semana se traslada desde muy temprano hacia las tierras que aún faltan acondicionar para su posterior cultivo.Desea terminar con éxito su carrera para continuar ayudando a su querida madre y para tener considerables ganancias en su cosecha necesita abonos a fin de obtener excelentes productos como fruto de su arduo trabajo.Apoyemos a esta joven promesa, juntos podemos lograr la acumulación de la cantidad que solicita.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to increase the quality of his products and completely satisfy the needs of his mother.

loans.name: Felix Alberto

texts.es:
Felix is a young man who runs a cyber cafe and sells cellular calling cards. He also offers local and international calling services. He has been in the business for a year and half thanks to loans, and his cafe is located in the popular local market. His motivation for starting the business was helping his mother and father with household expenses, since they are getting older and no longer work.

Felix's biggest goal is to go to college, and he hopes to earn more from his business in time. He has been a recipient of five loans, which has helped him purchase necessary equipment and accessories to provide his customers with better service and to earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El Joven Felix Alberto T. M. tiene un Cyber Café y ventas de tarjetas celulares, tambien ofrece servicios de llamadas telefónicas dentro y fuera del país. Este negocio lo puso hace un año y medio con prestamos de CEPRODEL, está ubicado en el Mercado La terminal de León. Su iniciativa de poner este negocio se basa en la necesidad de ayudar a su Madre y a su Padre a mantener la economia de su hogar, pues ellos ya estan mayores de edad y no trabajan.

Su mayor anhelo es poder estudiar en la Universidad y espera tener mejores ganancias con el tiempo. Actualmente lleva trabajando con 5 créditos y estos créditos le ha permitido tener facilidad para comprar lo necesario, com equipos y accesorios para dar un mejor servicio y obtener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase a printer, ink and calling cards, among other items, to help him keep offering his clients a quality service.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Señor Hugo is twenty-four years old; he is single and lives at home with his mother. He has a brother who is studying in the University and he pays for his studies. Hugo tells us proudly that his brother is an excellent student and that he desires to fufill his dream to see him graduated, so that he can accss better job opportunities.

Hugo is a travelling salesman of different articles. He first began as a salesman with his father when he was fifteen, but when he was eighteen his father passed away and he took charge of the business and of the family finances. He makes his sales from house to house on his motorcylce covering many kilometers daily.

He works with three young men who are his helpers. He tells us that sales are very good, and thanks to this, he can pay for the household costs and pay a salary for his helpers.

He needs a loan to purchase merchandise in bulk, because in this way he can attain very good discounts from his providers. Some of the articles that he wants are sheets, towels, pots, grills, curtains, table cloths, t-shirts, shoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Hugo tiene 24 años, es soltero y vive en casa de su madre. Tiene un hermano que está estudiando en la Universidad y a quien él le costea sus estudios. Hugo nos cuenta orgulloso que su hermano es un excelente estudiante, y que desea cumplir el sueño de verlo graduado, para que pueda acceder a mejores oportunidades laborales.

Hugo es vendedor ambulante de diferentes artículos. Empezó primeramente como vendedor con su padre a los 15 años pero cuando tenía 18 años su padre falleció y el se encargo del negocio y de la economía familiar. Realiza las ventas casa por casa en su moto recorriendo varios kilómetros diarios.

Con él trabajan tres jóvenes, que son sus ayudantes. Nos cuenta que las ventas son muy buenas y que gracias a ello, puede costear los gastos de la casa y pagar un sueldo a sus ayudantes.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías al por mayor, ya que de esta forma consigue muy buenos descuentos de sus proveedores; algunos de los artículos que desea comprar son: sabanas, toallas, cacerolas, asaderas, cortinas, ollas, cubiertos, remeras, zapatos, etc.

loans.use: Buy merchandise like sheets, towels, pots, grills, curtains, table cloths, t-shirts, shoes, etc

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás is twenty-eight years old and lives as a couple with Maria Dávalos, who is twenty-five years old, and they both own their own house already.

Tomás began to work when he was very young with his uncle as a travelling salesman. Later with some savings he bought a motorcycle and became independent. Ten years have already gone by since then and he tells others very proudly that sales are going well for him.

He makes his sales house to house, going about on his motorcycle some kilometers each day. He sells sheets, towels, t-shirts, skirts, table cloths, articles for the home, etc. His two brothers and his cousin work with him, who he pays with a commission for their sales.

He needs a loan to buy a motorcylce with a cart to carry his merchandise, so that he can carry a greater quantity and be much more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Tomás tiene 28 años de edad, vive en pareja con Maria Dávalos de 25 años de edad y ambos ya poseen casa propia.

Tomás empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su tío como vendedor ambulante, luego de juntar unos ahorros compro una moto y se independizó; ya van diez años de que ese entonces y cuenta muy orgulloso que le va muy bien con las ventas.

Realiza las ventas casa por casa, recorriendo con su moto varios kilómetros diarios. Vende sábanas, toallas, remeras, faldas, ollas, cubiertos, artículos para el hogar, etc. Con él trabajan dos de sus hermanos y un primo a quienes les paga una comisión por las ventas realizadas.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de una motocicleta con carrito para poder llevar sus mercaderías, de este modo podrá llevar mayor cantidad y mucho más cómodo.

loans.use: Buy a motorcylce with a cart

loans.name: Candida Luisa

texts.es:
Cándida sells basic grains and rice, sugar, beans, oil and corn, staples in the Nicaraguan diet. She purchases her products from wholesalers and then sells them at a local market. She has been in the business for three years, and got her startup money after saving a long time from the tiny convenience store she ran out of her home.

She started out constructing a tin sales post at The Terminal market in Leon and has since improved its conditions but needs to invest more to complete the job.

Cándida has received 10 loans. She currently lives alone and has no family. The loans have helped her business; her customers tell her that her business is well-stocked with high-quality products. Furthermore, having cash in hand has permitted her to purchase more goods and make better deals with wholesalers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Cándida vende granos básicos, productos populares de la canasta básica de los Nicaraguenses. Ella compra al Mayorista y sus ventas son al detalle. Lleva mas de tres años trabajando en esto, su capital inicial lo construyó a base de muchos ahorros que tenia sobre las ganancias que le daba una pequeña pulperia que tenia en su casa.

Inició construyendo un cuarto en el mercado La terminal en León, forrado con zinc. Actualmente ha mejorado un poco las condiciones del local, pero requiere de mas inversion para este rubro.

Ella vende Maíz, arroz, Azucar y Aceite, ha manejado aproximadamente 10 créditos. Ella actualmente no tiene familia, se mantiene sola, y con los créditos el negocio ha recibido un buen impacto ya que el cliente le dice que es una venta bien surtida con productos de calidad. Ademas, al tener el dinero en mano le permite comprar al contado y hacer mejor negociación con los proveedores.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, rice, sugar, beans, oil and corn from suppliers.

loans.name: Aparicio

texts.es:
Aparicio is 61-year-sold and is married. His wife's name is Eva, and she's 46. She helps him with their business, and they live in their own house. Aparicio sells drinks like soft drinks of different brands, beer, and juice to both small and large clients. He started this activity 17 years ago. He first sold to small clients, that is to say, people in the area. Then, with his savings, he was able to buy a truck and started to sell in large quantities to large clients like grocery stores in the neighborhood, mini markets, kiosks, etc. He needs a credit to purchase soft drinks, juice, wine, liquor, and beer, and since these products are currently on sale with significant discounts, he hopes to take advantage of the occasion.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Aparicio tiene 61 años de edad, es casado, su esposa se llama Eva y tiene 46 años y que lo ayuda en el negocio; viven en casa propia.

Aparicio vende bebidas como gaseosas de diferentes marcas, cervezas, y refrescos a clientes tanto minoristas como mayoristas. Empezó con esta actividad hace ya 17 años, primero vendía a minoristas, es decir, a gente de la zona, luego con unos ahorros que logro juntar compro una camioneta con la que empezó a vender en grandes cantidades a clientes mayoristas como despensas del barrio, mini markets, kioskos, etc.

Necesita el crédito para la compra gaseosas, jugos, vinos, licores, cervezas, ya que actualmente estos productos se encuentran en promoción y con descuentos importantes, el desea aprovechar la ocasión.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, juice, wine, liquor, beer, etc.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee is a brave woman who works hard for the good of her six children; she does so alone, playing the role of both father and mother to them after her spouse left them. After this painful incident, she decided to take up her work in land cultivation again and with greater intensity so that she could bring security and education to her large family. The strict discipline she uses with her children allows her to count on her household’s advice and support in working the fields. Aydee’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her, and they have gathered many lessons during this time that they can use when they form their own households. With their agricultural activities, she can economically sustain her family and meet their basic needs. Nevertheless, the brutal cold that lashed last year’s harvest hurt them considerably and did not allow them to earn what they had expected, despite Aydee’s diligent work during the harvest and her hope that it would be better. She needs to buy fertilizer and seeds. Your support for this loan is very important in allowing Aydee to continue educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Aydee es una mujer valiente que trabaja arduamente por el bien de sus seis hijos; trabaja sola y tiene que cumplir el rol de padre y madre para ellos, tras el abandono de su pareja. Tras este penoso incidente decidió retomar con mayor intensidad su trabajo en sus tierras de cultivo para brindarles bienestar y educación a su numerosa familia; la formación llena de disciplina que Aydee imparte en sus hijos le permite contar con el consejo y apoyo de los miembros de su hogar en las labores del campo. Toda esta actitud llena de gratitud de los hijos de Aydee la siguen motivando y han recogido durante este tiempo numerosas enseñanzas con el afán de practicarlas y difundirlas también cuando formarán su hogar.Con las actividades agrícolas que realiza puede sostener económicamente a su familia y satisfacer plenamente sus necesidades, sin embargo el implacable frío que azotó sus cosechas el año pasado la perjudicaron notablemente y no le permitió obtener las ganancias que esperaba, pese a ello seguirá trabajando con la esperanza de que durante está cosecha las cosas resulten mucho mejor.Desea comprar abono y más semillas. Tu aporte para el préstamo es muy importante para que Aydee siga educando a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds to ensure a successful harvest.

loans.name: Nimia Patricia

texts.es:
Nimia Patricia has been selling vegetables and fruits for more than 20 years. She goes out every day at dawn to purchase her fresh products from wholesalers and then sells them to customers at the local market.

She started the business with some money she had saved, but she started out selling outdoors and needed to find a way to keep her products fresh and clean.

Nimia is a single mother, and her three children are her only family. Her kids are in school, and her No. 1 priority is to keep them well-fed and make sure they have a good education. She's a recipient of five previous loans, which have helped her improve her quality of life and also helped her purchase more products and increase her sales. Her current goal is to generate more sales so she'll have more income to invest in infrastructure.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Nimia Patricia es una seño que lleva mas de 20 años en este negocio, vendiendo verduras y frutas al detalle. Ella todas las madrugadas va a comprar a los productores las frutas y verduras frescas y las vende a la clientela del mercados La Terminal en León.
